author: {'steamid': '76561198358175448', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 4652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1592514205}
review:
Tbh on first sight I thought "whose class project is that" :-) ?? Wanted to play it only until trading cards drop and that's it. Then I got into it and to my surprise got hooked. It is a great game, but not for everyone. I start with the contras:

Contras:
- Graphics and Controls feel like a timemachine; not state-of-the-art for sure, rather like it was around 2000
- Character Customization: "Hair Color" "Body Color" "Pant Color". That is it.
- Menus: Lots of clicking (however, auto-stack with E helps)
- Fights: Very simple. Stand there, click, hope your health is higher than the enemy's.
- Movement: Your char is clumsily moving, wiggles his behind when digging ^^ Also, at first he moves in snail pace. You need at least to get to level 7 (speed-boots) before that changes.

Pros:
- No time constraints whatsoever. You can relax at your base, go afk 3h, nothing happens, you won't starve or such. Be as slow or fast with progress as you like to. Plant a million sunflowers in between if you wish. It does not matter.
- In general it is a relaxing game. Explore the world, slowly, bit by bit, place portals to go further and further.
- Crafting. I liked it! It is the exact right amount between grinding for stuff/farming and getting it done, for me.
- The soundtracks when you enter a new biome are amazing!

Tipps:
- Gold coins: These are actually earned fast once you got the straw bed. Sleep for a night and low level goblins will respawn all around the base, these level 1s should drop plenty coins.
- Animals: Get a cow and chickens early to make proper food, exploring is way less painful with coffee to refill stamina and some cheese or strawberry dessert for health

Overall, if you get this for cheap, give it a try, I found it more than worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027822603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1591694261}
review:
The quest/narrative mode is pretty arbitrarily linear, with a gold coin requirement to pass into the next level, which wouldn't be much of an issue if it didn't limit the recipes and gear you had access to. So I spent just under half of my time playing the game wandering around looking for goblins that didn't spawn until I got into new areas, full of new animals to gang up on and kill me.

So it's a survival exploration game where you need to find coins (yes, useless currency in a wilderness with no stores) to unlock what you can build with all the wide wilderness at your feet.

Most mobs also run away when low on health and the ranged weapon mechnics in this game are straight up trash. It's not difficult, punishing, or interesting, it's running around in the woods looking for goblins to kill so I can build a better house while getting mauled to death by gangs of foxes, boars, and bears.

I am glad I got this game on sale but at this point I'd rather have had a sandwich.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074280284', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1630690816}
review:
While I bought this game on a sale for $0.99 and this review is after 3hrs of game play,.

The game held my attention for a bit, I had the curiosity itch of 'whats beyond my radar', I need to know but, the grind got to me, not bad mind you, I like games that grind out, this one I kind of got bored with fast. 
I'll come back to FoN again sometime soon and give a full review..

Fun little game, can't give a full review in just 3hrs of game play. but the 3hrs I did play was fun.. 
Definitely worth a buy on sale..

EDIT : tl;dr
Jumped back into FoN going on 24hrs now. So I feel I could give a more detail feedback.. 

- Right away I felt the grind of the game, I found myself being forced into a lot of crafting, as most of my time I spent (in my early levels) crafting a ton of Stam/Health Food. In order to craft such food/drink I had to venture out of my starting camp and harvest needed materials, which in turn I had to use said food/drink to stay alive to harvest enough mats to craft.. This is where I felt the grind kick in.. 

- Fighting style is pretty basic, as far as RPG's go.. Standard Melee toe 2 toe bash/slice. Then there is the Ranged fighting style, first you throw Rocks (which is a crafting Item), then upgrade to a bow much later on in levels. The Ranged Fighting is nice, pop the mobs in the head w/ a rock, or shoot them w/ an arrow, a few times as they run towards you, swap to melee and smack'um.. 
Don't expect to chase the mobs when they run away, practice your throwing/bow and you should be able to get the last hit on them as they turn n'burn.. They do run VERY fast.. 

- Building a Camp/Base is VERY slow going.. You'll need to build grass huts early on, in order to put a chest in there, which they HAVE to be in, can't place a chest outside near your make shift blacksmith area. Later on in levels you'll be able to make Barrels, which can be put outside, so you end up making a ton of them when they unlock.. Yes, more mat grinding.. 

FYI : When placing your first hut or two, make sure you want them in that position, as you can not move them once placed, you'll have to destroy all yer hard work and make a new hut. You can move a few things, and all yer blacksmith item are outdoors, so they can be moved around, just take out the tools and mats first.

- One of my biggest gripes about the game is Storage. You can only make 10-slot barrel(s)/chest(s).. I did find myself dropping a TON of mats on the ground near my crafting stations (they wont disappear, even if you log out), all while farming needed mats for storage. That took awhile, again a grind. 
Some mats do stack to 100, a few others stacked to 50 so that helps I guess.

I found the Armor a bit strange looking and I think its level 7 when you can actually make armor other than a crude cape and tarzan underwear. Once you do hit lvl-7 you cant even make a Leather top/shirt, only gloves/pants/shoes.. you still have to wear the cape, which now looks like your wearing your sisters hippy bra.. unless you make a shirt(which is more appealing) but.. gives no armor, so you end up wearing Tarzan Bra(called a cape) for the 3AC it gives.. its just off to me is all.. 

- The game as a whole is a fun/good time sink.. You'll spend all your time gathering required items for what the dev(s) call a Quest, meaning go gather X-Amount of mats, then make a certain something, then level. Rinse & Repeat.. Now, as far as I've gotten, you just pretty much chase level items to move on to the next level, aka.. Quest.. like most games..

FYI: All the pretty camps you see people have in the Screenshots/Videos.. They spent a lot of time getting there, as Everything is locked behind a level.. Which bummed me out, as I'm a base-builder kinda player, so I've got a few more GRINDING Levels to go before I can unlock the good things and make a decent base.. but I feel by the time I get to that level, the game end could be near, so I'm feeling just make the basics, grind out the next few levels and be done.. Not sure I'd want to grind for a pretty base then turn around and game be done.. FoN just doesn't make me feel like I want to stay around.. just get the levels and finish.. sad really as it had potential.

- For the price I paid on sale, a whopping $0.99c, and I think it's $0.79c now, was well worth it tbh..
It's a fun grind of a game with an odd qwerky undertone.. I'm for sure going to push on and see what the next 24hrs hold and fight to the finish..

author: {'steamid': '76561198052448408', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8998, 'last_played': 1708729629}
review:
Habe mal ca. 140 Stunden in das Spiel versenkt. - Hat sich gelohnt. War immer motiviert (und das hei√üt wirklich was). Gab zwar von den Programmierern 2 kleine Schnitzer in Level 11 und 12 wurden mir beim Warenaustausch per "Einlagern" doch glatt 2 x 10 Edelsteinsplitter weggebeamt. √Ñrgerlich - aber wenn man es wei√ü... Ansonsten muss ich ehrlich gestehen, hatte ich noch kein Crafting-Spiel wo so zuverl√§ssig, genau, genial und langzeitmotivierend war und ist.
Kann ich nur jedem der gerne was von allem hat (strategisch, rollenspielerisch, k√§mpferisch, simulationstechnisch, etc.) empfehlen!
Auch wenn man mit dem Spiel zu Ende ist - kann man weiterspielen und seine Basis versch√∂nern.
Habe aus Jux und Dollerei ein richtiges Fort gebaut mit doppelten Palisaden usw. - war zum Schluss richtig sch√∂n.
Habe alle Errungenschaften erspielt - bis auf den Hardcore-Modus - habe ich probiert, bin dann in Level 6 draufgegangen, da ich von allen Seiten angegriffen worden bin - war ein satter Hinterhalt.
Tut der Sache aber keinen Abbruch - hat trotzdem Spa√ü gemacht.
Kleiner Wermutstropfen war die √úbersichtskarte - die h√§tte man deutlich besser gestalten k√∂nnen - aber auf Sch√∂nheit kommts bei der nicht wirklich an...
Alles in Allem - sehr empfehlenswert f√ºr Fans von solchen Spielen.
Gro√ües Lob an alle Mitwirkenden!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055490590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 196, 'last_played': 1560678938}
review:
This game has potential, definitely, but it has been altogether abandoned. The game is incomplete and the mechanics are borked at best. The premise of the game is pretty standard to any survival game, build a house, and run deeper into the environment. However the game feels incredibly unrewarding. The level system is an embodyment of pay to win, requiring you to provide items and gold to level, rather than using an all too familiar EXP system, but it is also tied to all players in the game. So if one person initiates a level, everyone else gets it too. Which personally I do not like. That's not the only thing tied together in this game either. DEATH, is tied to everyone. Everybody gets a bomb strapped to their wrist, and if any one persons heart stops beating. That is it. End of the line for everyone else involved. So EVERYBODY loses whatever, depending on difficulty. The UI is very clunky and confusing at the beginning, making it kind of hard to learn how to do things, so if you are not particularly familiar with the survival genre, this is NOT where you want to start. The combat is a bit fruitless as well, many of the enemies you fight at the beginning already overpower you easily, and if you get lucky enough to get the edge on one of them, they run away when their health gets low, and they outrun you easily. Which is a whole other problem if you need to run. Lastly, once again, most critical, despite being incomplete and borky the developer has already abandoned this game to work on the 'second' game. Which looks a lot better, but what it really is,  is the 1.0 of this game. Don't waste your money on this, if his 'sequal' actually gets completed I would just wait for that. 

2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198087918877', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1590092095}
review:
Firstly hie to all the players out there who bought this game and are playing!! I bought this game for $1 and I truly think its worth the price. I have played it for 10 hour now and i am on level 6 at the moment. The crafting system is quite nice, I must say. There is a lo o this game for just a dollar honestly. I like survival and crafting and management sort of games although I do play a vast genre of games. But there are some things that could make this game even better. I wonder if there is a way to move a little more faster or sprint I mean, and the fact that I cant delete the unused/unwanted items heightens my OCD. Also the way the levelling up system is could be made more better because at times i feel stuck just because I cant craft that item needed to level up....

Pros: 
Many Biomes
In-Depth Crafting 
Big/Huge Procedural Map
Needs a very minimal configuration to run
Variety of animals(some can be tamed)
Monsters can be tamed

Cons:
To Slow - Need a way to sprint
No way to delete unwanted items once you get upgraded items
Grindy
Slow paced Combat

author: {'steamid': '76561198074861156', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 867, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 867, 'last_played': 1589616572}
review:
Pros:
I'm one of those people who love running around my camp making things because it gives me the illusion of being the productive and efficient human being that my real-life self is not. I am usually okay with waiting for crops to grow and waiting for animals to produce things while I methodically murder trees with a tool I slapped together with things I found on the beach.
I like the variety of audio options in the settings! Sometimes you want to hear one thing and not another. It's not comprehensive, but man was I happy to find that I didn't have to listen to my portal buzz 24/7 after placing it next to my house and learning I couldn't move it.
Items stay on the ground if you leave them there. Storage is optional. I can live as the filthy slob that I've always known I was, surrounded by piles of sticks and glowing embers. (Do you smell something burning..?)

Cons:
Combat is terrible, and yet is a key part of the game. Everything is faster than you, so neither chasing nearly dead things nor running away from stronger things work. They also tend to attack faster than you (except for goblins) and there's nothing you can do about it. The only way to survive a party of moose and rock people is to consume copious amounts of healing products beforehand so that their healing cool downs are stacked all up on top of one another, using up foods that took quite a long time to put together because of the cooking table's massive crafting times, and if you die anything you worked hard to collect could just vanish into the void of death, throwing all those wait times down the drain.
Navigating the landscape is just a bit awful. I can never tell if the land is too steep for my jelly-legged man to scale, and can never tell if trees are far enough apart for me to squeeze thick thighs through, not to mention the times when I turn around and my goblin compatriot or kidnapped animal companion is stuck nose-deep in the underbrush. (My chickens keep getting stuck inside bushes, which I then have to destroy, which takes time and stamina.)
Leveling up is an item sink. This doesn't even make any sense. Who are we giving these things to? Are we absorbing them into our flesh? Plus the level up isn't even satisfying because it just means the start of another section of waiting around waiting for things to be made while you go get slapped about by newer, meaner local wildlife.

I was genuinely enjoying the game up until I realized that an objective was surrounded by things that could turn me into paste and there was no reasonable way for me to make something to be stronger than them or kill them faster than they could kill me. A man made of rocks totally caved my skull in despite the fact that I was cramming delicious strawberry confections into my esophagus like Joey Chestnut inhales hot dogs.

Some improvements I'd love to see are some balancing of the combat mechanics and perhaps some tweaks in the crafting timers, particularly since the number of crafting stations is limited. I'd rather that crafting be a resource sink than a time sink. Why would I sit around chopping trees I don't need in a game I'm hardly playing (because all I'm doing is killing time!) when I could go, I don't know, play Solitaire in my computer's Start menu? Remember to keep your game engaging and you'll have people playing a lot because it's fun, not because they have to wait for their pants to come out of the oven.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277467801', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 7965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2588, 'last_played': 1591575207}
review:
Now, I can't say this is the most polished game in the world, but I can say I find it worth a play. If you really want to do stuff in the game, you might end up like me with 43 hrs of gameplay and not having finished 2/7s of it. 
What can I say, I like taking my time with survivals, but the fact I am still playing also shows I find this game to have something. It has some hidden narrative and misteriousness to it. 
Would I spend ¬£15 on it? No. Do I remember its price and what I paid including discounts? No.
All this aside, if I'd lose all the progress in my current game, I probably wouldn't re-install it, but as I have it now, I would definitely try to finish this off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064833959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 23686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9811, 'last_played': 1621851061}
review:
A fun sandbox game. There is a lot of grinding and you need to be on your toes when you go out in the world.

Setting up your little enclave takes time if you want it "just so". Once you figure out the multi-player function you can invite friends to see you home, or help you out with a quest, which I have found very helpful

author: {'steamid': '76561198799257464', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 316, 'last_played': 1588210183}
review:
Learning the controls was a bit of a challenge, and could use some tweaking,  but over all fun with others. Was surprised to see that there's a little lore/mystery to solve as I thought the whole point was just to survive. The goblins are ugly af lol. There a nice challenge in creatures that attack you suddenly tucking tail and running for the hills when you get the upper hand. Would def like a little improvement on interface and wish that I didn't need to click a button x amount of times to clear my screen. Will update once further along in the game about that.

I do like the graphics; an interesting mix of a little bit crude and pretty. It doesn't make any sense, I know, but  It is pleasant. There's no music but I do like the nature sounds that play through.

author: {'steamid': '76561198833319504', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1588210181}
review: WOW! I mean, she started out a little slow, and I was slow to get used to the controls, but BOY did she pick up! My sister and I LOVE survival/open world/ crafting games and at first glance, this didn't seem like it would be it. In due time, it began to open and up and we sat and played for over 5 hours straight. * I would have, however, liked the option of being a female character, and some water interactions. The fishing rod didn't seem to work for getting actual fish? You have to get it from creatures you kill? Overall... looking forward to playing more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033623422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 11950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8733, 'last_played': 1665519268}
review:
An extremely underrated game, especially if you can get it at a steep discount.

Not for everyone but If you enjoy goal-oriented crafting and resource gathering then you will like this game.

Can be grindy at times, but that is part of the appeal, like in factorio, etc

Some of the environments are really pretty.

Note: it did crash for me fairly often during loading and once or twice during play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049222066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4240, 'last_played': 1587307960}
review:
Simple and straightforward - a pleasant distraction.  No story, the leveling is weird (there need to be more levels with quests and tech unlocks more spread out to encourage more exploration and building), the crafting time/resources/unlock-level balance is really asymmetrical and unpredictable, and there is, in the final analysis, not actually that much content.

On the other hand it's relaxing, you can pace things however you want - even the campaign feels fairly sandboxy (which to be fair is as-advertised) - it's beautiful, and you're not bogged down by tech trees or resource chains so complicated you'd need an army of wiki-writers to disentangle it.

I'm not sure if this is a plus or a minus but I'd spend hours playing and feel, at the end, like I'd accomplished very little.  For ME that was a draw - it sucked me in and I always felt like there was more to do with clear, simple goals - but I can definitely understand how it might make other with more rapid/actiony play styles want to punch their screens in frustration.

review: I've had this game on my wishlist for awhile before I saw it for 80 cents and decided to try it out. I'm now 46 hours in and I'm still playing and having fun with it. It is a bit of a grind which I'm okay with. I don't know what the cap level is but right now, I'm level 9. If you like survival/building games, this is a must have imo. I've only had one issue and I left my pause on too long so the game froze. Other than that, I've had no issues besides the foxes running away :P (I know they're supposed to lol).

review:
Pro:
The game is pretty enjoyable, especially considering the price, and the level system provides good incentive. 

Con:
Survival in the open world can be slightly difficult due to the quantity of enemies: literally everywhere you turn there is either a goblin, bear, fox, warthog, or a predatory something-or-another.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026697386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1180, 'last_played': 1587245913}
review:
Honestly, I was really excited about this game when I saw it, but I've had to work really hard to give this game a fighting chance. That said, after playing for 16 hours and giving it a real go, I cannot recommend unless you get the under $1 deal that I got on it and have a lot of patience.

The GAME ENGINE seems like it's pretty old, which is normally fine with me since I come from the heroes of might and magic era, but the UI is clunky and requires a lot of extra clicking, the movement so slow. QUESTS are okay, but once you hit about level 6 the game jumps in difficulty and some of them are poorly timed (it wants me to go into a zone with level 10 mobs in order to level up at level 6 or 7). Honestly FIGHTING is pretty hard / really easy to get 2-3 mobs and get rolled... and when I tried CO-OP, my friend died when I died, even though he was at the home base building stuff and nowhere near a mob. I also don't like that it's not practical to try to create a new safe zone anywhere else in the world, and that maintaining your own safe zone requires you to be really careful to open only one really narrow and safe path from where you land initially. STRUCTURES break easily, and they will aggro any nearby monsters that spawn whether you're there at the time or not. There's no way to restore a tree or bush blocking the path once you chop it down, and they don't grow back once cut down, so you have to think about pathing to monsters UPON STARTING in-game or risk them wandering in. It does give you starting materials to collect all within the safe zone, though, which will get you to about level 3 or so, so that's a place where the game is smart. CHARACTER CUSTOMIZATION adjustment is very simple (and hidden in the pause/settings menu), but at least present. You can't play a female, but you can customize the skin color (skin colors only, no fun colors like elvish purple), hair color (most colors), and shorts (most colors). 

I will say that I did enjoy TAMING farm animals, and building a pen for them that existing animals can't escape from while trying to place a new animal (because they will otherwise wander all around camp and sometimes scare you into thinking they're going to wander right into a mob eventually). A pen also makes it easier when farming things like wool, so you don't have to wander all over the place looking for each animal in camp. I also like that not feeding the animals doesn't cause them to run away, and I also like that I can't kill them by accident while tamed (I've accidentally taken a few swings at some while fighting).

WISH LIST: 
* I would like to play this game purely in creative mode with no monsters (only animals) and without requiring materials to be collected, which takes FOREVER. I have had some fun with not-so-great games in the past with that and it's really disappointing to go into creative mode and find out that you still have to collect all the materials by hand and probably fight mobs, etc. My idea of creative mode is like Raft, where they just let you build with unlimited mats.
* I'd also like to be able to move major structures like huts around and not have to build inside or outside of structures depending on what you're building.
* In regular mode, maybe double the run-speed and stamina bar. You run out way too quickly and nobody wants to wait 1 full minute or two for the food to work to replenish health, and then another minute or two for stamina because you can't eat stamina and health food at the same time unless you have special food items that do both (equally slowly, if not more slowly because two-for).

author: {'steamid': '76561198083820976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1588959007}
review:
If you like a slow-paced grind and clunky, no-effort combat systems, this is a perfect game for you!

You will spend 1/10th of your time exploring the map, and the rest of that 9/10ths jumping from work station to station, slowly grinding out tedious tasks like using a shovel to pick up piles of sand, waiting on slow timers for crafting and resource capping, and being unable to add different varieties of items to a crafting queue at once.  Each new area zone takes about 30-45 minutes to explore for the next objective, involving unwanted combat, annoying manual path-making via ax, and slow stamina recharge- over and over, so you can make it to the same type of linear goal per new area.  It also requires you to make new clothing every time you enter a new area, and doesn't want you reusing or re-purposing any previously made sets of clothes, which take hours of work to make in the early game!  So anytime you reach a new zone, you will not get to explore it for a few hours yet, because suddenly there is more hours of crafting to do.

To level up, you are required to craft all items from a preset list, and after doing all of those tasks, you need to collect a large amount of certain materials, which it will then eat upon turn-in, thus transforming your level ups into a frustrating resource sink.

So many missed opportunities here.  There is a weather system that gives you relaxing rainy days.  For some reason, however, it does literally nothing for your game experience.  Why not have it auto-water your crops?  Get rid of the need to feed water to your animals during rain?  Make your wells fill faster?  All kinds of creative rewards they could have offered to us and the game has none of this kind of exciting immersive variety.  Why not have potions that temporarily increase ax or pickaxe efficiency?  Why not make enemy or animal lures that can increase the spawn rate of certain things?  Give us more!!

I think if there was a bit more effort put into the little things, I wouldn't be as annoyed with it.  Small user-friendly features like a run button for greater travel speed, the ability to rotate your camera view while in a build prompt, the ability to move ALL of your constructions once built, etc, would have improved this experience for me.  As it is, it feels like a disorganized student project instead of a good quality game.  Also, majority of work stations will be required to be built indoors for some reason, however the huts you are allowed to build early on are not only tiny, but limited in number for how many you are able to make per level.   It forces you outside of a more sandbox experience into a very linear crafting path.  Pretty much the only sandbox feature of the game is getting to decide where to put your stations....that's it.  This is NOT a sandbox experience.

I could easily forgive the strange bitmap-looking MS Paint map and the early 2000's aesthetics if there was just more love put into this game overall.  I think it was worth the $0.79 USD I spent on it, at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025216864', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1586982690}
review:
This game could be good with just a little more thought. Leveling is tied to quests not xp, but you can easily be blocked from completing a quest because you lack a crafting recipe that is locked to a level achievement.

Your character walks at a much slower pace than everything else in the game, which often runs from you once they're at low life. You spend the game chasing creatures you can't catch only to be ambushed my hordes of creatures you can't escape. Even after completing the quests needed to level up, you still require yet more resources to level up, sending you back out into a land filled with creatures you can't catch and hordes of monsters you can neither kill nor escape.

The game play IS fun, but there's too many game-breaking, or rather fun-breaking, frustrations to make playing it worth your time. I really wanted to like this game. It needs more work.

I bought it for under a $1, so if you can get it at that price and want to spend a night being frustrated, then go ahead and pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198979083790', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1591289662}
review:
I bought this game for a very cheap discounted price, after my friend told me about this game. He said that if i love Stardew Valley, then i should give this game a try, specially with the discount price. 
Well, why not ? So i bought this gem ! Yes, you heard me. A GEM !
Imagine Stardew Valley, but in a hard core way LOL. Sure there are lots of gathering and takes time alot, but its rewarding after you figure it out how to play this game effectively.
The battle  system is fantastic. One must think at first that the movement is clunky and laggy. But once you mastered it, it will give you more and more adrenaline rush LOL.
I would recommend to play the quest chapter first and finish it. I must admit, first it was very frustrating to finish the chapter one by one, but actually it's the way of the developer to train players how to master this game in the creative mode later  hahaha no i'm serious !
Last, BUY this game. It's beautiful, well made, and very cheap, less than a dollar ! 
I'm really looking forward for the next development of this game, and the full release of multiplayer mode.
Keep up the GOOD WORK !

author: {'steamid': '76561198033420529', 'num_games_owned': 499, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 899, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 512, 'last_played': 1586830147}
review: i dont usually write reviews but me and my buddies picked this game up for .80 cents a piece its doesnt say it on steam but it supports online multiplayer for up to 4 people at once, this game is deff a hidden gem i would of been willing to pay up to $10 for. sure the graphics arent triple AAA but again 80 cents. the crafting is actually pretty in depth and i enjoy the leveling system as well having to work on certain quests and gather certain items to not only level up yourself but your friends as well it gives the game a sense of purpose, the world is pretty big from what we can tell with diff biomes and having to meet certain conditions such as fur gear to withstand the cold area.there is fishing and farming/livstock , and even some building. combat can be a little lacking sometimes with just clicking the same button over to smack the enemy before he smacks u down. but overall id give this game a 8/10 and well worth the price if your looking for a quick time sink between game releases or something like we are.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983999218', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1587186526}
review: I got this game for 79 Cents. It would definitely worth 7.99 if not 10$ for me since I like survival/resource management and building games so I kindof feel bad for waiting for a sale to get it now. The combat could be less clunky, textures could be higher res, and I don't know how much its being updated, but it seems pretty fun for a small game.  Its a grind like rust so having two people is helpful, I like how intricate some thins are, and the base building aspect works well enough. Could use a little bit of polish, but at its core a pretty cool game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340205808', 'num_games_owned': 229, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1586375964}
review:
En l'√©tat actuel, je ne recommande pas ce jeu. Je l'ai pris √† 79cts car en promo, mais m√™me √† ce prix l√† je regrette.

Ayant vu les images du jeu, je ne m'attendais pas √† quelque chose d'extraordinaire, mais j'ai jou√© √† beaucoup de jeux gratuits et j'arrive toujours √† y trouver du fun m√™me s'ils ne sont pas 100% opti, graphiquement moyens, avec des gameplays simplistes...
Mais Force of Nature je n'ai pas pu aller plus loin que 3/4h environ tant j'ai trouv√© le jeu impraticable !
Rien ne va en ce qui concerne l'interface et les contr√¥les, voil√† une partie des d√©fauts que j'ai pu noter :
- Il y a au total 4 touches pour utiliser/interagir. M√™me si la plupart des jeux peuvent se contenter d'une touche pour les 2, en avoir simplement 2 aurait √©t√© plus simple. Ici on a 1 touche pour interagir, 1 touche pour utiliser, 1 touche pour r√©colter, et 1 touche pour ramasser (alors que r√©colter et ramasser sont strictement la m√™me chose au bout du compte). Et comme dans ce jeu on passe beaucoup de temps √† farmer, et bien on doit avoir les doigts en permanence sur ces 4 touches √† la fois, en plus des touches habituelles de d√©placement.
- Je n'en suis pas arriv√©e au stade d'avoir des structures avanc√©es, mais rien que pour utiliser le feu, il faut appuyer sur espace et ensuite cliquer sur "feu de camp" alors qu'on pourrait y acc√©der d'une simple touche
- Les niveaux sont pass√©s... manuellement ! C'est bien la premi√®re fois que je vois √ßa, et je dois dire que je n'en saisis pas du tout l'int√©r√™t.
- Je n'ai pas trouv√© comment se nourrir directement depuis l'inventaire, je ne crois m√™me pas que ce soit possible, on est donc oblig√©s de placer les aliments dans la barre d'acc√®s rapide, manger puis les ranger dans l'inventaire...
- D√®s qu'un menu est ouvert, on ne peut plus orienter la cam√©ra, donc on ne peut plus se d√©placer correctement tout en ayant les qu√™tes ou l'inventaire d'ouverts sur les c√¥t√©s (mais bon √ßa c'est un des moindres d√©fauts).

En gros, tout plein de petits d√©fauts qui, mis les uns √† c√¥t√© des autres, rendent le jeu tr√®s p√©nible √† jouer. En revanche, si les d√©veloppeurs corrigent toutes ces petites choses, je serais ravie de voir ce que le jeu a √† offrir !

author: {'steamid': '76561198010259946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1586444356}
review: The game has a lot of content, yet somehow makes it feel like you've got no purpose in the game. The only real thing to do is the quest missions to level up, and they feel extremely grindy. I reached level 6 and had to do a quest to get loot from monsters, but here's the problem: It doesn't seem like monsters respawn (sleeping supposedly respawns mobs, but it doesn't work), and there's only 1 type of monster that drops what I needed. I spent an hour trying to get the loot to no avail. It's just not fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984466718', 'num_games_owned': 2449, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 1852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1586705482}
review:
Engancha porque vas desarrollando cosas nuevas para craftear, tienes que farmear de vez en cuando...
Lo que menos me gusta es la distancia de visi√≥n, es muy corta porque a pocos metros todo lo que se ve es niebla (a poca distancia del personaje) lo que no te permite ver muy lejos lo que hay.
El comportamiento de la IA en los enemigos (especialmente en animales agresivos) tampoco me ha gustado, mucho menos que el punto anterior. Es decir, atacas a los animales porque normalmente se acercan ellos a atacar agresivamente, y casi cuando les has quitado toda la barra de vida, se largan. Y no un poco y luego vuelven a seguir atac√°ndote, NO. Se largan todo lo que el mapa les permite si no tienen obst√°culos de por medio, y cuando vuelves a por √©l ves que se le ha regenerado toda la salud pero a ti te ha quitado bastante barra de vida sin servir para nada porque no has podido derrotarlo y lootearlo. Vamos que ese algoritmo que tienen en el comportamiento cabrea bastante cuando ya casi est√°n muertos. A no ser que est√©n contra las cuerdas en un espacio medio cerrado, va a costar mucho acabar matarlos.
Supongo que hacer esto con el arco ser√° una tarea m√°s sencilla, porque estoy en el nivel 5 y a√∫n no he llegado para poder craftearlo.
Por lo dem√°s en general entretenido y el contenido que veo es bueno. Espero encontrarme pronto con nueva variedad de animales y enemigos (no solo goblins), as√≠ como biomas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992424212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1586349901}
review: I love survival games. Love em. I've been intrigued by Force of Nature since I first put it on my wishlist years ago. Saw it available for less than a buck and said hey, you can't beat that! After about an hour and a half, I decided to return it. The game has pretty decent potential, but there were some serious cons from the get go. The UI is clunky and strange. Combat is clunky AND boring. The crafting system seems to have some potential, but is incredibly grindy, and I hear there aren't that many different options for buildings. Most importantly, I did not have fun. All in all, these were enough for me to request a refund. There are too many great games in this genre, and life is just too short to choose one this lackluster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165093463', 'num_games_owned': 694, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 312, 'last_played': 1582409735}
review:
Jogo divertido, meio gen√©rico visualmente mas com bastante conte√∫do e coisa para se fazer, apesar de n√£o transparecer logo de inicio, ele deve render a pessoas que gostam desse g√™nero bastante horas de gameplay.
Uma coisa que acabou me irritando um pouco √© o fato de cada vez mais demorar para craftar itens, conforme voc√™ vai progredindo no jogo, a cada item que fica mais complexo de se fazer e mais demorado de "fabricar". O craft do jogo te obriga a fazer muitas tarefas repetitivas, de coleta que por muitas vezes demoram muito tempo e acabam fazendo com que voc√™ fique meio desanimado.

Acredito que a melhor forma de aproveitar o jogo deva ser jogando com mais algu√©m...pela quantidade de itens necess√°rios para cada craft. E ainda sim acabar√° tomando bastante tempo de todo mundo com tarefas simples, como farmar areia ou terra no mapa.

review:
Im Grunde ein sehr interessantes Spiel mit Quests die zum Aufbau erforderlich sind ( Aufbauspiel ). Dazu gibt es Gegner wie wilde Tiere ( B√§r, Fuchs, Wildschwein ) aber auch Goblins und andere gr√∂√üere Gegner. fast die ganze Welt ist nutzbar wie Gestein, Erze, B√§ume und B√ºsche, Pflanzen und Nutztiere. Das Spiel ist auch f√ºr sch√§chere PC,s gut spielbar. Nachteilig ist ein gew√∂hnungsbed√ºftiges Kampfsystem, Steuerung aber auch Grafik. Dennoch sind die guten Spielinhalte im Gegensatz zur Grafik und Steuerung √ºberwiegend. 
+ viele Spielinhalte
+ open world mit viel einsetzbaren Gegenst√§nden etc.

review:
Kƒ±yƒ± da k√∂≈üede kalmƒ±≈ü, kendi t√ºr√º i√ßin de ba≈üarƒ±lƒ± olan ama sesini √ßok duyuramamƒ±≈ü, ''ben de buradayƒ±m, beni de oynasanƒ±z ya! '' diye haykƒ±ran oyunlarƒ± incelemeyi seviyorum √ß√ºnk√º oynadƒ±ƒüƒ±m zaman keyif aldƒ±ƒüƒ±m da hakkƒ±nƒ± √∂demem i√ßin bir ≈üeyler yapmam gerekli gibi d√º≈ü√ºn√ºyorum, borcumu da anca birka√ß satƒ±r d√º≈üerek  √∂deyebiliyorum. Buna mecbur hissediyorum √ß√ºnk√º bunu hak ediyor  fazlasƒ±yla kendisi.Peki,  nedir bu bana inceleme yazmam i√ßin vicdan yaptƒ±ran, isminin hakkƒ±nƒ± doya doya yansƒ±tan oyunumuz Force of Nature ? 

√ñncelikle Oyunumuz; hayatta kalma tarzƒ± √ºzerine kurulu bir oyun. Oyun da √ßok sayƒ± da loot ve craft yapmaya imkan tanƒ±yan bir i≈üleyi≈ü s√∂z konusu. Hem ke≈üif yaparak g√∂√ßebe bir d√ºzen hem de yerle≈üik hayatla kendi yapƒ±larƒ±nƒ±zƒ±, yakalayƒ±p evcille≈ütirdiƒüimiz hayvanlarƒ±mƒ±zƒ± beslediƒüimiz bir d√ºzen var. Oyunda ki en b√ºy√ºk g√ºzellik ve oynanƒ±≈üa doƒürudan etki yapmƒ±≈ü √∂zellik ise; iklimlerin olmasƒ± yani  her b√∂lgenin farklƒ± bir iklim yapƒ±sƒ± var; eƒüer √ß√∂le giderseniz √ß√∂l kƒ±yafeti, eƒüer soƒüuk bir yere giderseniz kƒ±≈ülƒ±k kƒ±yafet yapmak durumdasƒ±nƒ±z bunu da yakaladƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ±z hayvanlardan ve gezdiƒüimiz yerlerdeki canavarlardan elde ettiƒüimiz malzemeler ile saƒülƒ±yoruz. Bu durum da oyuna s√ºrekli bir ilerleyi≈ü ve ke≈üif yapmak i√ßin ama√ß saƒülƒ±yor. Oyun bu baƒülam da duraƒüan bir oyun deƒüil ama s√∂ylemem gerekir ki tek ba≈üƒ±na oynamak biraz uzun ve yorucu s√ºrebilir √ß√ºnk√º asƒ±l anlamda bu d√ºnyanƒ±n i√ßine belli bir level aldƒ±ktan sonra girmi≈ü bulunuyoruz. Bu durumdan keyif alacak ki≈üiler de olabilir ama tavsiyem bir arkada≈üƒ±nƒ±z ile birlikte oynamanƒ±z. 

Eƒüer ''Lan'' √ºzerinden oynayabileceƒüiniz e≈üiniz,dostunuz var ise fƒ±stƒ±k gibi bir ser√ºvene dalƒ±≈ü yapmƒ±≈ü olursunuz. Bu arada maksimum iki ki≈üi oynayabiliyoruz ve belli bir mesafe birbirimizden uzakla≈üamƒ±yoruz yani sen git ke≈üfe ben evdeki inekleri, koyunlarƒ± besleyeyim pek m√ºmk√ºn deƒüil , yani oyunun bize;  anca beraber kanca beraber diye bir dayatma sunduƒüu doƒürudur, bu biraz √ºz√ºc√º ama verdiƒüi keyifle bunu tamamen artƒ± bir √∂zelliƒüe d√∂n√º≈üt√ºrebiliyor. Eƒüer,  bahsettiƒüim gibi bir oynanƒ±≈ü istiyorsanƒ±z ve bunu yapabilecek bir durum mevcut ise mutlaka ≈üans tanƒ±nmasƒ± gereken bir oyun kendisi buradan sevgilerimi sunuyorum.

Not: Benim oynadƒ±ƒüƒ±m zamanlar da, oyuna ilk ba≈üladƒ±ƒüƒ±nƒ±z da denizin kƒ±yƒ±sƒ±na yakƒ±n bir yerde parlayan bir ta≈ü par√ßasƒ± bulmanƒ±z gerek, onu almazsanƒ±z ileri seviyede biraz sƒ±kƒ±ntƒ±ya giriyor ilerleyi≈ü , bulmak i√ßin giri≈ü kƒ±smƒ±nƒ± izleyebilirsiniz. Oyun, s√ºrekli g√ºncelleme aldƒ±ƒüƒ± i√ßin deƒüi≈ümi≈ü olabilir ama hala aynƒ± ise aklƒ±nƒ±z da bulunsun diye bunu da buraya d√º≈üm√º≈ü olayƒ±m, iyi oyunlar!

author: {'steamid': '76561198033910034', 'num_games_owned': 3900, 'num_reviews': 555, 'playtime_forever': 1805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 141, 'last_played': 1594339404}
review:
Not recommended.

This is one of those games that I was excited to dive into because of the survival and crafting selling points. There are some good aspects to this game, such as some depth and variety of crafting and building. It has combat but that was not as polished as I would have liked. In the end, I was met with a mediocre experience that didn't quite grab my attention and left me wanting to play something else.

review: Open world survival game with crafting, battles, and multiplayer...but you have to play as a specific character. There is no character creation. author: {'steamid': '76561198109112656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 6578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6578, 'last_played': 1578993342}
review: La cantidad de horas que tengo en este juego es de dejar al personaje obteniendo arena, arcilla y otros materiales con el bot√≥n del rat√≥n apretado mientras yo me dedicaba a hacer otras cosas. Es un juego excesivamente b√°sico, que pide un farmeo exagerado, [u] sin cinem√°ticas de ninguna clase [/u] *SPOILER* [spoiler] ni siquiera en el final del juego que b√°sicamente consiste en un texto de enhorabuena [/spoiler] *SPOILER*. Tiene grandes problemas de dise√±o: El combate es horroroso, no puedes huir de los enemigos, ya que no dejan de perseguirte nunca y la √∫nica opci√≥n en muchos casos es abusar de la p√©sima inteligencia artificial para bloquearlos con obst√°culos naturales ( o incluso construirlos ) . Adem√°s de la poca variedad, pueden escapar cuando est√°n a punto de morir a una velocidad que es imposible alcanzarlos y apenas te da tiempo de hacer dos o tres disparos que ya se han ido de tu campo de visi√≥n. Debido a lo impredecible del terreno es muy dif√≠cil atacar a distancia sin que los proyectiles choquen contra algo invisible, o si quiera calcular la altura del disparo ya que solo encaras y estar en pendiente modifica tu disparo sin que puedas controlarlo. Los cambios de altura son surrealistas, te puedes encontrar una distancia de la altura de una caja de zapatos infranqueable o una bajada de terreno de un palmo que no puedes saltar. Solo recomendable para fans de los sandboxs o gente que quiera apoyar a los desarrolladores.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010632875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 24578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9481, 'last_played': 1681932045}
review:
I really like this game, and recommend it, but understand some might not be able to handle the grinding aspect that is necessary to progress.
This is basically the spiritual successor to an old shareware game called Stranded II (NOT the borefest one on Steam).  It was made by a Dutch(?) college kid, and it was raw and cheesy, but boy was it addictive.  This game has taken what Stranded II did, expanded on the crafting and combat system, and made a new world for it.  My favorite part of Force of Nature is the camp-building.  The only place you can't get attacked is the area around where you start, so that's where you set up.  As you progress, you can get new buildings, and new crafting stations, until, like in Minecraft, you have workstations and corrals and farm plots all around, and you run around constructing the things that will make you strong enough to kill the next level of enemies.  I consider the crafting to be relatively deep, but there is a tremendous amount of grinding:  weapons need metal, metal needs coal, coal needs wood and embers, embers need sticks.  You can see how long things take, but I see it as the relaxing part of the game.
Now the bad stuff.
The annoying top-down camera.  It's uncomfortable, but I'm now used to it.  Also, combat is not real exciting, and it's frustrating to get swarmed after making a dumb mistake.  But once you learn what you're up against, you can really plan for all situations.  That takes more grinding, though.  And the ending is beyond bad, it's almost a kick in the keyster.  None of this stuff bothers me enough to quit.  I feel like progressing is fun enough.
So if you can stick with it, I think you'll see this is a better-than-average survival game.

review: There really just isn't much here to the game. It feels like the dev gave up halfway through making it. It is technically complete but you can finish it in a few hours. It's a fantastic game for what it is but as support has ceased as well there wont be any more bug fixes for the many many bugs (such as being unable to shoot a bow more then 10 meters). Overall it's not bad, it's just not good, It had the ability to be great.

review: It's concept is fun, the camera angle makes game play tiring and weird. I don't want to play for extended periods of time because I feel like I'm looking up at all times, so my body slouches to try and "see" better despite knowing it's a camera angle issue. If I could find this game with more of a FPS over the shoulder view, I would be playing that instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167037384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1577808143}
review:
Die Idee hinter dem Spiel ist wirklich toll und es macht auch Spa√ü, aber die Umsetzung der Idee h√§tte besser durchdacht sein k√∂nnen. Die erste H√ºtte sollte deutlich fr√ºher freigeschaltet sein, Grund daf√ºr sind die Grundvoraussetzungen des √úberlebens: Wasser, Nahrung, Feuer und Unterkunft(Schutz vor Gefahr und Wetter), au√üerdem ist es unrealistisch, wenn man technologischen Fortschritt durch Kohlemeiler und Hochofen noch vor der ersten Unterkunft hat. Das K√§mpfen ist ohne die M√∂glichkeit zu sprinten eher schlecht, da manch Gegner/Beute flieht und das ist eine gro√üe Verschwendung der Ausdauer und damit auch f√ºr die Nahrung.

Ich hoffe dass noch einige Verbesserungen am Spiel vorgenommen werden, da ich ein gro√üer Fan von solchen Spielen bin.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056510630', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7036, 'last_played': 1691648393}
review:
Ok, so I finally beat the game.

I'm...  kinda still riding the incredible...  Yeah you know what it was a letdown at the end.  The game is an insane grinder.  I don't mean you'll be in insane situations where you have to rely on skill, wit, and courage to carry the day:  I mean grinding in the sense that you're trying to file down an I-beam into a knife with a grinding wheel.  It's incredibly repetitive for combat, you need to stock up on healing and stamina items before any real expedition into the island, and while the crafting does have an acceptable depth to it it can become, well, a chore.

That said, it has a decent base building mechanic to it, you can make your own little village, and if you beat the game you can try to kinda simcity it to make yourself a perfectly pleasant little homestead.

It's a rough attempt at a game, and I don't regret paying the price I did, even if the ending was...  Significantly lacking.  Seriously, it's not worth being impatient for the ending.  That all said...  I'll still give it a recommendation, as it's not a _bad_ game.  It has several hallmarks of a decent one. It's just too heavy on the grinding with a shitty ending for me to give it an enthusiastic recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007888964', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1993, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1598631900}
review:
Okay
this game....
Poor Graphics, I mean it's fine to be able to know whats around but visually there is nothing really going for Force of Nature other than practicality.
Poor Sound, again it's practical.
Poor Controls, very clunky and not comfortable at all to use

However...
I completely binged this game with my friend, we are fiends for a good building/survival game and this really ticks those boxes. Game play and balance wise, Force of Nature really hits the mark! If you can look past (get used to) it's many faults, this game is a jewel, especially playing with friends.

review: Normally, I don't mind a lot of grind in a game. Actually, depending on the game and my mood, I enjoy the grind quite a bit. But, this one is too slow. All the resources are incredibly far apart, you run really, really slowly, and the grind is too excessive for even me with a really low payout. In addition, the game mechanics are really cumbersome and weird, and the tutorial is lacking. I'm only 3 hours in, but I'm so bored.

review:
Magnifico juego de supervivencia. Con much√≠simo contenido, decenas de tareas que hacer, un mapa grande en el que cada zona tiene sus "handicaps" y unos gr√°ficos m√°s que decentes. Si te gusta la supervivencia, el ir creando tu campamento, el crafting, etc. No te puedes perder este juego.
El √∫nico "pero" que le pondr√≠a, es el sistema de combate, que es un poco "tosco", y quiz√° tambi√©n la poca variedad de enemigos (A√∫n as√≠ no se hace repetitivo).  Pero desde luego, el gran contenido del juego, compensa con creces esos peque√±os defectos. 
La buena noticia es que ya est√° en desarrollo la segunda parte del juego. Se espera que est√© disponible aproximadamente en primavera de 2020. Yo personalmente, la espero con muchas ganas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201620245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 608, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1573674847}
review:
Pixel hunting in 3D.
With interactions refused after clicking, via messages telling you to get closer instead of, oh, I don't know... making the click actually move you closer to do the deed?
With controls that don't make any sense whatsoever, and probably required a PhD in Impracticalities to be designed that way.
You can't grasp how ludicrous the controls are without trying them yourself, but unfortunately no free demo is available.

There are so many better games out there, no need to bother with such an amateurish head-scratcher.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127226734', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 10765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9019, 'last_played': 1679596601}
review: Highly recommended from me, this game has so many wonderful features RPG elements. You start on a beach with nothing the game shows you the basics of building and forageing for resources then lets go of your hand and sends you out into the world the trick here is patience you must be ready because there is many wonderful dangers waiting for you.Gathered resouces do not respawn only living things like goblins bears and other much worse monsters waiting for you so learn to farm and protect what is yours. Tempature in different biomes will make you have to manage different cloths so you can stay cool or warm or your stamina or health will drain.Two ways to play follow a quest line gather shards spread all over the world or creative no quest to follow but resouces needed to level up. Many different building options to improve your base that can be made anywhere but will get attacked if not hidden or defended tame a goblin to follow you tame farm animals to feed to produce resources create many different weapons and armors create portals for fast travel back to your base.I could go on and on about all the wonderful things this game has but at this price its a no brainer get it you wont be sorry just remember one thing no matter how good you are there is always something out there that is tougher so take it slow enjoy the creative side and be prepared.Enjoy a great game!

review:
I came
I played
I died 3 times on hard mode 

Would recommend game
Would not recommend dying on hard mode 3 times.  Died from being impatient.  All three times.

The fighting is not particularly complicated, but it's not unentertaining.
But, hey, you can kill chickens and rabbits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056049121', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 181, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1572463610}
review:
Graphics are PS1 quality, and this survival game adds nothing to the genre any dozen or so other games do better and better-looking. This character has no sprint, so you get mobbed and that is it. Stupid. You can't run away. You have to draw them out Diablo 1 style and fight each baddie solo. That is tedious.
You can't make a bow until later in the game, at least I got to level 5 and still no bow, and the problem is it takes 5 wacks to kill a pig but the pig runs away after 4 hits, then comes back with FULL HEALTH. FUGG YOU game.

I will not be checking out force of nature 2, not since this is so bad.

Unplayable but for the most punish-loving players. My character is level 5 and still naked, wearing skimpy Incredible Hulk purple cut-off jeans. Come on, survival game, get it the fugg together. No bow, pigs run away, need pigs to get clothes. FUGG!!!!!

I would say that if the character had a sprint system to run away better, then this game would be much better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032557010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 2937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2937, 'last_played': 1572122039}
review:
J'ai voulu aller au bout des qu√™tes afin d'avoir la fin, mais que ce f√ªt p√©nible! Tout au long du jeu, on passe par des moments o√π on prend plaisir √† jouer et d'autres o√π on gal√®re vraiment et ils sont un peu trop nombreux. 
Le jeu en lui m√™me est pas trop mal, mais √ßa fait tr√®s (trop?) amateur et √ßa se ressent dans le jeu. On a l'impression qu'il a √©t√© publi√© avant d'√™tre totalement termin√©, essentiellement au niveau de l'interface qui est une catastrophe (clavier qwerty inchangeable, raccourcis non modifiables et qui ne font pas la m√™me chose d'une fen√™tre √† une autre) et totalement archa√Øque (grosses fen√™tres et trop de clics pour arriver √† ce qu'on veut).
Le syst√®me de level est original et √©vite de monter trop vite et d'utiliser tous ce qui est √† notre disposition. en contrepartie, √ßa demande de devoir farmer des compos et donc c'est parfois long (voir tr√®s long pour la derni√®re qu√™te).

author: {'steamid': '76561198136321977', 'num_games_owned': 232, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 2440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1576347487}
review:
I've barely played this game, it seemed beautiful, but I didn't find a way to progress or how to do the first quest, then my son visited and he found the ruby (that spawn where you first spawn) and we also figured out that we could get more palm leafs by kicking the palm trees with coconut and banana, then things started getting more advanced quickly. We could craft axe to chop down bushes and trees in the way for further exploration and a pickaxe for gathering iron and unlucked more and more things to build and finding more enemies, that you had to be careful around. I can't praise the varied enviroment enough, seen through the 3rd person, main character.

It's more of an RPG game, rather then yet another zombie survival game, thank God. But there's crafting from the very start to be able to progress, and as the pictures also show building, growing food and domestcating animals, a part I'm looking forward to when I start playing again. The map is large, but then again not endless, so I like the idea that it's possible to get to an end somewhere, and I have really played games with much more grinding then this that I enjoyed a lot. Personally I only get a sense of achivement when I look at a home with everything I need to make to go on an adventure, knowing it all come from hard work (fun playing).

For once a simple, relaxing, survival game, where you don't have to move around in an dystopian, post-apocalyptic nightmare (NOT one of the many I've had to ask for refund of, because it's only positive reviews, but only depressing crap once you try it) and beat things to a bloody pulp in order to get anywhere, and I really look forward to play. I've saved this for a long time, to have something fun to do a weekend I'm bored.

Will give further comments once I've actually played through it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150113652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1571822797}
review:
Let's keep it short

I love grinding, material gathering, and nearly everything that exists inside rpg-survival genre. However, this game still need more than polishing. Gathering is good, but camera is so-so, combat system is bad, and tutorial clearly contain so little information that i need few minutes before start playing. 

Honestly, if you really want to try it, go ahead. But if you want a game with good system, please take your time before decide to buy this game. And also, please read the reviews from other people. Maybe their review will help you to decide.

author: {'steamid': '76561197981638563', 'num_games_owned': 4007, 'num_reviews': 518, 'playtime_forever': 4488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1572351459}
review:
[h1][b][i]No! God! No, God, please, no! NO!!![/i][/b]
~Michael Scott (The Office)[/h1]

Seriously, though, I really wonder just how much of such games do we need. I mean, come on! It's like every second wannabe indie developer tries to make these. The open world sandbox survival games with nothing but grinding and crafting in them. You know the drill. You waste countless hours on cutting trees and collecting crap to craft some new crap and use it to collect even more crap. Repeat until you'll get just enough crap to begin feeling miserable and start rethinking your life choices. Guess what, guys? Here comes another one of those! Because we freakin' needed it in our lives! Just in case if you've got tired watching your poor looking character cutting trees in some other games, you can switch to this one! Why should you choose this one over tons of other games? Well, it's slower than some others (just because after watching your character cutting trees, you'll need to watch the crafting meter to [i]slo-o-owly[/i] move from one part of the screen to another, which is literally as fun as watching the paint dry), it looks especially bad (remember the very first [b]SIMS[/b]? That's the stuff we have here, guys, a very cute visuals... from a freakin' year [b]2000[/b]), you can tame cows (Ah, [b]Chauncey[/b]?! [i]How are you feeling today?[/i]) and then [i]eat mor chikin[/i]. God have mercy...

To give the developers some justice, though, I should mention the fact that, unlike many others, this game actually has a proper goal. That's right, folks! You can actually beat [b]Force of Nature[/b]! To do that, you'll need to collect some shards (of course, you'll need to do tons of slow, boring and unskippable crafting first, because developers hate you that much) and craft them into one epic shard of nature. Because, you know... the nature... it's cool... and stuff... But [i]anyway[/i], it's nice to have a goal. It really is. The problem is... well... guess what you'll get in the end of the game? No, not a cute little cutscene with our hero (who's always male, since you can't even choose the gender here) leaving the island with a beautiful lady (or man, I'm not here to judge). And no, not a long and mind-blowing text about all that being an illusion created by his broken mind after he discovered the fact that the Earth is actually flat and the entire space thing was a KGB conspiracy. Nothing like that, no. What you'll get in the end is a ‚Äúcongratulations‚Äù message. Congratu... freakin'... lations... After wasting hours and hours on cutting the freakin' trees and staring at your pet cow's ugly butt. F***k me and my whole pathetic life, this is some seriously depressive s***t we have here...

Anyway, sorry for the language in this angry little review, but honestly, guys, enough is enough. You see ‚Äúsurvival, open world, crafting‚Äù in game's user tags, be careful. Be very, very careful. You see those tags with something that looks like [b]Force of Nature[/b]? With only a few enemy types and no variety whatsoever? You run for your freakin' life. As long as you are not the Time Lord and you don't have some extra lives to waste on all sorts of nonsense while eating fish fingers and custard. There are so many awesome things in this world... and yet, some a-holes want us to waste our lives on watching the crafting meter... Screw that. Now, excuse me, I've just suffered through a lot of stress and therefore need a drink. Or two. Or ten...

author: {'steamid': '76561198180234717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 179, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1570910018}
review:
Overall, I like the concept of this game, but the controls/menus are a little clunky.

It's very much a chill survivor-type game (at least in the beginning). I'm a casual gamer, so I don't particularly like having to fight my way through hordes of zombies; this game felt like the right amount of challenge between how easy it was to get the hang of it and the slight challenge of finding crafting materials and exploring the island. It even has a place where you can get hints if you can't find a material.

I had to completely redo the key controls. If renaming controls wasn't an option I would have returned this game. I can generally get the hang of most default key controls, but this one was so awkward to use.

The inventory/crafting boxes are clunky. Some buttons have shortcuts and some don't have the option. Equipping tools or weapons is weird, I spent a good chunk of in-game time just equipping stuff using the mouse. I don't mind the time sink since I only play for the crafting and the farming, but I can see how it would be frustrating to try and switch weapons quickly while fighting goblins or whatever.

I like that I can interact with nearly every single thing in the environment. It was a nice surprise when I accidentally kicked some reeds (what I thought were just world decoration) and some materials fell on the ground! I'm very impressed with the level of interaction in this game.

I like that my character doesn't die from exposure and that he doesn't need rest every night. It detracts from the 'realistic' experience, but I'm a very casual gamer so I like when I don't have to worry about my character running out of time before I get to craft something.

I wish there was an option to change the gender of the character. I'm a woman, and I like playing female characters in games; it adds to the immersion. Even if you were just to put a ponytail on the character I would be fine! It takes away from the immersion (for me) for my character to be male.

Very cool concept, great gameplay, clunky (almost frustrating) controls and menus.

Recommended if you're a casual player like me, not recommended if you are a die-hard survivalist gamer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080552711', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1970, 'last_played': 1539210236}
review:
The graphics were beautiful and there was a lot to discover about the world. However, it was very grindy.

The quest structure serves more to lead one through the levels of technological development and exploration than to form a narrative. The end game was basically a non-sensical grind, as well as being a cliffhanger: I wish it had lasted one stage longer, allowing me to use the Force of Nature to learn what was going on in this world to cause certain places in the world to be like they were.

In summary, I enjoyed the game a lot, but if you're looking for a story, don't look here. If you want to build a thriving little village to live alone in (I haven't tried the cooperative aspect), this might be a game for you. I didn't find it replayable, but I got 33 hours of entertainment for 8 bucks, which is a great deal.

One frustrating thing was that when you save, you respawn at a set location, so if you are playing and you have to leave quickly for some reason, you might lose the quest progress you've made since your last save unless you happened to get far enough to be able to set a new location.

review: Very fun and addicting for a simple little game. Lots of fun with friends. I also love how if you play with friends you have to stay close together.... and if one dies, you all respawns back home. It gives more purpose to putting in teamwork and surviving together without Everyone running off their own directions. It kind of seems to give you more enemies playing together then it does if you are Solo. Also very nice. Very great game.... addictive and fun alone or with friends.... so yes I would definitely recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277810110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 6345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6345, 'last_played': 1569178374}
review:
Gamers who enjoy exploration may find, like me, the beautiful game overall. The vegetation especially and its layout on the ground is very well designed and colorful, forming mysterious scenarios that call for exploration.
Mining, cooking, cooking, everything the supposed castaway has to produce to survive is terribly slow and costs a lot of real time. This is not good for a game to have, worse for the player. It is as if in the story of a movie, the character enters the bath; So whoever watches the movie would be waiting for the bath scene in real time, embittering the wait, until the character comes out, dries up, gets dressed for the story to continue ... so taking about 30 minutes of real time. Absurd a Gamedesigner to use real time as COST of manufacture or currency within the playing time. This is because it seems to provide some likelihood to the game. Slutty stealing your clients time isn't it?
It turns out that some Gamedesigners, seem to think that attaching the player to the product created, need to produce a mental micromanagement addiction. I do not agree with this as it harms young people in the matter of time spent on games. Spoils the fun.
However, I tried out of curiosity to play this "force of nature" all the way down to see what was going on. But I could not. I repeat, It was absurd to take real time to do everything I said and beyond, pick up the ingredients, cultivate or explore to get them.

The game has no plot. It is in the mystery. So far so good. The player may assume that they have sunk and arrived on the island.
I think the developers, and I'm writing this for others to really see and change their minds - were very shrewd and unfaithful to their clients. Have you forgotten where your money comes from? Rolling up the player takes a while to get to the end of the game and then you see that the game didn't have fun or teach anything. Just stole the time and some money. Very disappointing that.
Today I accidentally clicked on his link in my Steam library. I played for over a year. Steam reinstalled and restarted from scratch. Then I remembered how long this game was when I stopped playing. And uninstalled again.
I will speak in all sincerity, and look, I like games. Should games be accepted are super built around micromanagement? They do this to stick to your brain. Example: Real Time Demand for making and progressing items or characters; Interfaces whose actions require more than 3 steps (I've seen 5 to 10+) will gnaw the keyboard / mouse behind another increasingly subcategorized option. Not to say that I am exaggerating. Take the test ... Doesn't it addict your brain and you stand there unknowingly counting and sorting and checking "little pebbles"? It's like knitting without producing the clothes. Instead of having fun it will frustrate you to the extreme, with a foolish face (that was polite ..) because you paid for it.
I don't want to hurt developers just by showing that we watch what you do and show what we don't like. Improve it, change this way of making your products enjoyable. Don't hurt your customers' time. Thanks.

O jogo n√£o tem enredo. Fica no mist√©rio. At√© a√≠, tudo bem. O player pode assumir que naufragou e chegou na ilha.
Acho que os desenvolvedores, e estou escrevendo isso para que outros veja mesmo e mudem de mente - foram muito astutos e infieis com seus clientes. Ser√° que esqueceram de onde vem seu dinheiro? Hoje, acidentalmente, cliquei no link dele que est√° na minha biblioteca Steam. Joguei √† mais de um ano. O Steam reinstalou e recome√ßou do zero. Ent√£o me lembrei de qu√£o ladr√£o de tempo este jogo foi quando parei de jogar. E desinstalei novamente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009389605', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 6830, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6830, 'last_played': 1567469081}
review:
I literally kept falling asleep while playing this game, the pace is slow. 

To level up you need to craft/build specific things which is not so bad, at first. But when you have to build a house, when you already have 5 of them (smaller but still) and you really don't need a new one and it take you 2-3 hours just to get the materials to build it, just left clicking, doing nothing else. You start questioning yourself about why are you doing is profoundly boring thing. You also need to craft a huge about of healing supplies if you want to keep fighting and you often hit bottleneck in you crafting chain because the amount of building you can have are limited by your level.

This game was not worth it for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987977449', 'num_games_owned': 800, 'num_reviews': 265, 'playtime_forever': 3083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1569351148}
review:
It's a nice game and all, but it's incomplete. Some game mechanics do not yet make immersive play possible due to the way the game mechanics are put together a little too sloppily. A pity, because although it's a fully featured game, things like character movement is a bit clunky in itself, as is camera control. All the parts are there in one way or another to make the game and the story work. It's not a pretty game, but it is still a lot of fun to play and explore, as I said, incomplete, sound effects are very simple, as are graphics. There is a version 2 in the wings, but that's a bit cruel considering the game does not quite make me go "wow, I'll buy version 2".

All passable, but not ooooh yeah.

review:
Un juego de supervivencia y crafteo, con un trasfondo de fantas√≠a.

No lo he explorado a fondo, s√≥lo juge unas horas con un par de amigos. El juego parece que tiene un sistema de crafteo intereante y muy trabajado, pero para mi le falta acci√≥n o desarrollo... vamos tiene pinta de ser otro simulador de le√±ador m√°s con un sistema de combate bastante aburrido.

Esto no quita que la estrategia de crafteo y minimizar recursos para conseguir edificios y obejtivos no est√© bien conseguida, si te mola solo la estrategia del superviviente puede estar bien, pero yo le pido algo m√°s a un juego asi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044544701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1566691273}
review:
I recieved this game as a free gift during when it was on sale for 79 cents.  That said, this is an interesting rough-hewn gem that I would not have likely paid much attention to otherwise.

Force of Nature is a very simplistic basic survival game.  The mechanics are easy to pick up, the tutorials are packed in with the quests, and it is indeed somewhat addicting to play and work your way up.  However, I also would like to mention the fact that due to the developer being Russian, expect a few contextual English errors if you play this language.  Nothing unreadable, but certainly amusing if you enjoy that kind of thing.  The enemies are also somewhat monotonous and are used by the developer to pad the game out unnecessarily.  

Levels, which are how craftables are unlocked, are only gainable by doing the quests and spending some gold coins/ingots.  You will spend several hours beating goblins up for gold coins to make ingots with, and then refreshing the game, since the ingame monster refresher, the straw bed, does not work as advertised.  If you die, they will also come back.   If you die by the way, you also will outright lose some of your stuff with no chance to pick them back up.  Try not to die.  It hurts.

However, I do find myself enjoying this game rather more than disliking it.  If you keep in mind that this looks and seems to be programmed like a cheap but servicable Russian game, then you would be recommended to try this gem out.  For its full price of eight bucks?  Ehhhhh.... Ill let you figure that one out.  I personally would have skipped this one if I hadnt been given it, but I would probably recommend it on perhaps 4 or 5 bucks budget.

As an endnote: This is a finished game, and a sequel is coming out supposedly.  Any problems you encounter in this game will not likely be patched up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043669656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 16754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15020, 'last_played': 1590630796}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046059151', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 2821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1003, 'last_played': 1567164569}
review:
I picked this up on a 90% sale and I feel like I ripped someone off! This game is very cool. It's rough around the edges, but it's still in development. Combat is simplistic and aiming arrows needs a LOT of work, but that's really the only criticisms. The quest line is great and walks you through most of what you need to do to advance the story. The tedium of gathering resources is not really tedium if you are a survival gamer. Need food? Put a heavy weight on a mouse button with enough worms and a fishing pole near the water and go do some chores. Come back and you have fish for days. Need 50 sand? same thing.  Farming for gold is the most tedious chore. I tried sleeping til morning for a mob reset, but to no avail. Restarting game works, though.

One suggestion to the dev, please let us build fences and gates. every reset I get animals attacked. It's annoying. If I could make a pen for them that would be helpful. Also a perimiter fence and a gate for my property would be handy, too. I definitely got my $0.78 worth out of this game! If I had played it on a weekend preview, I would have paid full price and been happy with my purchase. I can't wait to see what happens mid game now. No telling what endgame is like yet. I have some ideas, though, and feel certain the devs won't let me down.
