author: {'steamid': '76561198121371584', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 10092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1706362977}
review:
Supervivencia lenta y sin apuros, modo de construcci√≥n y de crafteo bastante intuitivo y que lleva mucho tiempo el farmeo de materiales como para hacer todo a lo loco.
La supervivencia es "tranquila", no vamos a tener ataques de mobs a nuestra base y si buscamos problemas es salir del "√°rea segura" para cazar enemigos, necesario para conseguir oro y poder avanzar de level a nuestro personaje.
Con cada nuevo level trae disponible nuevas cosas para hacer, obviamente cada vez se pone mas dif√≠cil.
Es entretenido si te gusta desarrollar tu base tranquilo y sin apuros, como dije el conseguir los materiales y craftear cosas lleva bastante tiempo, incluso algunos materiales est√°n en lugares que es complicado acceder y necesitamos estar bien equipados para poder pasar ya que los enemigos son bastante complicados.
Los mundos se generan siempre de forma random asique nunca vamos a jugar en un mismo lugar mas all√° de que los materiales son siempre los mismos.

Recomendado 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198105753615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1527685882}
review:
I played for around 16 minutes, and i didnt like the game at all.

Is the first time i request a refund of my money.

The game controls are awful. 

If you want to harvest something you have 2 choices, press the Q key and click the item you want to harvest or press the L.Alt key. But if you want to loot something, you need to press the L.Ctrl key or press Q and click.

To interract with things, you need to press the E key.

That makes it impossible to loot around and harvest things because you need to press 3 diferent keys to do things that you can do with just 1 key in any other survival game. Why couldnt they just make the E key do the 3 things? Harvest, interract and loot.  You can change the controls because wen you try to change it, you get a message that says "That key is already in use" and you cant set the E key for the 3 actions. 

That was the stronger reason for me to give up on the game. Maybe for others thats not a good reason, but i hope this helps other people in the future to choose if they are up for that or not.

Other thing i didnt liked is that the enviroment is lifeless, plants dont move, u cant pass tru almosy anything like grass or flowers, it didnt feels like an oppen world.

review: The game seems slow at first, but once you've played more it is GREAT! There is alot of menu back and forth, but you'll get used to it just like the other crafting games.  I can't believe it has so many thumbs down, or the it's only $7.99.  I'd say if you've played only once or twice give it another try. It gets addictive!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120306953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1527263819}
review: I like crafting games. I like low-key nature survival games. I like research trees (which this sort of has). This game is boring, way too slow, and very grindy. The camera and controls feel a bit sluggish (even at max on a good computer). There is no other option to save than to save and exit, thereby respawning all the monsters you've killed. The achievements sound so easy and doable which is why I keep foolishly coming back to this game, but the whole game is just too slow and grindy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171696335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2254, 'last_played': 1539460867}
review:
This is a charming game with wonderfully textured graphics and simple gameplay.  The quests help the player build the rpg character and move the game forward.  The player has a lot of automony in the game to decide what to do and where to explore (open world).

Force of Nature has all of the excellent components of open world rpg:  crafting, gathering, fighting, and leveling up according to quests.  The battles are not bloody or gory in any way, and the game is very approriate for a younger crowd that can handle battling some monsters: goblins and ghosts etc.. and hunting bears, wild boars, and foxes.  The controls of the game are simple, but take some practice.  

This is a great little world with loads of fun details and balanced play.  Definitely worth a it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198194593577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1526146902}
review:
The traps need a serious fix. Nets go all over the place and it is so tough to catch something. I get it if they want you to throw two nets to catch an animal, but the physics are completely off and are in need of an overhaul.
If you do get lucky enough to catch something, it is an entertaining waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119840578', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1525722572}
review:
I don‚Äôt usually review games, but I most certainly want to review this one. I decided to play something new last night instead of letting my depression win, go to bed, all that good stuff.

All in all, I don‚Äôt think this is a bad game, per se, but I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs a great one either. I would say it was a nice change of pace, playing a different game in a genre that I sort of enjoy, and it certainly gave me what I had been needing at the time. But while I am rating this a positive experience, I think it is only necessary to provide why this wasn‚Äôt the best experience in the hopes of giving your team necessary feedback for your game.

When I first started the game up, it automatically opened the player menu for me so that it could give me my first quests. This was all well and good; it gave me the chance to hover my mouse over things and see what hotkey opens what, and I found that I could move my camera by holding space (on accident). I could pick stuff up off the ground, and walk. I had no reason to really play without my inventory open, so I was organizing as I went along gathering resources. This only became a problem when I got my first knife. The instructions provided said to place it in a number slot to use it, which I did, but found I could not use it for some reason. I wasn‚Äôt entirely sure what the system for using tools was as it was my first tool, so I tried hitting 1. Nothing happened. Tried left clicking. Nothing happened. Right click? Still nothing. I spent about five minutes trying to get close enough to things to find out if I needed to be near something, smashing my face into trees and bushes, desperately attempting to cut everything in my path. All was for naught. Finally, I decided to close out the game and come back in, since sometimes my computer is the problem and that tends to fix things. Whoop-tee-doo, I could suddenly use my knife! Then I re-opened the player menu to organize things, briefly thought the game broke again, and then realized what the problem was. It was not my computer, it was the player inventory that I could do everything but use tools in apparently. I felt like such a fool. Granted, most players probably don‚Äôt play with their inventories open, but I still feel like this situation would‚Äôve been avoided had the game told me that.
After that bout of confusion, I then proceeded to go back to relatively enjoying the game. I had a nice little campsite that was quite literally already closed off from the rest of the world, so I had nothing to attack me too early into the game. I wasn‚Äôt even 100% sure there were monsters at all yet, but I had a big pile of rocks and lots of trees surrounding my camp. I honestly couldn‚Äôt even see far enough to see if monsters existed since the game exists in permanent, apparently un-changeable fog. I found the ocean to be rather pretty with the overall game scenery to be lacking, but as it‚Äôs an indie game it could have been worse, and it actually looks pretty decent.

Then came the quest to kill goblins. After wasting a lot of resources to clear the brush, axing my way through trees, bushes, and sunflowers, I finally created a path. My introduction to the combat system was not pleasantly smooth, although I did kill my first goblin just fine. I had just hopped into a Discord call as I was discovering this part of the game and my language about it was pretty foul. Needless to say, I didn‚Äôt enjoy it. It felt like a shot in the foot after enjoying the gathering mechanics well enough and left me feeling quite sour. Monsters spotting you seems slightly random. I was up on a cliff mining stone and a bear noticed me from below, ran all the way around, and started beating me up. I felt glorious in managing to kill the bear, but I was almost dead and the ratio of healing items to how much you get hurt just is not enough. I also got spotted by a goblin that wasn‚Äôt facing me on that same sprint for resources out of my camp, which was unfair and ultimately ended in my untimely demise (and losing half of the resources I left my camp for).
Even worse are the Goddamn animals. Bears, foxes, and boars give literally no fucks in hell about each other. You can be attempting to run from any one of those and another will just run up and join the assault. And by attempt I mean, you really can‚Äôt outrun them. You really. Really. Can‚Äôt. Your player just isn‚Äôt fast enough, because they randomly pick up speed, don‚Äôt really seem to have a cut off point of just how far they‚Äôll chase you, and your hope of losing them lies in escaping through a spot just barely wide enough for the player to fit through and hoping the animals get stuck. If you can get out of their line of sight after doing that, you are home free. But it‚Äôs still just so unnecessary. You don‚Äôt want to make unsurvivable situations for low level players. Yes, you want to make a challenge so the game doesn‚Äôt get boring, but if an experience isn‚Äôt enjoyable then it‚Äôs just not enjoyable. The predatory animals really need to be updated. Maybe make it so foxes will run away if Goblins, bears, or boars start charging at the player. Boars and bears fight each other. Something. A system where players can get crafty to survive encounters rather then being unable to escape death is much more enjoyable.

And last but not least, please explain how to use tools and weapons more thoroughly. I have wasted over thirty nets trying to catch and tame one animal. The net explains what it can catch, but not how to use it, leading to so many of them just being plain old wasted. I even googled how to do it, because the game explained nothing. It did not even give tips on how to catch something. And I‚Äôm still struggling! Trying to tame things so far has been a complete waste of time and I am required to do it just to level up enough to be able to craft a bed. And I need the bed so I stop wasting the resources I really don‚Äôt have! Please don‚Äôt get me wrong, to an extent the ‚Äúfigure things out yourself‚Äù method is more fun than games that baby you through everything. But there‚Äôs a point where you‚Äôre not explaining enough and this is most certainly it.

Despite all my qualms, though, I do like the game. I enjoy that it gives us the basics and then encourages us to do things on our own rather then step-by-stepping each mission. However, I think it takes not explaining things too far, and I feel like the ability to cook food from the get-go would really help making the time it takes to finally create a bed much more worth it, much less grueling. Maybe allow us to make a starter bed? An elevated bow of palm leaves roped to a stick like a makeshift tent or a handful of palm leaves tied together and plopped on the ground. All in all, it‚Äôs a nice game for what it is and I really do look forward to seeing how this game may grow over time.

I appreciate all the hard work your team has been putting in to make this and look forward to roping a friend into playing multiplayer with me sometime. Thank you for making Force of Nature.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072510140', 'num_games_owned': 2192, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1752, 'last_played': 1525441334}
review: I was very very surprised to how much i like this game. Sometimes the price of a game makes me vary to how good it could be but not in this case. I play a lot of survival type games and this was nice change from those. While its pretty much like the other where to go gather resources and build up your base and farm and whatnot it has some slight differences i enjoy. The main difference is that everything is locked behind your character level and the character level increased after you complete the mandatory quests. I really enjoy this aspect of it because it keeps the game interest. It makes t so you cant just sit there and farm resources and in fives hour have the best gear. You have to do the quest then your able to level which cost something of its own. Then you unlock new things which help you complete the next set of quests and so on. I am 29 hours in and i can still see a bunch of stuff left to unlock. While it can be grindy it still is very fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983259012', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2627, 'last_played': 1525727395}
review:
Only played multiplayer with one friend so far.
I am at 40 hours played and he is at 20.
50% of the time played together we did the following and 100% of the time of me soloing while my friend was offline so that we could:

Gather water.
Plant/Gather coffee beans.
Gather water
Make Coffee.
and...

Gather water.
Plant/gather wheat.
Feed animals to get needed eggs/wool. (which also requires water to feed the animals and water is VERY slow to come by)
and...

Gather water.
Plant/Gather wheat.
Turn wheat into flour.
Gather more water.
Make bread.

Then later made pies which took all of the above plus:
Gather water.
Plant/gather apples.
[insert wheat+egg farming here]
Gather water.
Make pies.

To make a stack of coffee, bread, pies, or any consumable for healing health or energy would take multiple hours just so we can progress in one biome.
I HIGHLY recommend farming for wool for your equipment every other tier. You will spend way too many hours gathering wheat and wool. Kiting monsters with arrows saves you from taking too many hits once they are in range, so you don't need to rely on having the best armor at all times even if solo.

My biggest complaint is that the wells that generate water have a max capacity of 6 which is way too low.
Animals such as chickens or cows should have a chance to produce like 1-3 eggs/milk instead of just 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030229968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3282, 'last_played': 1666530516}
review:
Force of Nature.

When i saw the intro video i bought the game straight away and it turned out to be a good thing to do and because i can.
And even before i actually start writting a review on this i will state that there is NO WAY i would ever ask for refund on this game, just to clarify that and here is the reason why. (Also this is a review on Creative mode of the game that i play right now, i want to try everything before starting survival and getting them achievements rolling in).

1. Graphics are good.
2. Controls are easy, in fact they are laid out the same way as you would play an fps game, 
3. Combat system is a bit crappy but tolerable, as long as you dont give the enemy a chance to run away.
4. crafting system is actually better than the one you have in games like minecraft. 
5. A VERY GRINDY GAME, thats right...there is no easy way in this game. Either its leveling up or building a mill, the items required are sometimes hard to come by. (Actually not, mill and brick house are easy to build, as long as you have supplies laying around in your chests. 
6. As mentioned above leveling is quite tricky, for example, to reach level 9 you need 10 honey and 15 onyx chips. At first you might think *ah man, thats BS, i will never get it* but there is actually a trick on how to bypass this if you have correct materials, altar and alchemical lab built....plus a dozen of roses of any colour.
7. The hardest in this game has to be the gold ingots. The thing is that its tough and i mean VERY TOUGH to get your hands on gold coins, which are dropped by certain monsters in different areas. Goblins drop most of the time copper coins but sometimes 1-3 gold coins as well. You might feel that its not fair to kill 10 goblins and only 2 of them dropped 2 gold coins each, but then again there is always another way. Go ahead and enter desert map, kill off a couple of devils, because they only drop gold coins not copper anymore, and as a bonus they tend to drop topaz chips. 
8. There is an alternative for getting gem chips, if you happen to have yellow or white roses laying around somewhere, get them in seedbeds and constantly grow them, build mill and get that elixir rolling in, because as soon as you got that and hundreds of stacks of roses, there should be no problem with chips anymore.
9. Building something in this game is actually as easy as making coffee....for experienced players there should be no problem gathering certain resources and building stuff, but seems to me other people think otherwise.

Overall this game has a bright future and i absolutely love it. Keep up the good work devs, dont forget to add more stuff to the game in near future. Say an enchantment table would be nice, to enchant armor or weapons using gems or chips.

All the haters out there can piss their pants trying to get their refund on 2 hours play time, seriously....2-3 hours and you already writting a negative review. How about spending more time on the game? You will like it eventually...

This is a HARDCORE survival game and i like it the way it is, no changes needed. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197997748682', 'num_games_owned': 875, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1523485257}
review: Boring, slow and grindy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165729684', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5786, 'last_played': 1525140118}
review:
Why did I play this game? The payoff for the amount of work you have to do is non existant. Not wanting to mention the frustrastion involved with getting to level 12 because other reviews do a great job of telling those problems but simply put, this game is too realistic in the worst way, you could literally walk somewhere and chop wood and the other tedious tasks faster in real life.

When you finally reach the last level, if you ever keep playing long enough, the amount of work involved is overwhelming and the developers created the perfect storm to ensure your frustration and that you absolutely hate this game before it's over. To reach level "13" where there's no incentive as far as new upgrades, you need to create 5 of each gem, which means you need to dig 2250 sand blocks to create 450 glass bars then make 450 test tubes, you need to fill the test tubes with 10 flowers each for a total of 4500 flowers to make the elixIirs, the developers put a cap of 6 wells so you have to wait minutes for them to fill up with 6 water each that's 36 water every 3-4 minutes. To make 5 flowers takes 16 water so the most you can make is around 2 per 3-4 minutes unless you stalkpile water which takes time in itself, then you have to wait 3-4 minutes for them to grow................ were talking hours upon hours, then wait for the elixirs to become chips then wait for the chips to become gems.......... ARE WE HAING FUN YET???? Just to make it a little more FUN they force you to make 15 gold bars on top of that and 20 molotov cocktails....... there a couple more hours of great enjoyable content for you. Even at the highest level with the "best" armor your no match for most enemies......... I'm done with this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007973488', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 22670, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11257, 'last_played': 1642846573}
review:
So I see a lot of people complain that this game is a grind, and too slow etc.
Yes, it's true that the pace is a bit slower than many games.
And of course it would get boring if you start to craft something and then stand around to look at the progress bar.
I have found that I always have plenty of things to do, and by the time they are done so is the crafting.
To me this is relaxing, and a good contrast to stressful RTS or FPS games.

The main skill in this game, in my opinion, is to be able to aggro one enemy at a time. The further you get in the game the more important this gets. This could take a bit of patience in some circumstances, as you might have to wait for enemies to wander apart. But it's also quite fun to circle an area and look for opportunities to pull an enemy away from the bunch.

Of course there are things that could be improved, getting a little bit of story into the game would be one thing. But considering the low price, and the fact that this is a one man show I must say this game is remarkably good. With the right mindset you will have a lot of fun.

review:
How did I get to over 50 hours on this game?!

The other reviewers are right.  It is very, very slow and very, very boring.  Grindy McGrindface.

When a poorly drawn gorilla jumps out and kills you after you have spent literal real-life hours crafting...dude.  It's just rude.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163834595', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1509913277}
review:
So this game is a fairly straight forward survival simulator. Easy to play and I didn't encounter any bugs.

I was a little bummed on the limitations. for example you could only build a certain amount of huts based on your level.
I found that you definitely do not want to be a packrate in this game. carry what you need and store what you feel you may need.  You are even limited to a certain amount of storage boxes based on your level.  (why??)
I recommend getting a good weapon early on in the game so you can explore farther without needing to run back to base and heal.
Game Mechanics are a little clunky in the movement, but it makes up for it with crafting dynamics in my opinion.

for the $7.99 I would say give it a try!  6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198281098984', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2584, 'last_played': 1524350044}
review:
Suite √† mes 43h de jeu et une partit fini en coop, je viens laisser ma petite √©valuation dessus.

C'est l'un des meilleurs jeu auquel j'ai eu le plaisir de jouer depuis pas mal de temps.
Je le place dans la m√™me lign√© que the witcher vue sont niveaux de gameplay et ses m√©canique ultra pousser.

Bien entendu je d√©conne, faut pas r√™ver.
8‚Ç¨ pour choper un cancer c'est un peu ch√®re √† mon gout. 

Tout d'abord parlons du multijoueur qui est totalement flinguer.
Un alli√© meurt, tout le monde meurt.
Seul l'hote pourra valider les succ√®s steam durant la partit, et uniquement lui d√©bloquera le mode hardcore une fois la partit fini.
Donc quand vous aurez fini de souffrir apr√®s des heures de tuerie visuel, 75% de l'√©quipe l'aura fais juste pour le fun.
Sois dis en passans, le fun est mort apr√®s le lvl2, quand tu commence a comprendre a quel point tu va devoir refouler tes pulsion suicidaire.
Je sais pas pour le solo, mais a plusieurs quand tu passe presque 2h uniquement en craft pour t'√©quiper et ainsi pouvoir explorer une zone froide, ou chaude, les envie de meurtre se font omnipr√©sente.

Le seul point positif c'est la musique.
A mon avis tout le budget a du y passer et c'est pour sa que le reste est vide.
Le temps de jeu se comble par l'attente et uniquement l'attente du repop de monstre et le craft d'objet.
Apr√®s l'attente c'est uniquement du bourrinage de d√©bile.

Les gnome que l'on capture sont tellement b√™te qu'ils attaquent pas les ennemi.

Enfin bon, c'est un jeu sympa pour passer le temps quand t'as rien a faire avec des amis, mais a part sa, chercher pas le jeu de l'ann√©.
En m√™me temps pour 4‚Ç¨ en r√©duc, j'attendais pas mieux.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993894575', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 253, 'playtime_forever': 1030, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1030, 'last_played': 1523823948}
review:
It is truly a grind but I played and played hoping it would be worth it, hoping area farther in the game would be more exciting. So I crafted my fur armor to brave the cold right after I unequip my hot armor from braving the hot. The next place to go I must craft white fur armor now or it is too cold; with no content truly new or exciting. White fur armor takes every ingredient but x more + another material; sooo grindy. 

This game can be moderately fun if you play with a friend on free mode and avoid the normal progression mode like the plague. For me though it is too late to do that mode; I‚Äôm already grinded out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196745281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1538673798}
review:
Pros:
- excellent challange w/o being too easy  or too hard
- very engrossing environment and atmosphere such that it feels as if you were actully stranded upon a desert island
- very rewarding to "get next level" and craft new things
- employs a fetch/gather resource based system that is balanced well (not too grindy, not just given either. Items must be earned and it feels very rewarding)
- beautifl envrionment that does not at all feel bland or repetitive. Very fun to explore
- many resources such as ores are limited in their quanitity and location. Must be wise about how you spend resources
- many decorations make crafting and personalizing your "base" very fun and unique
- environmental sounds are fantastic and make sense based on the types of critters near you
- excellent leveling system and items to craft to suit your play style
- excellent tutorial and menu system
- price to get this EA game is outstanding

Cons:
- for some folks - they may prefer a soundtrack vs envrinmental sounds 
- the combat is clunky and awkward but nevertheless it is functional
- no controller support as of the time of this writing
- obviously the game is in EA, neverhteless could use more items to craft and npc merchants or quests
- could use some recurring quest lines to keep things interesting for endgame (ex go fetch, go kill, defend the base, protect an ally, escourt an ally etc)

OVERALL:
- I love this game and rate it a 8/10 based on my EA experience with it. It is of course a niche game, but if your into it then its a great little game for super cheap!

author: {'steamid': '76561198170382415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 607, 'last_played': 1564104542}
review:
TL;DR: Some parts of the game are great, but overall it's a bit too cumbersome for me to really enjoy with consistency. Worth it for the price ($7.99 USD as I type this)

I tried really hard to like this game, and made sure to give it a solid 8 hours of focused gameplay over a period of about a week. The videos on the store page show a rather dynamic camera movement which I could not recreate and it left me struggling to be able to see some of the world immediately around my character and made combat a bit cumbersome. There is also not much of a tutorial or guide available in-game.  What is there is actually really nice, but I found myself having to occassionally pause everything and sit back trying to figure out how to do something.  

On the positive side, I've run this on multiple computers of varying abilities and had no problems crop up.  The world is beautifully generated, and I felt a bit drawn in to wondering what the story behind the world was. (I didn't find any real storyline, but I don't feel that that takes away from this game).  Most of the game makes sense right from the top if you've played similar games before.

Ultimately this is the type of game I play when I want something a little less intense and can afford to just relax without feeling like I need to rush to get things done in-game.  Despite the negative portions of this review, I will be returning to the game intermittently, but not regularly.  The game does give you a nice sense of accomplishment as you build, craft, and explore so you really do feel like you're being successful.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993036518', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1479, 'last_played': 1524065534}
review: I've really tried to like this game ,but the rediculus amount of grinding you have to do to do even the simplest of things gets old within the first couple of hours and just keeps getting worse and worse. The game will make you collect large quantities of rare and semi rare drops from enemies that half the time won't drop anything at all. Once you finally do get everything your reward will be unlocking a basic crafting recipe that in any other crafting type game you would start with. After grinding through level after level and still just getting the most basic of crafting I finally just had to admit that this was a waste of money and an even bigger waste of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983434998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 1990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1990, 'last_played': 1515150319}
review:
Un petit plaisir, mais trop instable actuellement pour que je le recommande.

Si vous avez le malheur de vivre un crash in game, vous perdrez votre partie. Pas de syst√®me de sauvegarde en cloud qui puisse vous permettre de la r√©cup√©rer. Dommage.

J'ai ainsi commenc√© un game que j'ai perdue au bout de 10 heures de jeu. N'ayant pas eut envie de tout recommencer √©tant donn√© que tout prend quand m√™me pas mal de temps, j'ai laiss√© tomber. A part √ßa, le titre n'a pas de gros d√©fauts si ce n'est qu'il est un peu mou. Le craft est riche, le jeu est beau et les environnements a visiter sont vari√©s et agr√©ables. 

A voir sur la dur√©e si il devient plus attractif.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960566151', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1524021190}
review:
I was going to write a whole diatribe about my experience with this game but after looking at some reviews I think [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561197972200621/recommended/568570/]bigfoot's review[/url] down below says it best. 

[b]TL;DR:[/b] The "Losing items when you die" system wouldn't be that bad if you didn't have to [b][u]PAY TO LEVEL[/u][/b]. I'm fine with a "punishing" difficulty if need be, but this seems made to artificially inflate your time played by incredibly-grindy farming. Which is sad because I was kind of enjoying the game. Picked it up for $4 but I'm still refunding it. Someone with 20 more hours played than my 1 hour saying the same thing as me tells me that this game is going to have zero change in gameplay/enjoyment much later on.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996089634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1524002214}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972200621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1495, 'last_played': 1586268176}
review:
I was going to leave a review after only a few hours of playing because I wanted to vent my anger at the devs, but decided to hold off and push through some more levels.  I have reached level 7 and currently progressing very slowly towards level 8.

I say very slowly, but the devs have made it such a struggle to progress quickly.  While this could be a good thing they appear to have done it purely to extended your gameplay.  I see no other reason.

It's grindy, very grindy.  You farm to make something, using all your resources, to discover you now need to make something else, which requires some resources you have just used up plus others you have to grind away the hours for.  I personally don't mind grindy games, I actually quite enjoy it, but this game does really push me to my absolute limit.

With each level you have a number of objectives to complete, which can be tricky on it's own, but you also have to pay to move to the next level.  This payment is in gold/copper/resources or anything else they choose.  This is my 1st issue with the game.  There is no reason at all to justify this 'payment' other than to make you farm/grind for much longer than is necessary.  The game very quickly switches focus from survival and exploring to all about levelling-up.

When I reached level 6 and seeing the new stuff I could make, I did then see that more exploration would be possible.  The objectives were straightforward, albeit grindy, but the thing that made me scream out in pain was the payment of 5 gold bars (75 gold coins), plus some other stuff.  You only get coins from killing goblins, and they drop either gold but mostly copper coins, meaning I needed to kill a shed load to reach the next level, only to have them taken away from me when I did.  Again, the 'payment' system is unforgiving and unforgivable.

Combat!!  It's not really combat, more just hitting out until your enemy is dead.  I eventually found the best thing to do is to walk hit whilst walking backwards to try to avoid enemy hits.  If you attack one, every enemy around you will also attack.  If you get outnumbered, you're as good as dead, unless it's goblins as they are fairly easy.  You can't turn and run, because everything runs faster than you - I found this out when attacked by 2 boars - I ran butt they continued to attack me, and a fox joined in for the gits and shiggles.  No way to defined yourself.  This is the second issue with the game.

There are other niggles and dislikes, but the above 2 points really make the game frustrating and unenjoyable to play.  I bought the game at 50% off, and while it's very good for the value I believe the price should be ignored when reviewing a game.  I can't recommend the game.  If they sort it out by removing the level payments and improving the combat, I'll give it a thumbs up :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197993886588', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1356, 'last_played': 1649853551}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198023931705', 'num_games_owned': 1713, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1095, 'last_played': 1524951585}
review:
Excelente juego, lo ten√≠a en deseados, lo vi en oferta y lo compre, al principio me pareci√≥ ‚Äútosco‚Äù y los controles son algo ‚Äúparticulares‚Äù, aunque despu√©s de unos minutos ya est√° todo incorporado y se empieza a disfrutar. No solo me sorprendi√≥ para bien, sino que me tiene enamorado! debemos farmear much√≠simo, pelear, craftear y construir pero de una forma obligada bien integrada en un camino evolutivo de crecimiento muy logrado, creo que es el primer juego de este tipo que sabe utilizar el cumplimiento de los objetivos para ir avanzando y lo hace de una manera arm√≥nica, est√° muy bien balanceado en este aspecto y engancha much√≠simo. 
Por ah√≠ le√≠ unos comentarios donde mencionan que el juego es lento o que se tarda bastante, pero creo que la definici√≥n correcta es LABORIOSO, al que no le guste el hecho de tener que conseguir recursos y saberlos administrar para ir avanzando se va a quedar afuera de este juegazo, que promete, cumple con creses y tiene algunos detalles donde hace que sea un placer explorar, solo hay que jugarlo, el mismo juego se encarga de ense√±arte, guiarte y acompa√±arte, es fabuloso realmente, estoy a mitad de camino y ya me saca esta rese√±a personal y lo pagar√≠a nuevamente a precio completo (casi que me siento en deuda con los desarrolladores por pagarlo en oferta).
Hasta ac√° no me encontr√© ning√∫n bug, solo satisfacci√≥n, ganas de jugarlo, avanzar y disfrutar, ya veo venir que me voy a quedar con ganas de m√°s‚Ä¶ 
Lo √∫nico que podr√≠a pedir es m√°s espacio en base para guardar cosas (cofres y barriles) :D
RECOMENDADO A MAS NO PODER SE√ëORES!!!! Muchas gracias por esto!! aplausos......

author: {'steamid': '76561198025253042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1610988158}
review:
Aunque todavia no he completado el juego creo que ya he visto mas que suficiente para hacer un analisis.
Lo primero destacar que segun tengo entendido el juego lo ha realizado una o dos personas, ya sobre esta base entramos en la materia de como es el juego.
Es un juego bastante entretenido a mi manera de ver, tipo minecraft, empiezas como naufrago en una isla generada proceduralmente (isla aleatoria por partida), debemos ir poco a poco hacer una serie de misiones que consiste en crear cosas o recopilar ciertos items y conforme subimos de nivel aprenderemos nuevas formulas y podremos crear mas cosas.
La gente en los analisis se queja de que es un juego LENTO, a mi sinceramente no me lo ha parecido, ese es el encanto que tiene este juego, que vas poco a poco, no es el tipico juego que talas 2 arboles y ya puedes montar una granja.
Tiene multijugador cooperativo aunque yo aun no lo he podido probar (no tengo a nadie con quien jugar xDD).
¬øLo recomendaria? claro que si, pero unicamente a un tipo de publico concreto que le gusta jugar sin prisas y a juegos que te tienes que buscar la vida y que no buscan objetivos concretos si no que juegan por diversion y para desconectar del mundo real.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039468449', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1510, 'last_played': 1630584883}
review:
At fist a thought that it was lame‚Ä¶.it took too long to make something or even run somewhere.  But you get used to it. Took a little time to get all the control right and how to do stuff (and to just ignore the rabbits). A small tutorial option would be nice. 
I‚Äôm level 9 and I still think this is a very slow game‚Ä¶just to gather things‚Ä¶sloooowwww 
chopping wood even with the iron axe is still slow. I hope you make them better so you can feel a different. 
The quests I like a lot except the gather things to level up. a little different quests would be nice, its alot of build this make that.  Why gather tings to level up? Make more ‚Äúyou must do this before you can lv up‚Äù quests or an xp bar. I just skipped a lot of enemies just by chopping through the woods avoiding enemies and strait to the stone thing just to save health food and stamina for the gathering of gems (lv 8 to 9). 
And it would be nice if you can play with others trough internet‚Ä¶.I think that‚Äôs is a must nowadays to have with this kind of game. 

I hoped to see like a goblin house or something, goblinchests? The game feels abit stiff and lonely...maybe some random npc to save or intreact with? 

But overall I like it. I will play until Im tired of chopping wood slow.

pssst...were are the female character!????

author: {'steamid': '76561198002142971', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1524004155}
review:
This game has a LOT of potential. The main issue I have with it, is the multiplayer needs lots of work. The fact the players can only go so far from each other is a problem. I get the whole working together thing, but allowing players to move more freely from each other helps with the whole co-op thing. Especially when mobs start to despawn in already explored areas unless you're in single player mode.

Also, PLEASE ADD A SELECTION TO PLAY AS A FEMALE INSTEAD! Im a girl, I'd play to play as such.

author: {'steamid': '76561198314455800', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1382, 'last_played': 1689286068}
review: Muy buen juego! recomendado! voy 11 horas  y avance lo suficiente para decir que esta genial y muy completo. No se si haya final y no me importa, el hecho de poder construir, jugar cooperativo e investigar es genial. USEN SU IMAGINACION :D. Me gustaria poder formar parte del staff o grupo creativo para aportar al juego e incluso promocionarlo (: le veo gran potencial! JUEGUENLO, lleva su tiempo al principio pero se aprende rapido. SALUDOS!

author: {'steamid': '76561198386787182', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 395, 'playtime_forever': 2159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 415, 'last_played': 1586634439}
review:
"Force of Nature" wirkte auf mich im ersten Spieleindruck sehr einfach gehalten und r√ºckschrittlich. Will ich so etwas wirklich spielen? 
Doch dann habe ich an dieser Einfachheit gefallen gefunden. 
Ich f√ºhle mich entspannt in dieser Spielwelt. 
Die Reiz√ºberflutung und Kicks aus den modernen Spielen dieses Genres bleiben hier aus und sorgen so f√ºr Entschleunigung. 

Wer nach einem gem√ºtlichen Survival-Spiel sucht und keine hohen Anforderungen an Grafik und Spielmechanik hat, sollte FoN vielleicht mal ausprobieren.

review:
El juego en si, es fabuloso, entretiene bastante por la cantidad de cosas que se tiene que hacer y la verdad que su precio me ha dejado asombrado, porque ay juegos mas pobres de trabajo y son mucho mas caros.
Lo unico que le pongo en contra, es el poco espacio que te dan los baules para guardar cosas y la poca visibilidad que te da el personaje cuando esta apunto de morir y si me lo pongo a mirar bien, te acabas acostumbrando.
Por lo demas, yo no e visto que aya nada mas que me haga dudar de este gran titulo.
Saludos.

review:
The game is a bit robotic in the way it makes you do things. Its not like you can "multitask".  It has this "wanky" feel to it.. I see where the DEV was going but feel short.  Window means window... it locks you in and you cant get out of the window as I use 3 screens, I have to be able to get to other screens.. thats a  problem for me.. 

It needs to be smother having to cancel on each menu is just a pain in the butt... 

I like where its going but cant give a recommend at this time... maybe once you work out the basic problems..  

Problem list??? Where do I start....

Ya need to get you basic setting set first...
window... full screen... audio graphics... ya get that working first... 

If you looking to get this game be ready, your going to need lots of time...

ce ne sera pas le jeu du siecle, mais pour moins de 10 euros, c'est super. c'est agr√©able, pas trop gourmand, amusant et ca passe agr√©ablement le temps.

J'appr√©cie d'y jouer en solo. Et non je ne le trouve pas difficile. ne soyez pas Conan le barbare ou Scrubb! faut avancer p√©pere et √™tre prudent. Les monstres ne vous suivent pas longtemps, alors courrez .

author: {'steamid': '76561198195374435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1518986706}
review:
I wanted to give this game a little more time before I gave it a review, but I think I have a good enough idea considering how many other similar games I play to this one. (Keep in mind, this is based off of the questing mode, not creative).

Pros:
- I really like that there are quests.
- The graphics are nice. 
- It's harder than minecraft.
- Co-op is easy! I started a world and my husband was easily able to join me in a world I had started in single player.

Cons:
- You cannot move forward without completing the quests, you cannot level up and crafting is unavailable (besides the basics) until you level up (which in some way I do like, but some items would be nice earlier than when they are available to you).
- Combat isn't the best. You basically click until the enemy is dead or you're dead.
- It's a grinder. While, my favorite games are survival, open world, crafting games, this game takes a little more time than a lot of other games. Grinding seems necessary in these types of games but it's a little more than my, personal, liking.
- Crafting time, some items take an excessive amount of time, it seems. I don't mind that crafting takes time, but there were a few times I was just watching for a while because I was waiting for things to complete.
- For me, I want to be able to be efficient and by this I mean I want to be able to gather, build, or explore, while waiting for something to craft or build. Because of the points I made above, it felt like I was only focusing on one task at a time. I would gather one item, then another until I had everything for a crafting item or to complete a quest. I couldn't really deviate from the quests because in order to move forward you had to complete them.


So, I guess this game easily lost my interest. As you can see, I don't have very many hours in, I really wanted to like the game and I did enjoy it, but not enough for me to put more time in (it felt like work). Like someone else said, I wish there was a neutral option because I know this game could be enjoyable for people who don't mind the things I mentioned above, but if you're like me and you like seeing progress in a timely manner, it probably won't do it for you.

review:
Devido a la cantidad de comentarios diciendo que es un juego lento,
yo me tome el juego mas como un juego de supervivencia, que como un juego de construcciones. 
 (En menos de 70 horas ya tenia todo desbloqueado, el maximo nivel y misiones completadas. Juego terminado.)

 ¬øporque dicen es un juego lento?:
-las construcciones necesitan muchos recursos, algunos hay que craftearlos y estos pueden tardar "mucho" en crearse.

Para mi, el juego se me hizo corto, pero, me tubo enganchadisimo pensando en como economizar mis recursos y crafteando solo lo necesario y mas eficiente.

Mi puntuacion: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198029109271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 21092, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20787, 'last_played': 1701255851}
review:
je fais cette √©valuation car je vient juste de le terminer en mode hard core...
Que dire qui n'as pas √©t√© d√©j√† dit...compar√© √† Don't starve que je n'ai pas aim√© √† cause d'un craft totalement illogique ,de recherche continue de nourriture et de chauffage  pour finalement mourir plus tard car tu as trop coup√© de bois et que les monstres n'ont pas appr√©ci√© et te le font savoir en bande d'une douzaine...en plus c'est plutot moche alors de celui est vraiment beau.
Ce jeu n'est pas du bashing !! tu dois √©valuer tes chances et devoir kitter les mobs un par un si possible !!
La gestion de ton camp est de surtout cr√©er des labyrinthes de sortie afin qu'aucune bestioles de l'exterieur ne puisse y entrer.et mettre des lampes portables pour reperer les coins les plus surs !fa√ßon Petit poucet ! ^^
tous les mobs que tu as √©limin√©s ne respawn que lorsque tu quittes le jeu DONC D√®s que tu as la qu√™te de recherche du premier fragment et donc les portails de t√©l√©portation;
Tu dois prendre le temps de faire ton parcours pour poser ton portail le plus pr√®s possible du lieu , ne pas h√©siter √† contourner et ca prend un temps fou!! donc une foutue patience est de mise !
je n'ai mis que 7 portails en mode HC.
L'interface n'est pas vraiment tip top mais tu peux configurer les touches ..heureusement
Finalement pour gagner tu dois soit continuer a farmer des mobs voir memes des hard pour chopper hasardement des fragments de pierres pr√©cieuses.
Soit et c'est la l'astuce ultime et la beaut√© du  jeu !! faire pousser des roses !!!!
Ce n'est pas un jeu pour kikitoutdur car tu dois gerer ton equipement pour etre optimum selon les climats que tu traverses et la moindre erreur peut etre fatale!
La premi√®re partie t'apprend les r√®gles et la d√©couverte du jeu , H√©las tu dois refaire celle ci en mode hardcore sinon le succ√®s n'est pas valid√©..Confirmation apr√®s r√©ception d'un mail des Dev.
Le seul truc n√©gatif pour ma part est l'alchimie qui intervient quasiment trop tard et donc inutile quand tu connais tes possibilit√©s. ca aurait pu etre un must mais au d√©but..
Sinon j'ai vraiment transpir√© en √©vitant surtout de paniquer selon les situations et r√©ellement ador√© ce jeu...

author: {'steamid': '76561198015970646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5109, 'last_played': 1566932328}
review:
Force of Nature is a very good game in the crafting, building, and survival genres.
I would very much like to try the Co-op in FoN.

For the price, FoN is a great singleplayer experience.
The game feels very complete and there are no additional in-app purchases needed to enjoy the game.

The game is properly challenging, but careful preparation should allow you to prevail. This is a game with a goal to reach, collect the FoN shards and assemble the FoN artifact. So much more than just an aimless sandbox building/survival game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198009351603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 4105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4105, 'last_played': 1490414388}
review: I poured a good chunk of time into this and enjoyed it for the most part.  Oddly, the game becomes really lonely after a while.  You keep building what starts to look like a town, but there's no NPCs to share it with, no other players to interact with and after a while it kind of feels pointless as a result.  If I could give this a nuetral rating  I would, as it stands it nudges into a positive 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021878614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 2112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1876, 'last_played': 1517536956}
review: This game is more or less a grind-fest with generally simple mechanics. If you have little to zero patience for grinds, I'd avoid it.  Otherwise, this one will keep you busy for a while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198389890263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1700034034}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002356718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1252, 'last_played': 1520282467}
review:
In spite of the great price for the amount of content you get I just can't reccomend this game due to the tedium it involves. 

Hacking your way though the same enemies again and again so that you can collect enough gold pieces, etc. in order to level up(which is required to be able to build more buildings and craft more items) again really detracts from what would otherwise be an enjoyable game.

Eventually the game became more of a source of stress than a source of enjoyment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974854710', 'num_games_owned': 566, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 150, 'last_played': 1635630581}
review:
The price is nearly right for this game but I would say it's still a little high due to the lack of content this games got. The graphics are very bad for a game in 2018 there is a lot of '' Early Access '' games that don't have this issue so this game shouldn't either. The character creation is not very well made and limited to what you can do. The in-game objects clip a lot and you can find yourself inside a rock more times than not. 

The fighting style is generic and something that you could make yourself in one of them game building programs you can find on steam. The mace is really slow and not a very good weapon to fight with when you have multiple enemies around you. 

The objects seem like they have been imported from an old ''sims island'' game and you can't really build anything nice it's all been preset up for you. The play style is very slow and time-consuming with all the resource you need to gather just to build a small object.

I wouldn't recommend this game to anyone I know and I think there is a lot of other options that are on the market that you could try before paying money for this game. I will attach some screenshots to my profile so people can see some of the in-game objects and how they look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045765418', 'num_games_owned': 2112, 'num_reviews': 776, 'playtime_forever': 2938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1806, 'last_played': 1586965440}
review:
Very good sandbox with nice sounds. Music for now notice only one, for couple min. Was great but sadly only one time it appeard and suddenly. We land on beach in random generated world. Gather, build/create, explore and fight. We must explore to win, go further in forest to taiga and jungle. Make food, tame animals and create items that will help you to survive. World is full of foxs, bears, goblins and many more enemies that want you dead. You can play with couple friends with ease. Game is worth buyin' and playin'.

Controls are easy to learn and you can change them. Graphic is simple, no much of effects but gameplay it's his magic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043139843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 28303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13121, 'last_played': 1622512741}
review:
Hello all who read this.
This game is so time consuming and the rewards are not that great. It would be nice if you could plant the trees and they would grow back. I have been through every map and I have got almost all the Stone.
It would be nice if the Stone came back like from a earth quake or some FORCE OF NATURE.
As you play you see that all the monsters re-spawn and in bigger numbers as you level up.
The end reward for the game is by far the worst I have ever seen in a video game.
But if you have NOTHING to do in your life then this game will keep you busy right up to the end. 
I hate how the things you fight just run away I did find away around this and it works every time because you can not chase them down. The trick is to know how much your main weapon will do with one swing. then hit the bad guy with a hit from the pick or the axe then switch to the main weapon and one hit kill. 
Most people say you get what you pay for and that is very much so for this game.
It most defiantly needs some updates that will make it a better game.
I do recommend this game because it is fun to play
I have to say playing the game 4 times at over 100 hrs of game play each game has severely retarded my life. This word just means slow and everything you have to do in the game is slower than a heard of turtles. I have found that playing the game in the Sandbox mode with no restrictions has it's rewards. Like in the quest part of the game you get only one ally in the sandbox mode you can have as many as you want.
However I have not been able to trap anything but Goblins for alleys.
but you get 20 of them and nothing will last very long LOL.
It would be nice if there was more gold and more use for gold in the game
I would like to see you to be able to go to the lake and pan for gold and then melt it into bars. If they ever get an expansion out for this game it would need to have about 10 more levels. Because topping out at level 13 and having to kill 22ed level bad guys
is really hard. some golden arrows would be nice.
You really don't need to cheat in this game just use the bushes and trees to your advantage if you build stuff the monster will hack on it and you just hit him with the arrow. the monsters hate your buildings and will do anything to kill it. Use this to time to kill them OR run. 
In the sandbox mode I have about 18 of every animal and 30 wells it makes the game very easy. well hope this helps all of you see yea

author: {'steamid': '76561198244662622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1521048318}
review: I really wanted to like this game, and I did enjoy it for a while.  I like crafting, farming, and building and exploring, and as far as I got, this was great.  As has been said, there is a lot of grinding, but I didn't mind that.  To craft more things and better gear, you have to level up - no surprise.  I got to level 7 and had to find another Nature shard to get to 8.  But between me and that shard was a broad band of dense, mostly dead vegetation (which you have to use an axe to cut through), where the temperature was too hot for my beduoin gear (helps you keep cool), which was also filled with monsters way above my level.  If it has been more open, or less hot, I think I could have made it through by eating continuously to keep my health up, but I tried for HOURS.  I just couldn't get through that area without dying.  The map is different each game, but I'm not willing to go back and start over from scratch hoping I get a map that is doable.  So I am done.  Maybe my experience is a one-off.  I hope so.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081316136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1677, 'last_played': 1528513680}

author: {'steamid': '76561198153155416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1786, 'last_played': 1697313212}
review:
I really do enjoy this game. Pretty easy to get yourself pretty involved in it. What I learnt is that certain areas are better for certain resources than others. Like the winter deadland is best for sticks. Jungle is best for pawnleaves. Beach is - of course - sand. 

The only thing that really annoyed me was the fact that if you saved and exited, you wouldn't load back to where you were before you exited. You have a specific save point, which would either be where you started, or a portal you set. I have used this to my advantage (agroed like 3 bears, 3 goblins, several boars and foxes - long story), so I just exited and viola! I am back at camp. But when you are trying to streamline to a "Force of Nature" shard and you run out of time and you don't want to plop a portal down yet, it can be such a pain. 

I also like to pick on location with a neutral temp (so I can wear anything there without issues) and just build everything there. All my portals are placed right where I destroy and collect the "Force of Nature" shard. I just use those portals to get to different biomes for resources faster and to have a headstart toward the next shard. 

Overall, love this game. Definately worth the buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977880088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1519671568}
review:
Da ich gerne Ark und Rust spiele, habe ich mir dieses Spiel gekauft.
Die Grafik, nunja Geschmackssache. Ist mal was anderes.

Viele Leute schrieben das das Spiel sehr " klobig " sei.
Dem kann ich 100% zustimmen.
Der Charakter spielt sich sehr sehr altbackend. Mir f√§llt aktuell kein Spiel ein wo die Bewegung so hakelig war.
Fifa98, 20 Jahre her. So in etwa l√§uft der Charakter bei Force of Nature auch.
Oft bleibt man mit dem Charakter an irgendwelchen Ecken sinnlosen Ecken h√§ngen.

Den Charakter selbst kann man keineswegs anpassen. Lediglich die Hautfarbe und die Farbe der Hose.

Es gibt wirklich keinen Grund, wirklich keinen sich dieses Spiel zu kaufen. Ich hab es logischerweise zur√ºckgegeben.


Fazit : Man h√§tte daraus echt etwas machen k√∂nnen. Aber ein in der Art liebloses Spiel mit sehr schlechter Engine hat kein Platz in meiner Bibliothek verdient. Nein.Nein und nochmal Nein.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048448030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1269, 'last_played': 1521601248}
review:
Game is alot of fun, graphics are good. However this game is alot more grindy than anticipated, not to mention that as you get higher in the levels resources become more problematic to find ( as you have all ready mined most of the ore around you for previous levels ups ) 

   That being said, the only thing that really vexes me about this game, is the lack of fences early on in the levels. ( all the animals you get are stupid and will walk right towards enemies outside of your area ) We should be able to craft fences around lv 3 or so. that way we can pen the animals for their safety and the players sanity.

All in all, I give this game a 7 / 10.  not a bad game at all, and very enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008376208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 3585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3435, 'last_played': 1521350940}
review:
I do not recommend this game.  I can handle the grinding of gathering materials, making stuff, repetitive, boring combat.  I simply CANNOT tolerate losing a ton of stuff every time you die.  Trust me on this one.  if it irritates you to lose items on death, then this game will royally piss you off.  I am talking about losing hours worth of effort that it took to gather items and craft them and such.

Do not buy this game if that bothers you.  It is VERY easy to die.  All it takes is one of your tamed animals that you didn't manage to get to follow you back to your safe area to get attacked, and collect a big train, and then run close to you, and you are screwed.  You drop hundreds of items.

Yes, you can just run around with minimal resources in your pack, but at some point, you're going to need to carry stuff such as portal materials.  Dying and losing it sucks.  They need to let a corpse drop so you can go retrieve it.  Still a risk involved, but not so punishing as to make the game unfun.

tldr: If you have a NetFlix account, then you can find some joy in a game where stamina regen is terrible.  Just alt tab out and watch some flix, and come back and do 2 more fights, then rinse repeat. :p

If you feel like you can tolerate the "features" of the game I document below, then buy it.  Otherwise, I wouldn't.

[u]Update 1:[/u]

Run speed is a bit slow.  Glad there is fast travel, but even quick travel is a joke.  You cannot put portals too close to each other, so you still end up slooooow jogging a lot.  I can't imagine how bad it would be if you have to slow foot it all over the place every single time.

[u]Update 2:[/u]

Stamina regen is a bad joke.  I spend 90% of my time waiting on it.  Even eating food like bananas doesn't help that much.  This is a very negative aspect of this game, and I can see it causing me to stop playing.

Update -> To be fair, coffee helps with this, but you gotta grind up the materials to keep stocked up on coffee.  Early game is brutal, but the grind is always there.

[u]Tip 1:[/u]

[spoiler]Fight animals that flee near thick vegetation.  They'll often get stuck in the vegetation so you can catch them and finish them off.  I did that to two foxes so far.  VERY satisfying.[/spoiler]

[u]Tip 2:[/u]

[spoiler]Running into the middle of vegetation will sometimes make it so animals do not follow.  It's saved me a few times.[/spoiler]

[u]You gotta be kidding me #1:[/u]

1 strawberry = 7 hp in 10 seconds
1 strrawberry juice which requires 2 strawberries is 12 hp in 10 seconds.

You're better off eating two strawberries unless you are in a tough fight and the few extra hp might help.

[u]You gotta be kidding me #2:[/u]

The well can only hold 6 water at a time.  Yes, that's right boys and girls, you have to micromanage the collection of water.  Everything in the game is a grind.  I'm pretty much ok with that, but having to micromanage gathering water out of the well?  Nah, that's not cool.

[u]You gotta be kidding me #3:[/u]

You drop a crap ton of stuff EVERY death.  I had 13 cooked meat.  Lost 7 of them and literally about 30 other items in my inventory.  I should have read up more on this game.  Never would have bought it.  Death penalty is too severe considering how easy it is to die early on.

[u]You gotta be kidding me #4:[/u]

The sheer volume of materials needed to do anything in the game is pretty much over the top.  15 gold coins to get one gold ingot... [spoiler]It takes killing a lot of goblins to get 15 gold coins.[/spoiler]

[u]You gotta be kidding me #5:[/u]

Here is a good example of how ridiculous crafting is.

To make leather gloves, you need 14 pelts and 10 ropes with 2 burlap.  14 pelts shuld be enough to make 14 pairs of gloves.  You could hang 10 people with 10 ropes at the same time.  Utterly ridiculous.

Suggestions:

1-Increase movement speed.  An 80 year old man can move faster than my avatar.

2-Make it so when you die, you have a chance to recover your stuff.  Put a timer on it, but if you get back in time, you can get your stuff back.

3-Lower the resource requirements for things like armor and weapons.  14 hides for a pair of gloves is frankly stupid.

4-I spend way too much time alt tabbed watching netflx or surfing the web.  A game should not be so tedious as to make you feel like you have to to do this to prevent boredom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076744941', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 4315, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1910, 'last_played': 1626156785}
review:
Cute, fun, relaxing game for a low price. I got this on sale for 50% off, so for me this feels like a real bargain. If you've got the survival/builder itch, give this a try. It *is* a slower paced game however, so keep that in mind.
 
Update: This game has gotten a little hate lately, so I want to give my 2 cents on a couple points: 

1: Chunkiness: I despise clunkers, like, I cannot play them for very long before getting disgusted and consider them bad games. This game is not what I'd call clunky. It's no Japanese fighter, sure, but if you compare it to say, Mass Effect 4 (or even a Bethesda game), it ain't got nothin' on that clunk. 
2: Graphics, honestly, despite the basic graphics, it still offers a lot of beauty. Flowery forests, sunset beaches, etc. I really enjoy the scenery in the game.
3: Content/play time: I have 51 h ours in this game, between 2 worlds I started. There is *plenty* to do, collect, and build for a very long time. That being said, yes, I really would have really loved to see some updates and new content, but you'll get your money's worth out of this. 

Pros: 
-Fun mix of a little combat, farming, building, crafting and exploration. 
-Despite the basic graphics, the game can still be very pretty

Cons: 
-Spacing/spawning of enemies can be a bit silly at times. You can be running around with no monsters in sight and all the sudden you come across 3 bears, 2 goblins and a boar all at once and you don't have a chance of fighting them. 
-I have to restart the game every 30 minutes because at about that time, it starts lagging big time, like, Kenshi bad lagging. But once I restart the game, it's fine again for another 30 minutes.

Other notes: 
-As I mentioned before, it would have been nice if they added updates and new, fun stuff to build, but they didn't really do that. The game does feel finished, but a few more touches would have been nice. 
-I honestly think the interface/controls are fine. You do need to take a moment to get used to it, but once you do it makes sense for this type of game (you can harvest/keep track of your farm pretty efficiently) and I'm all for developers trying new things. The camera angle won't let you look directly up, and this is annoying though. 
-There isn't exactly a story. You do have quests, which is nice, but it's just telling you what you should build next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047875535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2282, 'last_played': 1606383090}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030010932', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1521148510}
review:
PLEASE READ BEFORE BUYING

I only just picked up this game about an hour ago, I like it but here are some Pros & Cons! 

Pros:
- Has great potential as a Game.
- Easy to Pick up.
- Crafting in the game does really deep and only just at the entry crafting!
- It's worth the Price! (Paid: ¬£5.79 GBP)

Cons:
- Graphics are not the best in the world, but are perfectly fine.
- No Music, really needs some sort of music
- A.I. has bugs, plus unfair towards player (eg. animals and goblins will work together to gang up on you).
- Player can get stuck in certain places with no way out.
- SFX need more some work, as comes from the other direction of Animal/Goblin so will end up running into them instead of away from them.
- Needs more work, as it's lagging for my Heavy Gaming PC Rig. 

Misc:
- Has a grind, you either hate it or like it.
- Story is 50/50 so not sure what to say about it.
- World gets genterated and makes some good and bad areas to work with.


Overall, it's a good game but does need a TON of work to make it better in a number of areas. 
So for my score for the game, I give it a "6/10"

I am going to keep on playing this, but will give another review in 6 months to see if it's any better.

review: It is grindy and i enjoy grindy.  Everything made sense and worked properly.  Use 2 weapons and swap back and forth for each hit otherwise 2 or more enemies will gobble you up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139533833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 492, 'last_played': 1601607476}
review: I was surprised by how fun this game is to play. It reminds me a little of old-school runescape but with the solitary aspects that I prefer in sandbox games. The UI is a little clunky and hard to navigate at first, but you get used to it. I hope there will be some updates to make the UI a little easier to manage and a little more intuitive. That aside, I'm having a great time playing this and I find the recommended quests to be helpful as a new player.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011757785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1519533166}
review: The controls and perspective are not quite garbage, but are close enough to make me want to quit.  The game honestly feels as cheap as the price I got it for... which oddly enough is unacceptable to me.  Just because a game is cheap doesn't make it worth my time.  Refunded within 10 min.  If you are on the fence, go ahead and try it out.  If the presentation turns you away from it as fast as it did for me then refund.  In my opinion it isnt worth playing though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982395611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2988, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2699, 'last_played': 1520567814}
review:
Description:
Crafting, survival, open world, and sandboxy.

Pros:
The game has a decent environment for protecting you from harm in the early game which helps to minimize pointless frustration.  The level system accurately and efficiently guides the player through the tech tree, and each level's build requirements force the user to stretch their skills and knowledge and force exploration of the map outside of the player's comfort zone.  

Building caps per level (e.g. - you can only have 2 wells until you level up further) keep you focused on the next construction project needed to level up and minimize the tendency of some players (me) to build bases that sprawl endlessly.  Portals are built into the vanilla tech tree and dying sets the player back a reasonable amount without brutally punishing them.

Cons:
The controls work efficiently but the overall usability could use a 15-20% improvement before I would call it intuitive and frictionless.  The map is large but the biomes are lacking in features and unique areas that would encourage exploration for the sake of exploration.  The main menu has a humorous combination of being both confusing and easy to use.  For example, 1) a friend can't join my world if I started a single player session but if I exit and load the same game as multiplayer (by clicking "Start a new game" for some reason), they're automatically alerted that I've created a lobby if the game is open.

Overall, the pros outweigh the cons by a significant margin and this is a pretty great buy for the price, especially for lower-end computers that might struggle to keep up with modern crafting games.
