author: {'steamid': '76561198061801907', 'num_games_owned': 268, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1519590102}
review:
This game is an odd case. I've been enjoying aspects of the game, and I'm probably going to persist with it for a bit longer - it isn't a total disaster, and there's a lot of potential here to make a great game - but there are too many things which are frustrating or annoying or just plain stupid to be able to give this a recommend.

Firstly, the controls.

The controls are the absolute worst I have ever encountered in a first person game. 
You will be constantly, every few seconds throughout the game, flicking between two completely different interfaces with different controls, and this is the biggest most fundamental flaw this game has.

It's a first person game with standard WASD movement and mouse look, but only while all you want to do is move around or attack something. This is the first of the two control interfaces, and one that any gamer will be familiar with.

As soon as you need to interact in any other way, with any other aspect of the game (even as simple as picking up items from the floor) you have to flick to the other control method, which is still WASD movement, but you now have a mouse pointer you can use to click on items to pick them up or interact with - which are invariably too far away, prompting an error message telling you to move closer - or to use the many menus which appear onscreen as well for crafting, construction, etc. Crucially, as your mouselook has been replaced with a pointer for interfacing with, you now cannot turn or rotate your character whatsoever - you're stuck strafing, facing in whatever direction you were looking in when you switched to it, until you subsequently decide to switch back. If you get attacked or sudddenly need to turn around for whatever reason, while you're trying to craft something or pick up items, the first thing you will have to do is switch back to the other control method before you can even think of doing the simple basic task of facing your opponent.

What makes it worse is that items on screen that you can interact with (be it things to pick up, things to harvest, or crafting stations) are only highlighted when you are in "mouse pointer" mode so if you're running about looking for stuff, you will need to perpetually switch in and out of "mouse pointer" mode just to see the items highlighted on screen. 

On the plus side, this double control interface thing is actually reasonably seamless - you can switch from one to the other by tapping "Q" (although if you have any menus open when switching out of "mouse pointer" mode, you will need to double tap "Q" as the first tap will only close the menus - another annoyance). And if you just need to quickly dip in to the other control interface, you can hold spacebar to do so, and releasing it will switch back. 

But for all this complexity, forcing you to spend 50% of the game unable to turn your character, and the relentless error messages when you try to click on an item that you're not standing pretty much on top of "please move closer!", you can't help but feel that it could have been made infinitely more slick by simply highlighting objects you can interact with when you move close to them, and then having a keypress to interact with the nearest one. It seems a LOT of effort to give you a point-and-click interface for interaction, when you still have to move your character right next to the thing anyway, negating any need to have moved a mouse pointer over to it in the first place.

Next, combat

Combat is just DULL. It's the worst. You have one attack (whatever weapon you have currently crafted) and you just stand next to a gremlin and click the button. You do an attack and then wait around 1 second to recover before you can do it again. You will get hit one time while recovering, then you repeat. There's no skill, or tactic. You just stand there and click a bit. They can't see you from very far away, so if there's a bunch of them in one place you can walk towards them until the nearest one spots you and runs over to fight you (its friends won't bother), you can deal with that one by itself then repeat to pick off the others one by one. It's so tedious that when the game quests demand that I collect gold coins (only obtained from killing gremlins) I find myself shutting the game down until I can be bothered tomorrow. The game only really started to get fun once I'd cleared a decent area of the map out from enemies, so I could actually run around undisturbed - now the game is telling me (in my latest quest) that I have to build a bed for sleeping on, and that if I sleep  on it then enemies will respawn. This may be the thing that makes me abandon the game, forcing me to grind through this most tedious of tasks over and over.

Right - graphics.
The graphics are basic but functional, at least everything is clear, but it all looks a bit 2005. The render horizon is so close it's ridiculous, things fade into view from approximately 10m away, and the solution for keeping things visible when you're walking near trees is to simply cut those trees down temporarily (they literally just turn into tree stumps if they would obscure your view)

You can't zoom in or out at all, and you can't even look up. 

Also the boundary clipping around objects that stops you walking past them is just ridiculous. Plenty of gaps that look like you can walk through them, turns out that bit of twig poking out at knee height means nope you really cannot go that way. 

I haven't even really started on the game itself yet. The crafting is a real grind. There's only so many "oh so I need to collect 50 of those to make 20 of those to make 10 of these to make this new weapon that will improve my attack speed by slightly less than 2%" before you just say sod it and walk away. Everything is just so slow, and marred by more annoying "features". You can do basic crafting from a menu in the interface, more complicated crafting requires you to go to a crafting station. Things crafted at a crafting station will remain at the station until you collect it (some of them take several minutes so you will run off and come back when it's finished). Fair enough. But the basic items you craft in your crafting menu, which you can do anywhere at any time, will remain *stuck in your crafting menu until you go back into it to collect them*. Literally, the first time you craft something you'll be thinking "great, now where is it". It's not in your inventory. No. It's in your crafting menu, waiting for you to click "take" on it. Despite several hours in, this still trips me up. I'll be at a crafting station trying to make a thing I need "oh I need 20 rope, ok cool I can make that in my menu, I just need to collect some leaves first". Go and collect leaves. Craft 20 rope. Go back to crafting station to make the thing "not enough rope". WHAT? Oh yeah. Have to go back into my crafting menu, collect the rope, put it in my inventory, now I can go back into the crafting station menu and craft the thing. The game is literally holding me up because it requires me to move an item from one part of my inventory to another before it will recognise it. Oh and you can't queue items for production anywhere, not in your basic crafting nor in the crafting stations. You have to wait for current production to finish before you can start a new one.

Bored yet? You're probably beginning to get an idea of what the game is like. "Oh these items need 45x soil to craft them, I'll just go and get that". Stands character over soil, and holds mouse button for literally three solid minutes. That's the standard of grinding in this. Endless "go here and hold your mouse button for at least 75 seconds".

From the preview videos it looks pretty slick, but be aware that almost all of the clips shown of gameplay have been sped up significantly.

I really wanted to like this game, and it really seems to have some potential, but honestly, I hate it so much, and it makes me feel like the devs really hate me when I play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051769404', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 12977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3300, 'last_played': 1592182104}
review:
If you are reading the reviews then you are considering buying the game. Buy the game. I got the game in a hunt for games my wife might be willing to play (she is not a gamer to the tune of outrage that she had to use W to move forward). After playing for a couple hours I decided I was going to devote an unhealthy amount of time to this game regardless of whether or not it piqued my wife's interest. She finally gave it a shot and is now hooked. This game is for literally Everyone 10+!

Pros
Easy streamlined interaction with world objects
Tons of crafting & building
Farming, fishing, adventuring alone or with your trusty chicken (or friends I guess)
When confronted with a choice between realism and game experience, the game seems to opt for the latter - initially I thought that being unable to walk through the bushes was stupid. Then I realized the goblin things and bears couldn't get through either. Then it occurred to me that I wouldn't walk through a damn bush in the woods IRL without an axe or something either.

Cons
No female player model - even something basic would be much appreciated!
Fog is depressing - the draw distance is short (I understand why, but it is almost oppressive)
Game is too cheap - I know that sounds crazy, but this IS at least a $20 game, so the $10 list price undersold the quality and content of the game by quite a bit

tl;dr: Buy at least 2 copies of this game, even if you're not sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053486643', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1519515699}
review:
I'm giving a positive, but it's a frustrating game in a number of ways.

The combat and resource gathering can be frustrating. Heavy stamina drain, dodge consisting of walking backwards (which usually just makes you miss more often and still end up getting hit quite a bit by the enemy) isn't much use. Would kill for a roll-dodge or even a block or something other than just watching that three-second-swing over and over. A slow cumbersome weapon (cudgel) when we can craft metal axes and picks early on but get stuck with a slow haymaker weapon is frustrating. Rough aiming with the bow with arrows that seem to get blocked by everything including the terrain and the far edges of pine trees.

Leveling up is a bit annoying. You gain levels not by actions but by doing quests. Some quests, such as getting 5 gold, are unecessarily painful, and require that you get lucky on drops from mobs as they often drop copper rather than gold coins. So it takes 15 gold coins to make one bar, and you need to get 75, and thats just to get to level 7. Did i mention combat is frustrating. ^^ (mainly this is annoying because it's not just holding you back from gaining some quest reward, it's holding you back from reducing the frustrations involved in crafting that comes with leveling up and gaining either more things to do while the items slowly craft themselves out, or by giving you more of the crafting buildings to do more stacks at once, or work on multiple items that that particular crafting building type is required to create).

There is no way to fast transfer from your inventory into storage (such as shift/alt/ctrl-click to move stacks) though there is an option to quickly fill a box with like items which is handy but not as much as a quick stack transfer.

Resource gathering, combat, and everything in general is made less enjoyable by an overly demanding stamina system. The stamina drains so fast that the only way to mine, fight, chop trees, hack bushes, etc is by rapidly spamming sunflower seeds, or eating other things that have longer delays before your allowed to eat more. I like a stamina system normally, it represents cost for action which adds a degree of realism, but in this case it's overkill and just punishes the player for wanting to try to do anything in the game.

Animals need to be hand fed food/water to produce a single cycle and provide a resource. There should be a way to just supply stacks to the animal and let it produce while you wander off and do something else. Instead, you feed it, wait for a slow timer to cycle through after a few seconds, then feed it again. Make it like a crafting table where you put in stacks and get stacks slowly back instead of having to hang around and feed them this way. Too monotonous even with a bunch of the same animal.

Limitations on number of crafting buildings means that you can't just put down five forges to quickly spam out a bunch of bars, or put down five cooking tables to quickly make a bunch of foods. Nope, instead you have to sit and wait or wander off and do something else while items slowly craft themselves out. Did I mention combat and resource gathering are frustrating? To add to this limitation, the buildings have a set number of slots for tools, some different tool sets are required to craft different items. SO either you have a building devoted to one type of crafting and another building to another type of crafting (since the number of those crafting buildings you can have are limited by level), or you have to swap tools and store those unneeded tools somewhere to spam craft stuff while you wander off to do something else, since crafting items can take quite a bit of time.

Anyway enough frustrations... the game is pretty well put together for all. I haven't come across any bugs while playing. The sounds and visuals are decent. There looks to be plenty of content. For all not a bad game and reasonably priced.  So despite what I don't like about it, and in spite of my frustrations, I'll probably continue to play it from time to time to unlock more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973376656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1519017195}

author: {'steamid': '76561197973630764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1575311440}
review:
I found this game pretty poor, even consideringthe price tag. 

The controls and UI are clunky and take a while to get used to. It feels like a browser game from a few years ago.

Unfortunately I found more that I didn't like about this game than I liked. 

You don't gain XP from killing or crafting but have to complete set tasks for the next level. Sadly the devs missed an oppotunity here because the tasks are almost always just a grindy as xp farming.

The story is non existant, something about portals, doesnt really explain why you are there or what you are trying to do.

Some of the other features involve needing to domesticate chickens before you can make bread for some bizzarre reason. Domesticated pigs provide you with worms and you need to melt down dozens of gold coins to make a button compass that doesnt point north. 

This game seems to be trying to take all of the features of other similar games, but dilvering them in a very poor way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023681591', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2452, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1059, 'last_played': 1573301412}

√â um jogo interessante. bastante complexo. um pouco travado no combate, mas acredito q seje intencional, por se tratar aparentemente de nosso personagem ser uma crian√ßa. Acho que esta faltando um ou mais NPCs para ajudar nas fazendas. pois ter q alimentar um de cada animal por vez e plantar cada canteiro individualmente, acaba se tornando algo extremamente massante e repetitivo. que no momento acabou sendo o principal motivo por eu nao voltar a joga-lo por enquanto. Entao fica a dica para os desenvolvedores: adicionem ou um npc para ajudar na fazenda (pod ser ateh um goblin) ou um cocho para alimentar os animais. e as planta√ßoes serem necessario mais dias para produzir e produzir mais, para q nao tenhamos q ficar replantando todo dia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198150182105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 184, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 151, 'last_played': 1656615905}
review: I am new to this game but I like it. I think it has a great potential. I find it a bit hard, but I am getting used to it. Pretty hard to earn the gold coins at the beginning, I already died a few times and lost a lot of stuff... but I actually really enjoy this game. The graphic is simple but still very realistic and nice and I think there is heaps to do. It is definitely a game I will be going back to and looking forward to next levels and new opportunities. The forest is a dangerous place when you a newbie , half naked and with a poor weapon :) But I am hoping it will get easier in time. So far I have nothing against the game and I really enjoyed it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032644791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 1169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 881, 'last_played': 1518792877}
review:
Easily one of the better games I have played. Could hardly stop long enough to write this review.

Overview:
You start out on the shores of who knows where and how you got there... well that doesn't matter. As you need to scavenge for your suvival.

From beach torn shorts to blazing glory you can hunt, craft, and tame things around you. As you work your way through quest after quest you grow stronger and the monsters you venture across become not only more dangerous but bigger and more blood thirsty.

Gameplay:
I would have to say for a game that has only been out for a little under 2 months. This is already a great game with hours and hours of fun for you and your friends. The fact that Multiplayer is easy as saving and switching worlds makes this fun for everyone.

Crafting, Building, Farming, Taming, Fishing, Fighting, and more... this game has it all. I can't wait to see what updates come out in the future. I hope they add more things to tame and more of a free roam feel with out the quests being the main progression.

Pros:
Great game play, a lot of things to do and a lot of different places to explore.

Easy if you want, excruciatinly difficult if you want as well.

Graphics are fairly decent and several different times I found myself just looking around... at what I built, at the wild, and at the beaches.

Multiplayer really is awesome, easy as switching a previously saved world to the multiplayer mode.

Random Generated worlds.... differnt every time. Gotta love that.

Cons:
Grind grind grind grind.... Takes a lot of time to advance to the next phase/crafting/equipment 

The only thing you can tame that helps you fight is the goblin... kinda boring and not very useful.


To sumerize I think it was easily worth the $7 I spent on it and would for sure recommend this game to anyone looking to spend a few hours in a great game, farming, buildling, and having fun with or without your friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198164600074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1519518039}
review: I absolutely love this game!  I'm so glad I bought it. It is totally worth the price, and for less than 6 dollars Canadian, you really can't go wrong. author: {'steamid': '76561198037319778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 10231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3832, 'last_played': 1652177829}
review:
Firstly, the game is well worth the money, but it is very annoying to actually play.

The combat is boring.  The progression system was made by someone who is clearly super pedantic and sets out to annoy you with illogical nonsense.  E.g. I can make a anvil easily, but cant make an iron weapon because the stupid quest system hasnt unlocked it yet...seriously?  Are you trying to make this as annoying as possible?  The other thing is you're walking along trying to see forward and suddenly half a dozen animals ambush you, which means you lose loads of stuff that took innumerable mouse clicks to acquire.

I recommend the game because it's super cheap for the effort that went into it, but the author really designed it to be as annoying as possible,

author: {'steamid': '76561198139298288', 'num_games_owned': 2920, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1555199397}
review:
El juego es muy bueno, ya que con el paso del tiempo el desarrollador si lo ha estado mejorando.
Los mundos se generan aleatoriamente, todos los mapas son enormes, todo se puede destruir para craftear, las criaturas se regeneran, los animales igual,etc.

Tiene modo supervivenc√≠a y modo mision.
Los gaficos estan bien junto con los efectos visuales, la jugabilidad es igual que minecraft y terraria.
Yo fui uno de los primeros que compro el juego y la verdad esta muy bien. la comunidad ya cada vez es mas grande.

author: {'steamid': '76561198390426265', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1596926162}
review:
Juegaso me encanto es muy entretenido!
si lo que buscas es pasar un rato explorando y construyendo pacificamente este es el juego que estabas buscando! 
Aunque si quieres algo de accion y pelea tambien lo tiene! 
<3
lo unico malo es que hay un poco de desbalance en cuanto a los recursos que requiere craftear ciertos materiales como el cristal es muy caro obtenerlo y solo sirve para botellas!
espero que con las actualizaciones esto mejore

author: {'steamid': '76561198045735466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2812, 'last_played': 1609468380}
review:
Fun little game. 

Survival, Crafting, and Adventure. 

The controls feel a little clunky until you get used to the quirks and shortcuts. Once you do itplays very nice.

100% worth the low cost - I'd say it gives quite a few 20$ games a run for their money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995142404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 5534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1686, 'last_played': 1557613186}
review:
Having a very fun time!  It's survival and crafting in its purest form.  

Graphics are very nice.  The survival mode has a very linear levelling/quest system which I appreciate: limits the player's focus early on while gradually adding quests that introduce new mechanisms and craft items.  

I paid less than $4 for it!  How can this be??

There's a bit of a fanatasy element to the game as well - you'll be combating goblins, skeletons, as well as natural predators.  

Can be a little on the grindy side, with slower pace.  But it's not too bad and is adding a harsh survival aspect to the early game.  Better tools and some neat devices will help speed things along as you progress. 

Liking it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080268954', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 2347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2153, 'last_played': 1518480770}
review:
I won't lie, this game is a slow and painful grind. If you're looking for story it isn't here. That does not mean it is a bad game. It runs on my potato of a laptop VERY well. As far as I can understand, most resources are finite and it pushes you to progress. 

If you are looking for a relaxed casual survival game with freedom to explore slowly, this is probably not for you.

Good:
- Pretty graphics
- Nice sounds
- Crafting recipies are easy and available in the menu, so you don't have to look up a guide
- I think the worlds are randomly generated but don't quote me on that
- Very bingable
- Very easy for beginners, the quest system basically holds your hand the whole way but you can do things at your own pace
- Controls are easy to get used to and use
- Very polished

Bad:
- Building things indoors is a complete pain because you can barely fit anything into 1 building. As for solutions to this maybe they can make it so 2 of the same houses being next to each other can connect or generally increasing the capacity of a house. (By houses i mean all of the indoor buildings)
- Questionable replay value. The game takes so long to do a lot of things
- Missing the value of all the ore shards and force of nature pieces we collect, idk if a story will be added at some point but either than gaining access to the next level, they are kind of pointless.
- Those palm leaves are such a pain to get. Make sure you don't die when you collect them because they seem to be very limited in supply. (Not sure if jungle trees drop them)
- I don't really like the force of nature pieces being a requirement to level up, they're really hard to get to let alone collect. It does push you to advance but I'm not entirely sure of their value or why I should collect them.
- Quest system holds you're hand a bit too much, but if you don't want a complicated questing system then ignore this point.
- Minions are too underpowered to be useful as anything more than body and damage shields. I often find myself throwing myself in front of them as a shield because if the enemy aggros on the minion it's almost gaurenteed death for them. A goblin minion can't face anything higher than another goblin and it certainly can't kill anything without help from the player.

All in all an amazing game. Very well executed and something I will binge for a longggggg time if my 18 hours in 3 days means anything.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076304884', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1678585369}
review:
It's a pretty fun game, guaranteed time sink. I like it though. Nice to come back after a tough day and just relax, farming, cutting trees, listening to nature. The Devs I think are rush-ian (ha, because they rush to give updates to satisfy their consumers gettit) and update the game by a monthly basis. Pretty awesome, considering the satured kickstarter stuff that comes out often.

Unlike most open-world games, there's an objective. Levelling-up means achieving experience and resources, not constantly standing in an open field farming goblins and wild animals. It's a good feeling to have a farm set up within walls and gates to protect from the monsters. Goblins are nasty little buggers that'll swarm you and take you down, and your farms, if they catch you off guard.

Imagine my surprise when I found out you can tame one. A little disappointed you only can tame literally one, but to watch a level 7 gobbo kick his cousins level 1 ass is fun. Now I want to open up a gladiator arena where I leave my gobbo and aggro a bunch of monsters and lead them into the death cage. Whoever wins gets to be my second-in-command, with their own little hovel.

To say this game is accesible would be incorrect as many people like action and drama. But I like this peaceful world. At least, peaceful until you bump into a biome you never seen and run, watching your second-in-command get beat the crap out of from a glowing golem monster four times it's size. 

Then you come, make a portal, kick ass, and get a shard of nature. The whole objective, as far as I can tell, is that you're a wizard that teleports and wants to grow your magic power through the shard things. 

I got a couple complaints. One is that I can't name any one of my animals or gobbo, which sucks. Two is that I just want to pet them. Who is a good little gobbo? Yes you are! You are!. Three is that I should be able to command an army of the green suckers. Maybe see them change textures or weapons as their level gets higher would be neat too. 

Bottom line: Don't buy this game unless you are willing to invest time. If you're expecting minecraft, this might not be for you. Since you can refund, give the game an hour and see if you're willing to sit and dig dirt for seven minutes straight. (or just *pretend* you bought it, like I did)

Good luck fellow wizards and their pet gobbo's. May many palisades defend your home!

author: {'steamid': '76561198284666085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1517432846}
review:
Looked cool at first. However, once I got into the game there were a ton of issues. The tutorial was alright but the gameplay is just awful. The controls are some of the worst I've used in a game for gathering resources, the menu system is strange and not very user friendly, the crafting and building seems very lazy at best. Having to craft things that take way too long to collect and craft for something simple then having to do that about 5 times for each resource just to get to the next step of crafting just to build something as simple as a small chest takes wayyy too long. There is no customizability when it comes to building either. There is one set model for each thing which is boring because you are not able to actually build a base or a home for maximum efficiency. Seems like they took the lazy way out and made things drag on so the game seems more interesting and seems longer than it actually is.

Game has potential but if it continues like this  I for one won't be playing it much longer. Unfortunate because it could have been a great game.

review:
Bonjour,
Notez que je n'ai test√© le jeu qu'en coop, je l'ai pas termin√© et je viens de me lever l√†, √† l'instant. 
Malgr√© √ßa, je sais quoi en dire sur Force of Nature.

... Rhuumm rhhhuuummm ... *√©chauffe sa voie*

Je naquis sur une plage en ce jour avec mes deux fr√®res, Leblanc et Lemarron. Sans parent, sans rien appart mes deux fr√®res. Heureusement, nous √©tions pourvus d'instinct et on s'est dessuite mis au travail.
Notre objectif premier √©tait de ... Oh .. ! Un lapin ! CHOPEZ LEEEEEEEEE !! CHOPEZ LE LAPIN, CHOPEZ-LE !!! Ha ! Il s'est enfuit... On doit surv.. s'installer en ces lieux.

On a donc d√©cid√© qu'on allait tout d√©foncer, tu vois, les arbres, les pierres, les plantes, les ... HA ! JE L'AI RETROUVE !!! IL ETAIT COINCER DANS CES PUTAINS DE N√âNUPHARS !! VENEZ !! TIENT PREND TOI CA LE LAPIN, DANS TA GUEULE ! TIENT TIENT TIENT !! CREVE POURRITUUUUUUUUUREEEEEE !!! ... Et finalement, c'√©tait pas mal comme coin ! Y'avait la mer juste a cot√©, on avait notre petit feu de bois et notre hutte soigneusement craft avec des palmes et du bois. Osef de la pluie, de la bouffe, et du beau temps puisque nous sommes ensemble !

Apr√®s avoir d√©truit la flore avoisinante, il fallait qu'on bouge pour ... UN COCHON ! PETIT PETIT ... PETIT COCHON ! COINCEZ LE ! HAHAHA EN TRIANGLE IL EST COINCE !! HA MAIS IL SE D√âFEND LE PORC ! TUEZ LE !!! CREVE POURRITURE D'ANIMAL ! CREEEEEEEEEEEEEEEVE !!!
Et voil√†, on a des v√™tements ! :D
Hihihi il est mort le cochon.. HAAAA DES POULES !!! TUEZ LES POULES !!! POT POT POT ... MEEEEEURT .. !!!
D√©sol√©, je m'emporte. En m√™me temps, comment r√©sister √† l'appel du meurtre ?
Du coup, on a d√©cid√© de ramasser des champignon etc ... Des trucs a bouffer quoi, m√™me si on a pas faim, √ßa fait toujours plaisir quand c'est gratuit alors on s'est mis a d√©boiser compl√®tement la foret et √† vider les champs.. H√©h√©h√©, j'avais des centaines de ..

Mais .. C'est bien ce que je crois .. ? C'est un gobelin ? OH MAIS IL NOUS ATTAQUE EN PLUS LE CON ! HA TU VA PRENDRE TARIF ESPECE DE SAC A M**** !! TIENT COUP DE BATTE DANS L'OEIL !! ON LE FINIT PAR TERRE DEVANT SA FAMILLE !!! PAS DE PITIER POUR LES INFIDELES !! DECEEEEEEDEEEEEE !!!!
Aaah ... Ca fait du bien :) !
Et quand on est arriv√© vers le nord putain qu'est ce qu'il faisait chaud ! Ou froid .. Je sais plus mais on a du faire des v√™tements pour chercher le fragment de la nature ! *COUIC COUIC COUIC* LE RENARD ! JE T'AI DECOUPE POUR ME FAIRE DES BOTTES HAHAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA !!!
Donc on est rentr√© au camp, on a construit des trucs... Genre un four, une enclume pour faire des √©p√©e , des fl√®che et toussa toussa ... On a fait une cuisine et puis .. Et puis .. J'AI TROUVE UNE CHEVRE !! BAAAAAAAH LA CHEVRE , BAAAAAAAH .... BAAM DANS TA GUEULE LA CHEVRE ! ELLE SURVIT PAS ! ELLE SURVIT PAS ON L'ACHEVE LA CHEVRE !!
Qu'est ce qu'il nous reste a tuer maintenant ... ? Les poules, les lapins , les porcs , les ch√®vres, les renards, les moutons, les vaches ( oui les vaches on peut les tuer aussi hihihihihi meuuuuh ! Hiiihihihihi) les gobelins, les ours ! Hahaha ! 

J'ADORE TUER LES ANIMAUX ET DETRUIRE LA NATURE !! JE REVE D'UNE MER NOIRE DE MAZOOT OU TOUT LES ANIMAUX SONT MORTS ET D'UNE TERRE PLATE DEVASTEE SANS VIE , ARBRES NI PIERRES ! HAHAHHAHA !! TUER @_@ .. !!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993348154', 'num_games_owned': 579, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 5291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5170, 'last_played': 1517349790}
review:
Force of Nature is a bit difficult to describe.  It mixes so many elements from so many genres that it seems to refuse classification.

Minecraft, Dungeons & Dragons, and Banished seem to create the core of FoN.  Add to that small bits of SimCity, XCOM, and 7 Days To Die, and perhaps just a faint whiff of WarCraft.  The end result is fascinating and compelling, even without much of a story.

Steady character progression, crystal clear quests, nicely challenging with a smooth difficulty curve, fascinatingly different mechanics from any other game I've ever seen, and a gigantic world to explore, fight, and loot; Force of Nature will hold your attention far longer than you'd ever expect.

I just wish I could craft pants a bit earlier.

Gameplay, d√©placement, lourd, lent, mou ou on se fait que cliquer ...

Interface lourd, pas intuitif, qui bloque les actions dans le monde. Une fois la fen√™tre des crafts ouverte, impossible de r√©cup√©rer le craft dans a la fen√™tre de construction, obliger de fermer et de rouvrir ... cam√©ra qui ne pivote plus une fois une fen√™tre ouverte ... que des "petites" choses dans le style mais qui accumul√©e pourrisse le jeu

Aucun plaisir a jouer

review: Force of Nature is a very time consuming game, but you can drop it and pick it back up again without any issue. Crafting and collecting materials takes a lot of petience, as well as advancing in questing/leveling. This is absolutley not an instant gratification type game. Would I reccomend it? If you have the time and patience, Yes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020004785', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1519325291}
review:
I love it! :D 
I just bought this game because it looked like  a decent survival game. The reviews didn't look so good, but oh, they are so wrong. :D 
I just couldn't stop playing it! There is really a LOT to do in this game, the mechanics are pretty good, it's fun to play, all the good parts are there and there are hardly any bad parts!
It really reminds me of stranded 2, and I was looking everywhere to see a game similar to that. It has all that, and more, and I really like it! 
I haven't tried the multiplayer just yet, but the single player is vast too. :) Highly recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198123597490', 'num_games_owned': 89, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1527438493}
review:
Ciertamente les faltan pulir algunas cosas, pero una vez que te sentas a jugarlo perdes el sentido del tiempo y te entretenes. Si sos de los survivals, este es un buen juego que te va a dar una experiencia un poco diferente. Sencillo por momentos y complicado por otros. Considero que los desarrolladores pongan mas filo y terminen algunos conceptos, pero la realidad es que van por un buen camino.
Interesante para probarlo en coop por mas que el multijugador este en beta. Recomendado 100%

review: Good game! Big map with lots of items and features, keeps you enternaining for hours. I like it how all the things are destructible in the game and you are free to do whatevery you want. But be warned its not an easy game and you can die in secondes, if you are not prepared well enought !

author: {'steamid': '76561198071815937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9257, 'last_played': 1575406757}
review:
Das ist ideal zum Entspannen nach der Arbeit, ich habe keinen Zeitdruck, das Spiel zwingt mich zu nichts.
Dennoch stellt es l√∂sbare Aufgaben, weist kaum Fehler auf und Spielabst√ºrze waren bisher recht selten.
Ich kann solo spielen, oder bis zu 3 Freunde einladen auf meinen eigenen Server. Im Laufe der Zeit hat sich gezeigt, dass gewisse Einschr√§nkungen auch schon mal etwas nervig aufkommen, wie etwa Brunnenwasser, das scheinbar immer zu knapp ist, oder zu wenig angesammelt werden kann, f√ºr die Bed√ºrfnisse im sp√§teren Fortschritt.
Dennoch rundum gelungen und f√ºr mich genau das richtige Spiel. Besonders positiv aufgefallen ist mir, dass es in deutsch spielbar ist und keinerlei √úbersetzungsm√§ngel gezeigt hat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064919995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1210, 'last_played': 1516655474}
review: This game provides an excellent sandbox environment which offers many building, crafting, and taming opportunities to its players. Many people who have viewed the game play have described it as ‚Äúa relaxed crafting environment which provides just the right level of challenge and goals‚Äù. My son has noted that he enjoys the parallels to Minecraft with more of an understandable goal and purpose to playing the game. As I continue to explore this game one thing of note is the size and style of the map. This provides a clash of old and new gaming realms as I can‚Äôt help but think of Zelda for NES as I push further from the pebbly beach shore.  I don‚Äôt exactly know what to expect from this game and its developers in the near future but, what I do know (coming from someone to tested Minecraft via Steam in Beta) this game has the potential to top Minecraft and draw in crowds from the differing corners of sandbox and RPG together in gaming bless!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030516476', 'num_games_owned': 5534, 'num_reviews': 465, 'playtime_forever': 12889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5928, 'last_played': 1587060855}
review:
Attention jeu hautement addictif !!!! wow wow wow j'ai lanc√© ce jeu pour essayer comme √ßa √† la vas vite et en 2/3 jours de temps j'ai accumul√© 42h dessus !!!! Difficile d'en d√©crocher !!!! (je me suis m√™me fait toute une journ√©e dessus du matin jusqu'au lendemain matin 5h non stop !!!! un truc de malade !!!!).

Beaucoup le comparent √† "don't starve", je ne crois pas, don't starve a ses m√©caniques et un style graphique qui lui sont propres, mais dans l'id√©e il y a quelques l√©g√®res similitudes...

Je ne pense pas avoir vu de craft aussi d√©velopp√© et r√©aliste dans d'autres jeux jusqu'ici. Un petit exemple sans vouloir trop spoiler : pour fabriquer un cocktail (style smoothie ou milk shake fruit√©) il vous faudra d'abord r√©colter des pommes en chemin, puis cultiver des fraises, mais pour cel√† il faudra d'abord vous fabriquer des planches de semi, y mettre de la terre que vous derez pelleter √† la force de vos bras mais sans outils impossible, puis vous aurez besoin d'accessoires de cuisine et m√™me d'une cuisine, d'une forge pour les outils, d'une ferme pour y √©lever des vaches √† lait et autres animaux qu'il vous faudra capturer, apprivoiser et aussi nourrir.

Il y a un tas de choses √† faire dans ce jeu, construire une base rudimentaire au d√©part qui √©voluera au fil des niveaux acquis. Pour augmenter les niveaux de votre personnage vous aurez des petites qu√™tes √† r√©aliser. Doucement mais surement vous allez faire √©voluer votre campement de fortune en un v√©ritable petit village dans lequel vous serez le seul habitant, vous pourrez m√™me y ajouter des d√©corations.

Entre la popote, la culture, la nourriture de vos animaux, la p√™che, la confection de v√™tements, d'outils, d'armes diverses vous risquez de passer un long moment dans votre petit chez vous. Mais rester s√©dentaire n'est pas le meilleur des choix.
Apr√®s vous √™tre par√© comme il faut il vous faudra partir en exploration, affronter les ennemis, trouver de nouvelles mati√®res premi√®res et je suppose trouver un moyen de rentrer chez vous.

Oui rentrer chez vous car vous vous r√©veillez l√† un matin √©chou√© sur cette plage au milieu de cocotiers, sans savoir ce qui a bien pu vous arriver, ni ce que vous foutez l√†.

Il y a diff√©rents biomes sur la carte, heureusement vous pourrez fabriquer des portails de t√©l√©portation pour voyager plus rapidement. 
Mais attention ces biomes n'ont jamais √©t√© explor√©s vous allez vous enfoncer dans une jungle dense qu'il faudra d√©fricher pour vous frayer un chemin. 

C'est un des points n√©gatifs du jeu, cette phase de d√©frichage pourra en rebuter plus d'un, car vous perdez vite en endurance, ce qui ralentira votre avanc√©e. Si vous n'avez pas pr√©vu et emport√© assez de nourriture, vous devrez retourner dans vos quartiers pour vous concocter des recettes afin de vous retaper en √©nergie, et cela va vous prendre r√©ellement beaucoup de temps.

Dans certains biomes il fait tr√®s chaud, dans d'autres tr√®s froid, vous aurez besoin de certains types de v√™tements pour y entrer au risque de voir baisser rapidement votre sant√© ou votre endurance.

Votre but principal est d'explorer ces diff√©rents biomes (7 au total je crois) dans l'espoir d'y trouver une pierre sp√©ciale qui vous servira √† .... euh je ne sais pas encore lol

A l'heure actuelle j'ai explor√© 5 biomes, c'est long, tr√®s long (personnellement √ßa ne m'a pas g√™n√©e) mais les impatients vont surement se lasser avant la fin du jeu. 
Il va falloir pas mal d'heures et de patience, il vous faudra aussi apprendre √† bien g√©rer et vous pr√©parer avant de partir en combat, car les ennemis ne sont pas simples, et  si √† votre grand malheur vous veniez √† d√©c√©der en combat vous respawnez sur la plage pr√®s de votre base mais vous perdrez une grande quantit√© d'objets de votre inventaire.

Le jeu fait souvent des sauvegardes et aucun soucis de ce c√¥t√© l√†.
Je n'ai rencontr√© aucun bug, les graphismes peuvent paraitre pas terrible au premier abord mais au final on s'y habitue et tout compte fait ce n'est pas si mal, les animaux et ennemis sont plut√¥t bien r√©alis√©s, les gobelins (vous pourrez en apprivoiser un pour combattre √† vos c√¥t√©s) sont tous mignons je trouve.

La gestion de la cam√©ra peu vous paraitre assez hasardeuse et m√™me vous agacer, mais tout est question de prise en main, une fois qu'on a pris l'habitude √ßa passe...

Pour la musique de fond, je n'ai pas trop compris, il n'y en a pas, √† part le bruit des petits oiseaux et diff√©rents bruitages, mais parfois √† certains endroits vous l'entendrez (rarement et pas longtemps) alors que dans les options il me semble y avoir vu une case permettant de  choisir de jouer les m√™mes en boucle ou tout le r√©pertoire.

Les succ√®s steam ne se d√©bloqueront que si vous jouez en solo. Je ne peux vous parler de l'option multi qui ne m'a pas int√©ress√©e pour ce jeu et que je n'ai donc pas test√©e.

J'ai modifi√© un peu mon √©valuation ce jour (15/05/2018) suite √† une critique dans les commentaires, il est vrai que j'ai peut √™tre insist√© un peu trop les c√¥t√©s positifs sans appuyer sur les c√¥t√©s qui peuvent f√¢cher. 
Mais mon avis reste inchang√©, m√™me si je me dois de souligner que ce jeu n'est pas fait pour tout les amateurs de survie, ceux qui ne jurent que par le multi, le PVP et la possibilit√© de crafter des armes de guerre de malade pour d√©gommer tout ce qui bouge seront d√©√ßus.
Mais pour ceux qui aiment le solo, qui aiment se poser tranquillement et prendre leur temps, r√©fl√©chir, g√©rer, s'organiser et choisir les bonnes tactiques d'approche lors des combats, ce petit jeu est un vrai r√©gal.




[code][h1][b]Si vous avez appr√©ci√© cette √©valuation et souhaitez en lire d'autres venez suivre ma [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39072619/]page de curation[/url].[/b][/h1][/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198032167311', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1738, 'last_played': 1577221312}
review:
This game is pretty alright. I got in in a sale for just a few bucks n played it for about 16 hours n there's still plenty to explore. The interface is kinda clunky but alright once you get used to it and learn the hotkeys. The quest system I found to be pretty good, nicely navigating you through the game. You can fight, farm, build n craft n forage n explore - it ain't amazing but it's fairly fun and enjoyable, at least for me. If you don't like grinding, this won't be the game for you though - you do a lot of it in this game. It's also a lot about resource and work management with all the different crafting stations, hrowing herbs and harvesting goods from animals. 
If you enjoy games like minecraft, this should be a fun time for ya.
I only have a single complaint. I wish there was a way to pet my animals. Even if it's just a button that makes my lill chicken cluck happily with no other use. Let me pet my cow. Let me pet my piggy! LET ME PET MY GOBLIN! HE'S A GOOD BOY!!!
So yea, 7/10, good job devs <33

author: {'steamid': '76561198013977080', 'num_games_owned': 47, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 22448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14538, 'last_played': 1604846251}
review:
I would describe this game as a "casual" survivalist/exploring/crafting/mining/farming type of game.  There isn't a lot of stress involved in this game.  You can't starve or die of thirst, but you can run out of Stamina.  When that happens you just stand there and do nothing until you recover enough Stamina to move.  The only way to die in this game is to be killed by other critters.

You only have the one avatar, a male.  You can change the color of his cut-off pants, and his hair, and nothing else.  The only view you will ever have is from behind your avatar, so it really doesn't matter.  The combat is extremely simple - click to hit, with no manuvering or complex animations.  The graphics are also simple, but nice.

Part of the fun of these types of games is figuring them out, so I will not give anything away.  I will say one thing about the game mechanics.  While you are playing the game the critters you kill never respawn.  However, when you save and exit the game the next time you reload the saved game to play, you always start at the beginning (no matter where you were when you saved your game) and all the critters will have respawned.  

If you are looking for a casual, laid back survivalist/crafting/farming type games, then for $7.99 you can't beat this game.  The developers are still adding content to this game, so I would certainly recommend it.  I've spent more at the movies and have been entertained far less.  After 45 hours of playing the game, this is my first impression.

UPDATE:
I am now 245 hours into this game and I still stand by my review above. There is a lot of grinding/farming and crafting, which is why we buy these kinds of games, right?

review:
A fun game.  I have had this for some time and just forgot to write a review. author: {'steamid': '76561198054666239', 'num_games_owned': 3252, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1622, 'last_played': 1515532111}
review:
Overall a really nice game. Weakest point might be the graphical fidelity which is servicable but resembles more a mobile game than anything on PC. It is realistic but less detailed with flatter lighting. Sound is decent, some of the samples are worse, some of them create a pretty good atmosphere. My favourite place so far is the jungle which feels quite mystical at night with the look and sound provided. Some of the landscapes still look gorgeous despite the lack of detail. The world is really open, you have to reach certain points but you can pretty much go across forests, bamboo fields, etc by cutting them down. Had that kind of feeling when I tried to get my bearings back in the first Dark Souls, always on the lookout for enemies and ways to get around them. The goal is to reach a location and avoiding foes is an option. Of course you will need equipment for different circumstances so you have to gather resources, build stuff, accomplish tasks and level up which would let you build more stuff and create better equipment. This provides a simple but reliable sense of progression. It might be a little slow and might become boring after some time but it is rather fun for quite a while. Combat is pretty simplistic which gets in the way in later game especially. Other thing which is a mixed bag is the huge, box-like collision meshes which prevent you from walking through bushes or between close trees for example. Once you get used to this it can be used to create pathways and lure enemies away, other times it could potentially kill you. I died a few times due to being stuck between foliage while I was being chased.
Overall, I was generally surprised how well-made Force of Nature is. While some of the design choices might not be the best I barely had any glitch during the couple dozen hours I played. Updates are also coming out every now and then. At this price FoN is definitely a title that everyone who likes exploration based survival games should consider trying out at some point if for nothing else just for the sake of it being so different.

[u]MY OPINION: 7.5/10 (GOOD)[/u]
Graphics: 6/10
World Design: 8/10
Gameplay: 7/10
Sound: 7/10
Replay Value: 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197978646869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 2817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2737, 'last_played': 1520454646}
review:
Very farmy game. Takes huge amounts of time for anything. Generally slow and calm. If you're looking for action or quick fun, this is clearly not for you. I'm lovingly calling this a work simulator because you'll spend a lot of time watching your character chop down trees and rocks while keeping the left mouse button pressed.

However, from beginning to approximately mid-game (cannot talk about late-game), I love it. There is no pressure. Time is on your side and an investment you make. Everything is controlled. Quests are designed to ease you into the game, with the learning curve being pretty much perfect. Resources are abundant, practically unlimited for all intents and purposes, and as long as you're not in a rush, you can just farm to your heart's content, killing time building your village. There is a lot of depth in the crafting system with almost no redundant resources. Most things can be used up in some way. Level progression is also interesting in that it is tied to your crafts and quests instead of character experience. Progress is saved per map and you can hop back in whenever you like.

The game has weak graphics and animation, sounds are average at best and UI management is slightly clunky, but it has an appealing feel to it. I wouldn't have bought the game had it not been recommended by a friend. Short sight range with no backdrop. You'll never stop and marvel at nature's beauty.

Multiplayer is good. Playing with a friend worked from the get-go and it was a lot of fun because everything becomes more efficient. Multiplayer is unorthodox, though:

- You cannot join mid-game. Your friend will have to stop his game and invite you to start together with him. Progress is saved though, but it can be annoying when you're in the process of doing something and someone wants to join.
- You cannot move too far away from the host. There is no splitting up like in Minecraft or Terraria, where you'll explore different areas of the map or stay at base while the other guy roams around. You're tied together with a magic rope.

Some game mechanics are questionable. Combat isn't fleshed out. Do not buy this game if you don't like chill farming and grinding games (Minecraft Survival style). If you do, this is highly recommended.

Pros
+ Ultra-chill
+ Very good crafting tree
+ Nice balance of farming, looting, harvesting and crafting
+ Multiplayer with a friend is dope
+ Automatic saves and permanent items without despawns
+ Perfect learning curve
+ Quests are just right

Cons
- Visual appeal
- Combat is weak
- Ranged combat is even worse
- UI is simple but blocky
- Multiplayer lacks freedom

author: {'steamid': '76561198068881153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1059, 'last_played': 1515101081}
review:
Quite nice game with really high potential, I'm hoping that it will be still developed ;-)
For the first few levels it's bery interesting, then gets a bit grindy, but although stays fun, especially in co-op with a friend :D

Unluckily for now the co-op is limited to 2 players and also they can't move to far away from each other, or the message appears saying something like "You moved too far from other player.", and doesn't allow you to move further.

Every few weeks it seems to get an update though, this is nice ;-)
Can't wait for more that 2 players co-op ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198050891684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 2372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1349, 'last_played': 1526219943}
review:
Un jeu de survie int√©gralement en Fran√ßais, qui supporte √©galement le multijoueur.

Le gameplay est dans l'esprit de Don't Starve avec une vue √† la 3√®me personne avec une cam√©ra libre.Vous commencez √©chou√© sur une ile et votre but est de survivre dans un monde plein de ressources, mais √©galement d'animaux et monstres.

Le jeu ne propose pas une construction libre, il faudra vous contenter des recettes d'objets et de les positionner sur le terrain, c'est le cas pour les diff√©rentes cabanes qui permettra d'avoir un abri int√©rieur.

L'aspect survie du personnage se r√©sume surtout √† maintenir sa sant√© et si besoin l'endurance. Les notions de faim et soif n'existant pas, manger sert uniquement pour remonter sant√© et endurance. Il n'y a √©galement pas de notion d'usure des objets ou de pourrissement des denr√©es.

La survie s'oriente surtout dans la collecte des ressources et l'√©volution du personnage et de sa base. Vous pourrez faire de la culture, de l'√©levage, de la cuisine, le syst√®me est bas√© sur l'imbrication des ressources.

Edit : courant janvier 2018, √©volution du mode multijoueur jusqu'√† 4 simultan√©ment et augmentation de la limitation d'√©loignement entre les joueurs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023716890', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1635768265}
review:
I tried this game out again, now that its on sale for less than a dollar and honestly, its exactly as bad as it was before. Clunky, boring, tedious, and meh. I will never play this game again, however, I can't refund at this point due to the 2 hour limit and meh, it was less than a dollar really so no point. Its designed in a very low quality way, everything just feels like extreme basics, doing the bare minimum to make a game. I'm not even sure they are working on anything at all. Only one update in the last 2 years, and it was a bug fix update (going based on the public update posts).

Creative mode in fact, is fake. It unlocks all structures and such, but you still have to play survival mode to get materials to craft or build anything. Its not -really- creative.

Old Review:
This is so boring, I'm contemplating refunding it and I haven't even tried it the full 2 hour limit.  There's no way to really fully try out much of this within two hours, but its just ridiculously boring and a bit clunky.  It even froze up on me when I changed a single graphic setting which shouldn't have frozen to begin with, right in the main menu with no graphics even loaded yet.  Had to task manager kill the process to get the game back.  I gota say, this feels like Early Access, but not labeled Early Access because of how games get a bad reputation of Early Access.

I tried creative mode just so I could try some of the later game things, only to find out Creative Mode is just no quests, but not actually creative.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044410014', 'num_games_owned': 282, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 515, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 515, 'last_played': 1514581831}
review:
At best, mediocre. You explore an island, scrabble together gear to survive, etc.

I do like it. It's a prety chill game, and I feel no pressure to speed ahead.

It's quite tedious. The control scheme to build and craft is clunky, and harvesting materials takes a long time. But after the initial excitement, it starts to feel like a grind. It could be that I'm not very far in whatever story there is, as I make an effort to hightail it back to my base before nightfall because of the darkness.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986756382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1727, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1727, 'last_played': 1514565497}
review:
This is the type of game i really enjoy, and i sank a fair few hours into it. I would love to continue to play this, but the save game refuses to load again. Twice this has happened, and i am not prepared to do it again.
The game needs a lot more stability, otherwise others will start to get annoyed with the endless repeating.
The game itself is enjoyable, yes, a grind sometimes, but fun. There could be more to do - more animals to capture, more recipies and bettwe ways to obtain stuff. 
Once they fix the stability issues, and maybe provide a save game recovery, then i will be more than happy to play this game again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154920089', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 2295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2221, 'last_played': 1639680749}
review:
The game is fun at first but then after a few hours it gets annoying playing alone...
Way too repetitive.
Cannot jump or climb over any slanted hill  grounds.
Extremely limited character customization.
Stamina takes WAY too long to regain.
Very time consuming when building and crafting.
Farming takes forever too even with large amount of resources and animals.
Mining / Wood cutting takes forever.
However if they update and fix this game, I think it could have a lot of potential.
It feels like I'm playing farmville sometimes.
6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993299430', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 4912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2701, 'last_played': 1533512667}
review:
This is one of the farmiest games i've ever played. I was ready for a negative review within the first few hours, after seeing the nerdy skinny white dude with a 13 year old's face that was the only choice of avatar. But then i gave him purple hair and purple shorts and kept playing.
45 hours later - eh, i guess i can't complain too much - i got my farming urges satisfied for a full year.

This is not Don't Starve. Although it's a lot like Don't Starve, except without the starving part, without stylish artwork, and without changing seasons. On the other hand it has much more micro-managed crafting, more sophisticated equipment, and slightly more involved combat (mainly because the game is 3d and your arrows actually fly in 3d space).

Basically if you're into the whole thing of having to feed the cows to get milk, using cooking table to turn milk into butter, then using the butter to create chocolate - you'll love this. Or if you're into having to burn sticks to get ember, then using ember with logs to create coal, then using coal and ore to create ingots, then  using ingots to create weapons/armor and better tools - you'll love this too. It's farm upon farm upon farm. Then you go farm the goblins for the gold coins that you can turn into gold ingots which you can use to build better weapons to farm the goblins faster.

The world was surprisingly large too, AND you can build teleporters which helps you optimize your farming.

Thinking back on all this, the only bad thing i've got to say about this game is that it's VERY farmy. But then again, that's also the good thing for a game whose goal is exactly that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198214516105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 398, 'last_played': 1498275411}
review: This one is hard for me to review properly. This game is awesome the map, creatures and crafting are fabulous and well made but for me, I don't like its style because I'm the kind of gamer that wants to be able to clear area's of enemies without them repopulating. This game does repopulate them which is fine but for me, I don't like it. So as I said its hard to review for me because personally the inability to "clear" areas kills this game for me, but others may not mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035702366', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1514154365}
review:
Not fun.

Can't swim, run or jump, which ruins exploring. Gathering, crafting and building are just painfully slow. Combat is stupid simple, and enemies are all faster than you. No story at all. Artwork is uninspired and fog hides anything beyond 20m. This game doesn't have a single thing going for it. I bought it on sale, but wouldn't recommend at any price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174682843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1325, 'last_played': 1601823531}
review:
[EDIT] J'avais post√© une √©valuation n√©gative car le jeu √©tait injouable (crashs √† r√©p√©tition au chargement de la carte). Mais les d√©veloppeurs ont r√©pondu √† mon appel √† l'aide et ont r√©solu le probl√®me avec une efficacit√© remarquable. Du coup, j'ai pu avancer dans le jeu et me faire un avis plus complet.

Force of Nature est un super jeu de survie et de gestion pour qui aime le farming intensif. On d√©bute en slip sur une plage et il va falloir bosser dur pour construire sa "base" et s'√©quiper convenablement. La nature environnante est compos√© d'√©l√©ments naturels exploitables, d'ennemis agressifs (gobelins, ours, renards...) et d'animaux apprivoisables.

Il n'y a pas de syst√®me d'XP. Pour monter d'un niveau, il faut r√©ussir des qu√™tes qui permettent de d√©couvrir certains aspects du jeu. Le gameplay est agr√©able bien que forc√©ment r√©p√©titif, les d√©cors sont plut√¥t cools et la map a l'air assez grande pour offrir de nombreuses heures de jeu. Bref, m√™me si je n'ai pas encore d√©couvert toutes les possibilit√©s, le c√¥t√© bac √† sable et open world est franchement r√©ussi, et font oublier les quelques d√©fauts du jeu.

Quelques remarques :

- On aimerait vraiment pouvoir choisir le sexe de son personnage, √† d√©faut de pouvoir personnaliser le skin.
- Quand tu aggro un ou plusieurs ennemis, rien ne sert de courir puisque les mobs te poursuivent jusqu'en enfer ! 

Voil√†, pour le prix c'est un jeu √† s'offrir pour tuer les longues soir√©es d'hiver.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079906412', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1283, 'last_played': 1513779652}
review:
I would recommend this game but,

Bad points: 
I stopped playing this game because I lost my save file due to developer hide save file somewhere over my drive then I format my drive without knowing this and it gone (I already backed up my game via steam) and no such cloud system for save file that was how I lost my 21 hrs save file. Another problem about this game is control system that is not so friendly you have to play over an hour to figure out how to control your character, you even have to press spacebar before gap things and smash ctrl like crazy.

Good points: The crafting system is nice, there are a lot items to be crafted and use it in the journey. The world field can be manually manipulated. If you‚Äôre finding a game for exploration world and love building the base, this game is the one you can enjoy with.

Justify survival game: This game is not entirely survival game since only strategy here is to mass production hp recovery items and then keep smashing use it like crazy and you win the battles.

review:
EXELENT :), franchement un tres bon jeux ou on destresse et on peut apprendre, certe les graphismes son simple, mais ce qui est simple est bon meme tres bon, je viens juste de l'acheter aujourd'hui pour moi et mon fils, et c'est tres bien car cela lui apprend certaines choses en s'amusant, bon pour moi le seul point n√©gatif c'est qu'il y a des cr√©atures immaginaires, mais bon √ßa on pourra dire que c'est √† cause des amanites tue mouche , je sais pas encore les effet dans ce jeu des amanites, mais √ßa serais bien si √ßa ferais perdre de la sant√© si on les consommes avec effet voir des goblins mdr, juste pour l'√©ducation √ßa, mais comme je dit pas encore vue ce que √ßa fait dans le jeux de les consommer.
en tous cas √† ce prix pour moi et mon fil c'est un tres bon moment relax, pour le multi joueur j'ai essayer, √† parement ce n'est que en local, 4 joueurs d'apres ce que j'ai vue , mais c'est bien en famille ce jeu tres bien meme, en multis internet je sais pas ce que √ßa donnerais, moi j'aime bien comme √ßa.sinon suffis juste de cr√©er soit meme le serveur pour faire rejoindre quelqu'un √† l'autre bout  :).
mais en tout cas j'aime bien la simplicit√© de ce jeu car cela me rapel aussi mes premiers jeux pc , si vous voulez passer un bon moment relax entre p√®re et fils ou autres c'est parfait.
voila que dire de plus : ben rien ;).

*si vous √™tes comme mois √† aller voir sur yt ou autres le gameplay, sachez que il y a bien aussi la traduction fr des textes, oui pas de voix car il il y a du texte pas de voie et c'est bien car on se concentre mieux  si vous √™tes comme moi que la moindre voie d√©concentre ;), voila un jeux qui n'est pas gourmand en ressource et √ßa c'est trop bien surtout pour un les genres de jeux comme cela, √ßa devrait etre une norme de pas etre gourmand en ressource pc pour ces jeux, car ceux que j'ai tester dans ces domaines bien sont tres gourmand pour le moment, bon apres c'est des early , mais justement lui force of nature il a tout compris il est rapide √† dire son message car il est  "simple", bla bla bla mdr oui √ßa c'est moi lorsque je trouve des choses rare :)

√ßa serais bien si avec les champis tue mouche √ßa ferais voir justement les cr√©atures imaginaire, il suffis juste d'un  if : en php ;) php = c ;) √ßa serais un boost √ßa ......

author: {'steamid': '76561197977419454', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 619, 'last_played': 1513301501}
review: The first few levels of the game are pretty fun but it turns in to a pretty boring grind.  Because there is only a few base materials to this game, higher level crafting requiers hours upon hours of grinding. New items do not realisticly increase the ability to harvest raw materials at a fast enough rate to compensate for the recipes at mid level.  I didn't even feel like finishing this game it had turned in to such a grind.  On top of that, poor fight mechanics and literally no dodging kinda hurts the exploration.  If I run in to more than one fox its trouble and I cant even kill them because they run away faster than I can run when they get to min health. So there you are, foraging and in a fight with some enemies when a couple of assholes role along to take you to super low health and you get no reward for spending the health and stamina fighting them.  leaves a pretty low feeling of achievement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045050306', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1532734308}
review:
My experience so far:
After relaxing few hours I got a quest to tame an animal and got hyped to have a pet.In a forest I found a chicken and tamed it, was so happy, but then an undead goblin attacking my birbo frien and it ran away. After an epic battle between me and the goblin (Which I won barely) I saw my chicken running towards me, thought it was coming back to me and got happy, but I saw her with some friends: 3 foxes, 2 boars and a BEAR (Got mauled) . I'm still crying in my hut by the beach without any friends.

Recommended, but beware of those back-stabbing chickens.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024996889', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1303, 'last_played': 1513734476}
review:
This game can be a grind at times but it is definitely something I enjoy sinking hours into. The worlds are massive and despite still being in development there are a lot of avenues already incorporated. 


My biggest beef is storage. Your inventory size is reasonable, but the size of the storage containers you can make are not. 8 slots per container does not allow much organization and I've ended up with an army of barrels and a whole bunch of frustration. I now just throw all my items on the ground and pick them up to sort through them.


7/10 thus far. 8/10 if they incorporate more reasonable item storage. I don't care if the resource cost is much higher... I am dying for some 20+ slot storage! :)

review: Not particularly inspired, even for its price point.  The Level system requires materials and honestly the whole thing reminds me of a fetch quest.  There's omissions in how to do things and at the 100 minute mark, it appeared that there was going to be a  quest that was literally incompletable because the game hadn't mentioned what arcane way you were supposed to get water.  There are other games that do what this does, but better; even if they might be a couple dollars more expensive.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368151865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 3840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3816, 'last_played': 1603434086}
review:
This game is less than 200 mbs but it is a lot of fun, for a crafting game with many kinds of resources, it's important to have object interactions that can be felt when gathering something, like chopping down trees for example, or mining ores, the animations and sound effects feel so right and satisfying, it's one of the most important aspects for a game with this genre. It's a simple thing and many games of the same genre might have done it, but there are also quite many that don't.

Other than that, the game's progression is good, more advanced stuffs are accessible after leveling up, and each level feels like a big achievement with all the new stuffs that always bring more advantage for progressing further, even though some people say that it's grindy, it is grindy in a good way, and it gets a lot easier than before because of the new accessible stuffs. 

I like how the animals behave in this game, especially when being hunted, when their HP is low, most of the time they will run, it reminds me of hunting animals in Zelda BoTW where they run after being hit, it's similar here so we have to use bow after meleeing them. We might kill them and pick up the loots or we might lose them and lose some stamina and arrows. 

The combat mechanic needs a bit more explanation  like when using a trap, first hit will never catch them, but the second time shooting a trap to the same animal even though they already ran afar will trap them. It's quite fun so we'll have to be prepared to chase and aim. The aiming system is also confusing at first but will get used to it with more time spent.

The alchemy table is interesting with added mini experiment mechanic using ingredient dosage for getting the highest quality potions. I think that's really clever and original, never played any game with that kind of mechanic as far as I remember. 

This is a great game, small and cheap, nothing to lose having it in your steam library and the system requirement is also low, so it can be played on alt pc, maybe even on a tablet. 

I hope there will be an expansion for this game or more quests because once I've completed the game I will have no more reason to come back to it. It's a waste on the crafting system with the many recipes for stuffs, because there is no more incentive to keep crafting those stuffs if the game doesn't have any more content once we finished it.

The crafting system is also very clever, there is no wasted stuffs, everything can be used for other things. The developer is a genius. Also there is no respawn for resources, once it's chopped or gathered it's gone forever, but the whole map is full of resources, it's plenty enough to keep us stocked until beating the game.

review: While graphically it isn't the best looking survival, crafting game, it has oozes charm.  I haven't played a lot yet, but from what I have seen it is very interesting.  I like the little quality of life things like L.CTRL to pick up all and L.ALT to harvest all.  The crafting is well done.  I haven't built anything past the basic foresting and mining tools but so far what I have seen it is more than worth the $7.99 if it continues to be as fun and bugfree as what I have encountered so far.   Nice little questing system as well.

review:
Biscoitos amantegados

Ingredientes:

150 gramas de manteiga sem sal em temperatura ambiente
2/3 x√≠cara (ch√°) de a√ß√∫car
2 colheres (ch√°) de ess√™ncia de baunilha
Raspas de meia laranja (ou mais se quiser)
2 x√≠caras (ch√°) de farinha de trigo peneirada
1 pitada de sal
1/3 colher (ch√°) de fermento qu√≠mico em p√≥ (uma pontinha de colher)
2 colheres (sopa) de leite ou suco de laranja (s√≥ se precisar)

Preparo:

1. Misture a manteiga com o a√ß√∫car at√© formar uma pastinha, eu usei uma colher mesmo.
2. Acrescente o sal, as raspas, a baunilha e misture.
3. Acrescente a farinha de trigo, o fermento e misture com a m√£o, se sentir que a massa n√£o est√° bem unida, adicione o leite ou suco.
4. A massa n√£o pode grudar nas m√£os e tamb√©m n√£o pode ficar seca.
5. Envolva em um pl√°stico e deixe descansar uns 15 minutos na geladeira se estiver calor.
6. Abra a massa em uma bancada bem enfarinhada com espessura de mais ou menos meio cent√≠metro. N√£o pode ficar muito grossa porque cresce um pouquinho.
7. Corte os biscoitos e coloque-os com um espa√ßo de 2 cm na assadeira forrada com papel manteiga, n√£o precisa untar.
8. Asse em forno pr√© aquecido a 180 graus, por mais ou menos 10 minutos, fique de olho quando o biscoito dourar nas bordas, est√° pronto.   

Agora que o lanche esta pronto divirta-se com esse exelente jogo!!!!!!!!!!
