author: {'steamid': '76561198135209526', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 989, 'last_played': 1569604394}
review:
This game is not for everyone

When i first bought the game, i thought it was going to be a normal survival crafting and building game y'know, but then i realised its way more than that, it made me deal with the problems it has very calmly and sometimes after 5 mins the problem is gone and now the problem is a way for you to keep going, thats the first thing that most people dont like, they want an easy game pretty much spoon feeding you content, but in here, you make your own stories, its mostly a very chill game, after you get your base up you will be spending most of the time crafting alot of stuff just to reach that new area that is filled with new things ( Mostly bad things that will end your life ), i learned that, the hard work i do no matter how frustrating it may be, at the end i have fun beating it, the game is so big, and its not stretched its big and filled with content, not repetative boring conte- maybe a bit repetative in some aspects but its still fun trust me, listen im not a good reviewer and i cant really explain how i feel very well so im just going to say it raw, The game makes me feel chill having fun with my best friend crafting stuff exploring areas taking care of each other its just refreshing, the game really touched deep in me even tho its not that well polished i must say, the game is good if you got the friend and the time to have a chat with your friend for hours and hours while crafting nails from your hard work iron so you make fences, chests, and many other cool things,the game has alot of problems which sucks but if you can ignore it then good for you, you just got yourself a good game, this review is taking to long im going to end it here by saying 

thank you for making this game dont stop updating it keep adding more stuff and fix the goddamn ranged combat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068659062', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5175, 'last_played': 1511491188}
review: There's 12 levels, and they are based on completing quest associated with each level. Starting out was okay. Once you hit mid to end game requirements, it's a total grind (Tedious to the point of being boring!). Movement can be improved with some items or poitions, if you don't mind collecting the materials. Like a previous review I saw, collect materials for 30 minutes so you can have an item for a 5 second fight, ugh.  I think the only thing that made it bearable is the fact the multiplayer did work, but you're VERY limited on the distance you can travel from your co-pilot. There's an achivement for completing the game on hardcore mode. No Thank You! I can not recommend this in it's current state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007240278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 1933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1914, 'last_played': 1510889708}
review: The game is widely panned as "grindy". At low levels, this grind is *good* - the slowness and annoyingness of no tech no food makes tech + food rewarding. So there was payoff in the early game. But after about 20 hours progress becomes glacial. You find yourself spending half an hour at a time growing and gathering food to sustain 5 minute of attritional combat against monsters that might occasionally drop the item you need 15 of to get past the next level so that you can build the gear you need to accomplish the next quest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057501841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1557097068}
review:
In a sentence: 
- If you like crafting, and you're the type of gamer that usually indulges in MMORPGs' crafting systems, this is the game for you!
The CONS: 
- The combat system is a little bit too simplistic, but I'm sure it can and possibly will be improved with time and support. Do keep in mind, though, that battling creatures is more of a means for acquiring materials for crafting rather than a scope/rewarding experience by itself; also, it is quite challenging, and you will definitely need to gear up and skillfully consume "potions" (cocktails and bananas, that is) during combat in order to avoid death.
The PROS:
- In a way its core concept kind of reminds me of those simple puzzle games for mobile phones where you had to find all the combinations of elements and derivatives in order to create refined objects and such, with the great improvement that you have an avatar with RPG elements within this very nice precedurally generated environment of a delightful deserted island all at your disposal. A real treat for any wonna-be-stranded-on-deserted-island-self-sufficient-adventurer type of person! :)
- Since the crafting system is the core aspect of the game, let me assure you that it is well balanced and rewarding. You will find yourself running to and from the water well while you wait for sheep and cows to produce wool and milk, meanwhile trying to plant and harvest as much wheat and whatnot as fast as you can while the campfire produces coal for the foundry which itself is running at full speed and still in need of more coal, and this, and that, and all the numerous other things you have to bear in mind in order to keep production running steady.
- shooting those lame foxes while they're running away from you after a few hits is extremely satisfying, also

Cheers, 
have fun, 
and BUY this game. It's totally worth its low price.

PS: hell, if I were a game developer I'd totally do this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198105358818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1088, 'last_played': 1510521852}
review:
First of all, I'd like to point out that I do realize this game isn't finisched yet and that I genuinely enjoyed it most of the time. That being said, there are SO many things that just hold this game back from being truly enjoyable.

1. Why.does.everything.take.FOREVER.to craft? I realize its a survival game, but I also realize that no one wants to wait 20 minutes for just enough coal to be finished to craft ONE ingot of metal. especially if you need like 5.

2. Basic combat is fine, but only if theres a sense of danger left. even with hordes of enemys attacking there is little to no chance of you being defeated, so mostly, combat only distracts you from walking from A to B.

3. Standard things like crates to store Items should NEVER require high tier materials like nails and metal ingots. Imagine playing Minecraft and having to find Iron bevor you can craft a simple chest (that then holds like a quarter of what your character inventory holds)

4. It is very unintuitive and makes you feel claustrophobic at times that you are not able to look higher than the horizon. This also influences not being able to aim higher while using bow and arrow to compensate the drop which goes against EVERY normal gamers instincts.

5. Having Stamina instead of tool decay is a fresh of breath air. It doesnt help though if your constantly run out of it because your fighting unnescecery hoards of mobs that pose no danger and only resutls in you having to wait for your stamina to refill to continue travelling.

6. Obvious stretchers and fillers resourcewise (e.g. one piece of burlap needs 3 wool to craft. a sheep wields 2 wool per shearing. one cup of coffee needs 5 coffeebeans. a plant yields 4 beans per harvest and so on)

7. Inabillity to get to far away from each other in multiplayer. Good times when you could split up and multitask (one player looting, one staying in base crafting) but have to sit arround in the base together waiting 30 minutes for 15 steaks to be cooked.

If this flaws were fixed (especially the time wasting ones), this game would be a hidden jem. Unfortunately its held back by stuff like this which defies gamers instincts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032620436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 4049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 480, 'last_played': 1527360478}
review:
Force of Nature is the kind of game I've been waiting on for a long time. Sadly, it's implemented too poorly to earn it a spot on my list of favorites.

There are far too many unpolished mechanics that make the game too frustrating to play, all of which could be over looked if it weren't for the primary flaw of the title and the ultimate reason I choose to not recommend this game - 

It's a resource based game with incredibly scarce resources. Everything requires a metal, and a lot of it, and metal is no where to be found.

Normally, this isn't a problem. A game that forces you out of your base and forces expansion is good except that monsters are super dangerous and drain your stats pretty heavily. This requires you to put an extrodinarily high effort into domestic efforts for fighting fuel and those efforts, while enabling you to explore and gather, don't yield particularly bountiful results. For every 5 mins you plan to spend outside of your "base" you have to spend 15 preparing consumables.

Which brings us to the scarces resource of all - your time. 

Instead of EXP, you're given a honey-do list for leveling up. Once the honey-do list is done, you're given a list of materials/resources you'll need to actually gain the level that you've already earned. This list is almost always entirely too long. 

Perhaps the biggest problem with that concept is how early it's implemented. Before you can even wear a full suit of basic leather/fur armor, you're hit with a leveling wall that will require an hour or more of gameplay. Before you can even shuck the stone tools you're using, you have to learn how to forge a bronze sword which is surprisingly not much more effective than the piece of wood you've been pounding your enemies to a pulp with at a rate that could rival only the velocity of a glacier.

Plain and simple, this game does not respect your time. With a few tweaks, it could be one of the most amazing sandbox survival titles on the steam store. Sadly, I'm not sure we'll ever see those tweaks made.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056470289', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 117768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16492, 'last_played': 1651605463}
review: Pretty good survival game, considering the reasonable price. It does get grindy after lvl 7. You spend a lot of time collecting resources and battling thru mobs to get to the end of the level and base building is limited until late levels. The combat is challenging though, and that was what made me determined to beat the game.

review:
The crafting is a bit grindy and involves  a high amount of running from station to station. It's alright at best.
Combat is horrible. Completely uninteresting and sometimes unpredictable, but necessary to progress in the game.
Overall this is one of the worst survival crafters I have played so far.

review: I love the game. Very challenging at times. I see a lot of potential with it. I love that they added a multi-players aspect to it. Although it's only 1 other person. author: {'steamid': '76561198083368332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 175, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 175, 'last_played': 1482092504}
review: Eigentlich ein guter Ansatz, sympathische Pixelgrafik und das Versprechen ein entspanntes Singleplayer-Crafting-System vorzufinden. Steuerung und Interface sind leider so unzug√∂nglich, dass sie den Spielspa√ü schnell verderben. Au√üerdem wird das Spielprinzip sehr schnell repetetiv. Man sammelt sich tot mit Rohstoffen, k√§mpft gegen die immer gleichen Gegner und kommt kaum anst√§ndig voran. Dazu die feste aufsichtige Kameraposition, die nicht ver√§ndert werden kann, und nach kurzer Zeit nervt√∂tend wirkt. Die Abwesenheit von (Zwischen-)Zielen mag so gewollt sein, tr√§gt aber nicht gerade zur Motivation bei. Leider kann ich Force of Nature daher nicht weiterempfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159294447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 2004, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 606, 'last_played': 1661035030}
review:
Gra godna polecenia 

typowy survival jedyny minus tej gry jaki widze to to ze nie mozna grac z wieksza iloscia ludzi 
jestem za tym by tw√≥rcy dodali mozliwosc tworzenia serwer√≥w na max 5/10 os√≥b 

mapa tez troszke malutka

gre moge polecic ludziom ktorzy lubia survivale , przetrwanie , ktorzy lubia rozkminiac oraz budowac

kontent gry hmm troszke slabo ze questy sa w stylu samouczkow 

samouczek a zadanie powinno byc odrebnym systemem.

z checia bede obserwowal w ktora strone tworcy porzadaja 
czy w strone survivalu gdzie czeka nas masa przyg√≥d , zadan kt√≥re daja nam mozliwosc rozwijania postaci czy rzadkie przedmioty 

czy moze w strone single survival cos w stylu terrarri  gdzie tylko masz mozliwosc budowania 
rzadkich przedmiotow dopiero wtedy gdy spedzisz wiecej czasu w grze.
obecnie sprawa wyglada tak ze rozwoj postaci nie zalezy od pracowitosci gracza, a od tego ile godzin spedzisz w grze

jestem za nutka rpg z checia chcialbym zobaczyc te gre z wieloma aspektami rpg , jaskinie na koncu ktorych walczysz z bosami ktore daja ci prezenty lub niespotykane losowe przedmioty , ktore upiekszaja twoja zbroje lub jakies diamenty ktore laczysz z bronia i daja ci powiekszanie ataku czy obrony w zbroi.

polecam obecnie daje 6/10 jak pisalem wyzej brakuje mi tej nutki rpg.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211968819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1508830808}
review: Finde das Spiel nicht so gut, von der Grafikund der Idee nicht schlecht, aber bei der Steierung hapert es enorm. Zum teil ist es von ARK kopiert, nur das es hier nicht Dinos sind sondern die heutigen Tiere, und das man sie (in meinem Level) nicht z√§hmen kann. F√ºr mich lohnt es sich nicht das Spiel zu kaufen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139754708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1508797509}
review:
Interesting game, seemed to have lots of potential. Some people talk about it being tedious to grind resources, but I dont want to be spoon-fed progress. It can take whatever time it takes. 

Overall pretty ok game. 

Movement is ok, but would be better if you could move a bit faster. Swinging your weapon while moving would be an improvement. The creatures/monsters/whatever are faster than you. Meaning, if they decide to flee, which some do, you're not gonna catch em. 

Shooting with a bow is a joke, melee is the way to go in this game right now. A bit silly that you cant move through some fauna, but interesting at the same time, wouldn't say I like it, but wouldn't say I dislike it either. 

I refunded the game, but would not have, if there was a proper multiplayer. No multiplayer games available, and if you want to host your own, its for 2 people. so you and one friend. If this was like 50+ people on a server with a couple of servers to choose from, I'd have kept the game. Because lets face it, Sandbox games are not fun on singleplayer. 

A bit more work on movement/combat, and implementing proper multiplayer, and I'll def give this game a go again. Until then, hold on to your wallets, and go spend 8 Euro's on icecream for your kids or something. 

Also worth mentioning, If the game had a proper multiplayer, I would have no problem with the pricetag being 30 Euro's instead of the 8 it is right now. A price tag is irrelevant when it comes to a great game, which I do believe this has the potential to become. 

But as of right now... Force of Nature? More like no guy buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099086387', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3053, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1183, 'last_played': 1632933680}
review: Basically another minecraft. However, this one adds a bit more realism to the mix and gives you a leveling system. I enjoy it. Yes it is grindy (there comes the realism) and yes there are still a few bugs to work out. When in co-op sometimes my partner will see things like stumps that I have already removed or he can't affect something. However, a relog will generally fix that. One thing I really wish they had was a way to join a game already up - for example - when my partner needs to relog to fix an issue that means we both have to log out and I have to restart the game in multiplayer for him to rejoin. I recommend this game if it's on sale (like when I picked it up).

author: {'steamid': '76561198030763143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1518478140}
review:
So far, it's an alright game. It's simple, easty to learn, and fun. I like the combat. I like the graphics and music. It's a fun world to get lost in and explore. 

My only complaint would be that there's too much of a grind for materials. Getting five ingots together for a cooking table took a whole hour.  If you're not a fan of a slow grind, building up a base in a CG world, you won't like this one at all. I do like those kind of mechanics. I'm a slow, methodical builder type of gamer. But it is a little slow, even for me. The rewards need to come more often. In this case, the rewards are higher tiers of gear. I'm level 5 and I don't even have a single scrap of armor yet. Perhaps some rebalancing might benefit the flow of the game a bit.

Also, the ambient sound effects loop needs to be fixed. Every once in a while it just stops, goes silent for half a second and then starts up again. Immersion dies. Gotta fix that ASAP. 

Other than that, it's well worth the price. I had $8.79 worth of fun in the first half hour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142382952', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2547, 'last_played': 1533133142}
review:
I thoroughly have enjoyed my time playing this game (especially considering the price).  There is a lot of time spent crafting, but I enjoy that. The crafting system seems relatively well thought out. The combat system is extremely simple. The aiming with the bow is difficult to manage at times though. It's easy to work around, but you can't really change the trajectory of your arrow. You just have to make sure you are within range of your target and at the same elevation to make the shot. 

I was most excited by my interaction with the developers of this game. I contacted them through their website whenever I experienced a bug, and they had responded and fixed the bug in 24 hours! 

I've already gotten way more time out of this game than I expected to, and I would highly recommend it to anybody looking for a crafting game. It's exactly what I had been looking for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143385207', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3283, 'last_played': 1508078818}
review:
Ok, I'm gonna do this shortly. 

Firstly lets talk about the negative points. 

It took me 54 hours to complete. Although I didn't hurry, I didn't waste time as well. And around 70% of that time was spent to harvest raw materials and convert them to what I need. The game IS tedious, as many people mentioned. If you dont have alot of time to burn, stay away from this game

It was also very annoying to harvest until lvl 9, where you get iron pickaxe and axe. Too much material is needed, and axe swings too slow. Although harvesting gets faster after lvl 9, I was already sick of it by then. 

You cant Run! And it is maddening. Everything in the game is faster than you from bears to goblins to chickens. There is stamina, and you spend it for almost everything, why no run?

It is not realistic. Now this what people likes to talk about alot, for a survival game it is too unrealistic and unbalanced (not only combat, but also things like growing plants). HOWEVER, this is not a survival game.  Yeah I though so as well before re-checking. As mentioned its more like a management game. And you manage...your time...your off game time. Its like "I should do this to finish the game faster".

Then why like the game?

1. I had alot of time.
2. The game requires very little PC specs. It is good for old machines as well.
3. After 20th hour our so you get used to the slow axe and slow walk speed. That is, what was a problem back then you get used to it, and focus other things. Like gathering your water in time so it won't go waste.
4. It is fun to build a village size settlement from the scratch.
5. Realism demand was forsaken fast enough (This one is important!).
6. The keeps 650 MB or so in hard disk. For such a small area, it provides a huge map (less than 40% was explored) and alot of play time.
7. Most flora, from trees to stones, from palm to bushes, can be broken and harvested.
8. Very reasonable price. Price/PlayTime ratio is very good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969326689', 'num_games_owned': 1184, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2694, 'last_played': 1555783845}
review:
This game is well worth the money.

I have payed two or three times the amount for games that provided less enjoyment. Even most of those giving the game a negative review got more than their money's worth when you look at the number of hours they played.

Keep in mind this is an indie game, but the graphics are very well done. The multiplayer is very limited but it has been a blast to play with a single friend. It is an open world management survival game. Kind of a hybrid of world or warcraft and rust (minus the multiplayer aspect). It is a grind, which I loved. If you prefer a game with high volume action and immediate gratification, then this may not be for you. On the other hand, if you prefer the games where you grind to build up your level/status, inventory, and abilities, then this game is perfect. As you improve your tools you will be able to upgrade the layout of your base and make material generation more productive. There are PLENTY of resources in the world so getting materials has not been an issue. Most of the important materials you can eventualy manufacture in your base, or are in abundant supply through out the world. Use of portals allows you to setup quick travels to points in the world you deem important. If any of this sounds interesting, you can not go wrong at the price point for this game.

Happy hunting!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001593238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 2381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1952, 'last_played': 1508710348}
review:
I have been in love with survival games with rpg elements for years, so when this came up on sale I decided to jump on it. 

15 hours later I am writing a review of this game that has had me playing every available moment the last 2 days. Most of it has been quite enjoyable, with a few hicups in design that keep me from giving it a 10/10.

The game opens with you wearing nothing but the clothes on your body at the time, and what you have is in tatters. Collecting local resources you are able to build basic tools with the help of a nice quest/turtorial system. Within a couple of hours you have your first building and crafting structures. The level of satisfaction I had with each level unlocked and each new tool or building was palpable. The pacing is just that good. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone that likes surival games with rpg elements. I have been glued to it for the last few days and I have yet to get bored. WELL worth the money.

Overall Score: 9/10

Pros - 

Ability to destroy nearly every environment object in game

Ability to move placed objects easily, streamlining build fuctions and removing resource penalties for mistakes in settlement design

Well balanced game progression. Every new tool, weapon, and armor feels significant and affects the experience.

DEEP crafting system, so many things can be created and the progression is very logical and thought out.

Player determined teleports!


Cons - 

Tool usage could be greatly improved with a tool box kept in your settlement that allows all tools to be shared vs needless tool management that slows down crafting

Spawn points always in the same spot, would be nice if it placed you near your bed

author: {'steamid': '76561197971548533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1552252500}
review:
Petit test du jeu vite fait...

Bien que le d√©mmarage du jeu puisse √™tre probl√©matique (voir note plus bas) le jeu n'en reste pas moin tr√®s plaisant, beaucoup de travail (de beau travail) √† √©t√© fait et une bonne complexit√© de fabrication est introduite au jeu,

Je n'ai vu aucun "lags" durant mes essaie, l'aide en jeu est excellent, graphiquement bien aussi et tout est bien expliquer..., (tr√®s beau travail des traducteur aussi qui ont donner de leur temps et, qui gra√ße √† eux nous permettent de jouer en fran√ßais..., sinon je ne l'aurais jamais achet√©)

les constructions ne sont pas tout √† fait comme je le pensais, par exemple pour les maisons, on ne peut pas b√¢tir les murs et tout, c'est du pr√©-construit, et les maisons sont tr√®s petite, mais √† part √ßa, il est possible de faire un beau petit village pour nous m√™me avec de belle d√©coration,

un excellent jeu pour ceux qui aime la fabrication de choses, les combats ne sont pas complexe et l'inventaire est tr√®s bien fait, bien s√ªr je n'ai pas tout tester le jeu au complet, mais le concept du jeu nous donne le choix de commencer le jeu avec ou sans aide, mieux vaut suivre l'aide si on ne conna√Æt pas le jeu..., car si on commence directement avec le niveau sans aide, les ach√®vements Steam semble √™tre d√©sactiver aussi (de ce que j'ai vu), car je n'ai test√© le mode sans aide que quelque temps avant de revenir au mode avec aide pour accomplir les ach√®vements Steam...

Le jeu n'est pas complexe car il ne tient pas en compte la faim, la soit ou le besoin de repos, la nourriture (tr√®s diversifier), et le lit ne servent que de source de regain d'√©nergie qui elle est d√©pens√© durant les actions faite, tout est graphiquement bien repr√©sent√©, les bananier ont l'allure de bananier, et les cocotier aussi, ect..., les lapins aussi sont tr√®s jolie √† regarder, les attraper sans toujours manger que leur poussi√®re seulement est une autre histoire par contre ha ha ha

Il n'y √† pas de monstre dans le secteur du d√©part et vous pouvez y construire votre base sans probl√®me, mais si vous vous √©loign√© un peu vous y verrai des goblins et autre animaux qui vivre tous ensemble dans le seul but de vous d√©truire... (tous des jaloux de mon beautiful body ha ha ha)

le jeu m'a surpris quelque fois durant mes recherche d'√©l√©ment, comme par exemple en fouillant le sol pour prendre de la terre noir, j'y ai d√©terrer des vers de terre, ce qui m'a fait voir qu'il y avait de la p√™che dans le jeu (pas tester), mais on peut prendre du poissons, ect, bien pens√©, car je ne suis pas amateur de soupe aux vers de terre ha ha ha

pour les constructions, une fois faites, il est possible de les changer de pla√ße sans les d√©truire, ect.., le positionnement des batiments est excellent, on nous donne une grille autour de notre avatar et on choisi l'endroit et on peut chang√© l'orientation du b√¢timent, syst√®me tr√®s bient fait... 

Ha!, avant de l'oublier, plusieur semble se questionner √† savoir comment capturer un goblin pour le faire combattre √† nos c√¥t√©, et bien j'ai fait quelque recherche et la r√©ponse est la suivante :

quand vous voyez un goblin, faite baisser sa sant√© de moiti√© environs, ensuite utilis√© l'outil (genre de fillet) pour capturer les animaux, mais n'abandonner pas, vous devrez lui envoyer environs six fois le filet correctement dessus avant qu'il ne cesse de le cass√© et ensuite vous faite comme avec les animaux une fois qu'il sont dans le pi√®ge, et voil√†, vous avez un nouvel ami tr√®s laid...
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[b][u]Probl√®me possible lors du lancement du jeu :[/u][/b]

Pour commencer, cette partie n'est pas une √©valuation du jeu, mais plus un resultat de petit test effectuer vite fait avec le d√©marage du jeu qui peut √™tre probl√©matique...,

les notes que j'inscrit ici ne sont que pour m'aider √† me souvenir de tout les probl√®mes que j'ai pu rencontr√© avec le jeu (et une petite √©valuation du d√©but du jeu), et ainsi me souvenir des probl√®mes si je veut re-tester le jeu plus tard...

pour ceux qui lisent ceci, il n'y √† rien de positif o√π n√©gatif, seulement des √©valuations de probl√®mes rencontr√© lors du lancement du jeu et/o√π des solutions trouv√© aux probl√®mes,

je n'ai rien vu de majeur en tant que probl√®me au d√©part mais plusieurs petit probl√®mes de d√©part qui finnissent par faire un casse-t√™te..., √©tant donn√© qu'il faut ce cass√© la t√™te d√©ja pour faire d√©mmarrer le jeu et enray√© les probl√®mes mineur, je donnerais une note n√©gative au jeu, mais vu le bon travail en jeu qu'il ont fait, le jeu m√©rite une bonne notes mais reste un probl√®me qui je l'esp√®re sera corrig√© dans le futur par le cr√©ateur du jeu...

encore une fois, cette partie n'est pas une √©valution du jeu mais une √©valuation de testeur ha ha ha..., pour me rappeller qu'avec ce jeu je doit faire √ßi et √ßa pour qu'il fonctionne bien...

[b][u]Probl√®me # 1 :[/u][/b]
La souris n'est pas configurable pour modifier les touche du jeu, seul les commande de la souris inscrit par le cr√©ateur sont autoris√©, donc m√™me si on veut configurer une souris √† 5 boutons, c'est impossible, et comme les commandes de la souris n'y sont pas (sauf pour la vitesse de mouvement de l'√©cran), diffi√ßile de conna√Ætre les commandes utilis√© dans le codage en dur..., (j'aurais aim√© pouvoir ajout√© mes propre commandes √† la souris, plut√¥t que d'utiliser le clavier pour certaine action...)

[b][u]Probl√®me # 2 :[/u][/b]
Pour ceux qui joue en version fran√ßais, les √©critures dans le jeu sont parfait, avec les accents et tout, mais quand vient le temp d'√©crire quelque chose dans le jeu, il est impossible d'utilis√© les accent dans le jeu , (note : ceci est souvent du √† un codage unique pour clavier anglais seulement (America first, fuck the other, comme dirais Trump), puisque les fichiers de langues sont ind√©pendant du fichier jeux pour les traduction...)

[b][u]Probl√®me # 3 :[/u][/b]
Si vous d√©mmarer le jeu avec le raccourci que Steam installe sur le bureau, il est fort probable que beaucoup de gens soit incapable de voir l'eau dans le jeu, ou que l'√©cran passe sont temps √† s'intiller...,

ceci est du √† cause du "Direct X 9", la solution est d'aller dans notre liste de jeu et de d√©marrer le jeu en "Direct X 11" √† chaque fois..., (Il devrait mettre cette option du choix du "Direct X" dans les option du jeu et non seulement sous le menu des commande Steam avant de lanc√© le jeu...)

Donc, je continue..., mais mettre le jeu en "Direct X 11" cause une autre erreur pour ceux qui veulent jouer en format "Plein √©cran", le jeu crash √† sa sortie la premi√®re fois √† cause de cette erreur du "log file"... :

"You may not release a swap chain in full-screen mode because doing so may create thread contention (which will cause DXGI to raise a non-continuable exception). Before releasing a 
swap chain, first switch to windowed mode."

donc la solution est d'aller dans les options d'√©cran du jeu et de mettre le format d'√©cran √† "lancer le jeu en mode fen√™tr√© plein √©cran", ceci corrigera le probl√®me de plantage o√π de gel temporaire de l'ordinateur quand on essaie de quitter le jeu...,

Le jeu semble vraiement plaisant mais comme il n'est pas en "Early acces", ce genre de probl√®me ne devrait m√™me pas exister,

pour le clavier sans accent o√π la souris non configurable, on peut vivre avec, mais pour les probl√®mes de directX et en plus qui nous oblige de charger le jeu autre que par l'√Æcone Steam sur le bureau, √ßa fait non professionnel...,

Ha oui!, j'allait oublier, n'essayez pas de faire un racourci de la version de d√©mmarage du fichier du jeu "ForceOfNatureDX11.exe", cela ne fonctionne pas car Steam vous bloque lors du lancement du jeu, vous devez absolument passer par Steam aller dans votre liste de jeu, choisir le jeu faire un clique droit et choisir "d√©mmarer avec directX11..., maintenant vous pourrez voir l'eau et vous pourrez quitter le jeu sans "crash" o√π gel de l'ordinateur, avec dirrectX11.

review: I do not write many reviews but after seeing all of the neg. ones I thought I would just jump on and give my two cents...I am playing this multiplayer with my wife and between the two of us it's not bad gathering resources. I can see why people would complain about it taking a while if they play single player and kicking to get all of their resources. But anyways Fun game multiplayer if you have already played most of the other survival games out there and are looking for something different give this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119504638', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1558933725}
review:
This game is wonderful and holds a lot of potential, It's got something really going for it. I believe that the quest system is easy to understand, everything is easy to find and decently catagorized. I do like that you can feel like your accomplishing a lot despite the hours played, which means its grindy and that's good. It does take a while for somethings but its understandable. Once you get a system going it works out fairly well, taming animals and making fences to keep them in one spot is also fairly handy and you can make it as large or as small as you need too, which is nice. 

I do think that the game should have a running mechanic, but if you keep yout stamina and health high you should be fine. You don't even need to leave the starting area to level up until you are at least 3, I believe, and that's just to get coins to further yourself. At that stage you should be well prepared to fight the goblins or anything else that comes your way. Food items help heal and fix stamina, which is handy and you don't have to worry about a hunger bar but I'm not going to frown upon it if it's added, over all, I loved it, and I'm glad I got it as a gift.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041757257', 'num_games_owned': 582, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1507333388}
review:
[h1] 16 Minuten Unzufriedenheit. [/h1]

An sich bin ich √§u√üerst leicht zu beeindrucken, weshalb ich mir trotz relativ negativer Resonanz dieses Spiel kaufte.
Da es sich lediglich um 16 Minuten handelt,kann ich keine sonderlich Handfeste Review verfassen, m√∂chte euch aber dennoch gerne meine Meinung mitteilen.

[b] Grafik [/b]
Die Grafik eines Spieles, d√ºrfte niemals ein Kaufargument sein, jedoch sieht dieses Spiel schlechter aus als einige der ersten PlayStation 1-Titel, was nicht verwerflich w√§re, wenn die eingeschr√§nkte Sichtweite nicht so verdammt nervig w√§re.
Ich f√ºhlte mich seit Beginn des Spieles so, als w√ºrde ich eine billige, nicht gruselige Silent Hill Mod des ersten Teiles spielen.

[b] Gameplay [/b]
Das Gameplay basiert √ºberwiegend auf dem typischen "sammeln und craften"-System, wie es derzeit in jedem zweiten Spiel zu finden ist. Allerdings hat das in diesem Spiel auch nur bedingt geklappt.
Eine kleine, aber auch schwerwiegende Sache, die daf√ºr sorgte, dass "fl√ºssiges Gameplay" hier kein St√ºck vorhanden ist, ist dass man nach √∂ffnen des Inventares nicht mehr in der Lage ist, seine Kamera zu bewegen. Vielleicht st√∂rt das aber auch nur mich.

[b] Fazit [/b]
Kriegt dieses Spiel meine Kaufempfehlung?
 - Auf keinen Fall
Habe ich viel Spielerfahrung sammeln k√∂nnen?
 - Nicht wirklich.

Alles was ich sagen kann: Ich habe keinerlei Spa√ü empfunden.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988984079', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1507387492}
review: I played a tiny bit of the game and i'm a little dissapointed. The concept of farming and breeding animals, clothing, building, crafting is good, very complete but the game lacks a key factor on survival games: the player feeling hunger, thirsty, cold, react to the weather. That and the lack of multiplayer made me ask for a refund, but don't get me or my review wrong. I'll buy the game again if those two key points are added to it. Look at this review as an constructive critic. Cheers.

- animation still need to be rework,

- add other need, like comfortness/sleep (can use tent), hunger, fear of night it will raise the intense, and more fun in mutiplayer :D

- fuel for the bon fire, add small realistic for fun :D
- and for crafting, i think we dont need to wait the process, come on, just skip it
- pay with resourcer for level up? hm, i think better add leveling up for strengh, agility, logic and these point gain trhough the game, like chopping trees, walking. and these point  will effect of crafting option, open new area, braveness, accuracy. 
- camera view make people dizzy, (motion sickness), add more option to the camera, 
- cant use item while seeing inventory, i wanna see my item while digging stuff
- dont need small quest, make it more interesting like (prepare for defending your self from the beast, or conquer this temple, bla bla) i dont need to be taught to make some rope, let me find my way. 
- really? coin? 

i know it still under develop, i hope your game will getting better and better :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198197911934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1585, 'last_played': 1507141422}
review:
Play this game if you have a prophet's patience.
Crafting, building, materials and somewhat combat is simply great. On the other hand; you need to level up. To level up, you need to find shards. To find shards you need to travel. When you start travelling, you encounter a few hostile mobs and near infinite amount of trees and bushes you need to cut down. Plants just do not stop coming at you. You cannot even pass over water lillies. You need to cut them down with your axe. I cheated for "one hit harvesting". Even with that it was hours and hours of slashing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200860642', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3990, 'last_played': 1585352795}
review: Es un buen juego y me gustar√≠a que siga su desarrollo. he notado que las flechas de hierro, bronce y acero hacen poco da√±o como para costar los recursos que requiere. El crafteo del cristal es medio caro como para desperdiciarlo en botellas. Las esquirlas fabricables con los jugos de rosas son muy car√°s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159075589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1506820593}
review:
En r√©sum√© : ce jeu est un simulateur de d√©broussaillage.

De bonnes id√©es au d√©part qui sont mal exploit√©es avec des crafts inutilement co√ªteux en resources qui ralongent artificiellement la dur√©e de vie qui pourrait √™tre hon√™te (~70h) si les environnements n'√©taient pas horriblement r√©p√©titifs. Quelques d√©tails de gameplay sont assez astucieux pour rendre le crafting plus "confortable", mais encore une fois cela est g√¢ch√© par le co√ªt astronomique des crafts.
Le" leveling" du personnage est beaucoup trop rigide, trop lin√©aire et au final un peu inutile puisqu'il permet seulement de d√©v√©rouiller de nouveaux crafts, dispensable en bref.
Les diff√©rents biomes sont donc tr√®s r√©p√©titifs et on ne les explorera que contraint et forc√© puisque toutes les resources n√©cessaires (sauf les gemmes et les roses) se trouve dans l'environnement de d√©part. L'exploration est donc le gros point noir du jeu. Quant √† la rejouabilit√©, elle est pratiquement nule, puisque la g√©n√©ration al√©atoire du monde ne change fondamentalement rien, puisque vous aurez les m√™mes biomes arrang√©s un peu diff√©rement.
Les musiques sont sympas mais elles font rarement acte de pr√©sence, dommage.

Le prix du jeu jeu est honn√™te pour son contenuet sa dur√©e, mais le jeu est par trop perfectible pour que je le recommande.

review: I didn't enjoy the gameplay.  You need to collect so many resources in order to craft parts and then to craft bigger components.  The other issue is it has a very "paint by numbers" feel to the game.  Do this, now do this, now do this.  You're very micromanaged. Instead of giving you a large end goal, there are many, many small ones.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039538543', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1768, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1768, 'last_played': 1507355646}
review:
Play time as of this review: 4 hours (17 hour review update below, game no longer recommended)

While I DO recommend this game, as it does have ALOT of potential, I do still have to give it a pretty poor rating.

First off: Survival game... NO RUN FUNCTION!... What? In any survival game sprinting is a must. Why? Are you really gonna walk when something or somebody is trying to murder you? No, if your life is on the line you're going to downright haul ass. If you're out hunting and your, now wounded, prey runs off are you going to walk after it? No. It'll get away. As it ALWAYS DOES in this game as of right now.

Second: Tedious as fuck! Now to be fair, you can start a craft and walk away. But the material farming is dredgingly slow and the count of materials from each source will have you pulling down on the sides of your face making your eyes bulge out. Sticks and Palm tree leaves should be explosively abundant. But, compared to any build costs, they are a tedious grind to gather as many as you need. A good, quick fix for this is simply to up the amount dropped from each source. Instead of a single tree only giving 6 sticks have it give 12 to 15 and take 2 to 4 fewer sqings to bring the tree down. Instead of 7 palm leaves, 10 and it takes 1 swing to bring the bush down. Unless the Dev meant this game only for children, most adults usually have full time jobs, sometimes multiple jobs, and thus don't have the time for a slow ass grind. I've been playing for almost 4 hours and have only managed to get as far as building my first hut.

Third: Swinging like a... I dunno, even the girliest of girls can swing an axe faster than that. I mean, do I really need to elaborate on this one? The player character hits really damn hard but swings soooo frickin slow, while you, the Dev, have the enemies swinging at a believable speed but hitting for much less damage and with weapons that are clearly superior to my Cudgel. Goblin with a war axe anyone? And the frickin bear!? I'm sorry, I would NOT fight a bear with a stick off the ground! The bear should hit ALOT harder. It's a fucking bear! 600+ pounds of "I'MMA EATCH YUH!" Easy fix you say? Sure, speed the player characters attack up and bring the damage down a bit, then make that bear into a proper beast. Honestly, for a naked guy with a stick the bear should kill the player in 2 hits. It's a fuckin bear!

After only 4 hours, that's really all I have found to complain about, though I'm looking forward to a female model. Just saying. But anyway, the game is really pretty, so far I love the designs and graphics and I am already in love with the simpler elements of the crafting system. The grid assisted placement is very nice, my OCD approves. The fact that most everything is breakable is nice. I can build wherever the hell I bloody well please.

That being said, I DO recomment this game as I have high hopes for it.

A few things I'd like to see added in are:

Sprinting, faster character movements, quicker material farming to reduce the tediousness, female models, modding support(modding support only helps), and maybe set it up so two or more of the same building piece will join together to form 1 big building piece(but still count as multiple building pieces). This way we can have a bigger home if we want, instead of just a bunch of smaller homes. ( I'm gonna feel dumb is that's already a thing and I just hadn't played long enough to see it yet )

Is the game worth $7.99 as it sits now? Yeah, I think 8 bucks is a fair price for it in it's current state. But with the 3 issues I listed above down right killing the game play, I do have to rate the game about a 6 out of 10 as they badly drag the immersion and enjoyability way down. Hopefully the Dev reads the reviews and takes people's input to heart as I AM enjoying this game and hope to see some of the improvements I've recommended.

17 hour review update:

So I've been playinmg for 17 hours now and can no longer recommend this game. Good looks is about all it has going for it. Material harvesting is still a slow as hell grind that doesn't leave you feeling accomplished at all. Enemy balance is beyond laughable, a goblin warrior with an axe is less of a threat than a naked man with a club AND A FOX! Yes, a tiny fox is more of a threat to the player than a goblin and a bear is barely more of a threat than a fox, dealing the same damage but taking a whole 3 more hits to kill. The painfully slow movement speed has me falling asleep just trying to run from one side of my base to the other, and my base is pretty cramped up tight mind you. The collision boxes for trees create ALOT of invisible walls between tree trunks and small bushes can not be "pushed aside" by the player. You run up to a shrubbery and can not pass through it, which makes moving across the map a HUGE pain in the ass as you constantly have to switch between your sword, which is barely more useful than your club, and your axe to chop down small bushes and shrubbery. OH, and let's not mention the fact that a sword CAN NOT cut through shrubberies and sunflower seed stalks.... What?

I don't know what is wrong with this developer's head, but this game is NOT worth money. It has great potential, but at this point I can only see it reaching that potential if the current developer steps away and allows some one else to take over. Take your money somewhere else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043720561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1217, 'last_played': 1688032718}
review:
This game is a bit on the fence for me... there's features I like, mostly the simplicity of some aspects of the game... and features I don't... like having to kick a bush ~10 times to harvest branches/palm leaves. I don't even mind how simplistic combat is... but where this game lost me, is traps.
To begin with, a net that you have throw at a moving target is in no way "a trap", but changing the name of the object to "net" still wouldn't have helped when you need to use it to capture animals with required materials (eggs, milk, wool) and it literally always fails the first time, even the people who talk in the forum about how they've got it all figured out, say it always takes them at least 2 traps to catch anything... and to do so, they use one, then have to chase down the animal that is now fleeing and hit it with a trap while it is running, then run over to it and get it tamed before it breaks free again...
After repeatedly playing up to the point I needed to trap something (both in the general mode (linear progression) and creative (almost open progression)) and going through 30-60 traps Not catching a single animal, I am ready to give up on this game entirely. If they fix this aspect of the game I might give it another shot, I like solo survival crafting games, but right now... I'm deleting it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996774777', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 217, 'last_played': 1547823330}
review:
Tedious.... TEE-DEE-US

I read another review that said it got boring very quickly. I thought I didn't mind the complex survival/build/strategy type games so I could overcome a degree of 'boring'... but ouch. It gets boring very quickly.

VERY nice looking game. Love the free look, movement and graphics. The GUI is clean and friendly enough (Although why I have to 'take all' for items i built with my own hands.. I have to take them off myself before I can use them? Really?) however the system for finding and obtaining recipes seems long winded. Multiple clicks to get to what you need just helps make the game boring quicker. I found that the fog of war some people are complaining about to be pefectly fine, could be stretched out a bt further but meh.

The heirachy system of building items is very good and very complex so if you like a good depth of options and different constructions this is a pretty sweet little time waster.

Unfortunately for me it just felt like that, a time waster. The tedious amount of work required to get to the higher levels of the construction heirachy are painfully laborious. I didn't even get to the first palm leaf hut before I was wondering how I could put up with the collection of the resources required to build a proper wood or brick house! For example the first basic hut requires something like 20 logs, 40 sticks (I think?), 50 palm leafs... among other things like nails (which I can't even be bothered to explain the process to get to them!). To put this in perspective, to obtain palm leaves you either kick a palm tree or chop one down. Going with kicking seems sensible so you don't kill your resource. Kicking ten times gives about 1-4 leaves. So walking around to every palm tree, kicking, collecting, move, repeat, it takes some time to get that basic resource... you see where I'm going.

I imagine once you get your systems in place it would work out streamlined but I could see by the scarce rocky outcrops and the little metals they yeilded meant that travelling far and wide to collect higher end resources was going to grind me down. That was when I pulled the pin.

Combat.... is just awkward and pointless. There should be an option to switch of foes (maybe there is I didn't go that far into it)

I wanted to like the game and I certainly do like aspects of it but it is just too tedious. It's more like a job than a game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149413594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1669397029}
review:
This is a wonderful game with lots of potential.

I understand why some people don't like the game because they say that there is a lot of grinding and after a while it becomes boring. Now, I'm not saying that what they're saying is completely false, I'm just saying that it's not completely true.

First of all, you have to remember that game is still receiving content updates. When I first bought the game, there was no fishing and no multiplayer mode. The devs are active and they are very keen on adding more content.

Finally, if this were a $30 game, then I would expect a lot more from it. But it only costs $7.99! This isn't the type of game where you grind for a month straight. It's the kind of game that you play for a few days, play something else for a while, and then play again. It's like a nice 'side game' that's good for playing once in a while.

ich habe FoN einfach mal gekauft, f√ºr den Preis von 8‚Ç¨ dachte ich mir nicht viel falsch machen zu k√∂nnen. Es war dann lange Zeit (wie so viel anderes) erstmal nur in der Bibliothek.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055982590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1505465192}
review:
Tons of potential, but many gameplay aspects totally suck enjoyment out of the game

Crafting is excessively grindy and tedius, even for a game in this genre. The most basic materials like coal or nails need an excessive amount of time and resources to make, resulting in an excessive amount of time spent grinding for materials with very little payoff.

Combat seems to be a massive afterthought, which wouldnt be a problem if it didnt happen so often. can't take five steps without getting swarmed by goblins you have to fight off with in depth "hold the left mouse button" gameplay.

Dying results in you losing a massive amount of supplies from your inventory, which again, could have taken you hours to accumilate.

The leveling system is by far the worst offender, not being able to craft things even though you have all the supplies to do so is incredibly frustrating, and not being able to level up without completeing a list of arbitrary tasks which require even more grindingfor supplies and materials just adds to that.

I have high hopes for this game, fantasy based survival/crafting games are almost non-existant, but as of now, it needs a lot of the kinks ironed out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052277634', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3671, 'last_played': 1504239449}
review:
It's fun, and has plenty of content to play in single player, and justify the price. The price is highly reasonable for even less content... however...

Multiplayer is a mess--you and the other player(s) are essentially all one player, the host... you can't go far from the host, and host has to level things up for all the characters, and if the host leaves, so do you (no server to speak of).... Since it was bought specifically for multiplayer, I can't recommend it...

If you just want a relaxing single player survival game, you could do worse. And the dev does seem to be active, so multiplayer might eventually become a legitmate thing. I'd surely change my not-recommend if it pops up someday...

review: Sehr sch√∂nes Sandbox / Crafting Game. Man kann leveln, man kann verschiedene Sachen herstellen, man k√§mpft gegen Monster und muss Quests erf√ºllen. Es macht regelrecht s√ºchtig, weiter spielen zu wollen. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037381863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 464, 'last_played': 1504580001}
review:
This game is not without some significant faults that make game play less enjoyable. 

Playing in ‚ÄúGeneral Mode‚Äù limits the items you can craft based on your character‚Äôs current level. This make early game play challenging, but not in a good way. The items you can craft at the beginning are simply underpowered, and it‚Äôs not like you can farm materials to make stronger weapons and faster tools early on. You‚Äôll encounter enemies that are not hard, but take a lot of swings to kill because of the weak weapons. Farming will become very redundant due to the slowness of the tools. You have to advance in a very linear way; it‚Äôs very anti-sandbox. The game does offer a creative mode that supposedly unlocks all building/items. 

Leveling is a little weird, you have to complete quests, which is fine. But you also have to collect resources (the same that you use to build things) are part of the requirements. Said resources are consumed when you level up. You have stats, and the only way to gain higher stats is to complete the quests and burn through resources. 

Draw / View distance. This game has a very limited draw and view distance; hiding un-rendered areas with fog. This makes the world feel very small.

This game has a weird handle on menus. submenus prevent access from their main menus; even when both menus are visible. You have to do a lot of menu juggling to get between menus. It's very clumsy, frustrating, and inconvenient.

All crafting benches require additional tools; and later on upgraded tools. It‚Äôs neat, but also requires a lot of busy work to collect the items necessary to build the tools, then the resources to build the benches.

You cannot personalize or change your character.

The English translation is a little rough; there are some grammar syntax errors that require you to read through a tool tip or quest multiple times to understand what it actually means. Some of the word usage is awkward, such as ‚ÄúSplinters‚Äù. You‚Äôll actually collect some in the very first quest, and you‚Äôll be like ‚ÄúThose aren‚Äôt really splinters‚Ä¶ technically they are, but‚Ä¶‚Äù

Building is a little clumsy, you can‚Äôt rotate your view of the area, and camera control doesn‚Äôt feel natural. 

Camrea control in general is very clumsy.

Be prepared for a lot of walking around, micro management for item crafting, redundant and boring framing. Slightly overpowered, but not difficult to defeat enemies that are time sinks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009958363', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1504468806}
review:
Controls are a little bit awkward at first, but you get used to it pretty quickly.
Its a good game so far.
Its not really a survival game - not enough survival mechanics in this game.

Pro:
-alot of stuff to gather
-alot of stuff to craft
-farming
-animals
-combat(pretty basic though)
-pretty relaxing

Con:
-pretty grindy
-combat is pretty basic
-no hunger / thirst (pretty big thing to me, would improve this game by ALOT)
-art style/colors ware a bit depressing
-clunky ui. it works, but it could be improved

afterall i give it 5 out of 10 points, and recommend it cause its definitily worth 7,99‚Ç¨

author: {'steamid': '76561198157772293', 'num_games_owned': 307, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1506825265}
review:
This is a pretty good game for the price, you could play this game for hours and not get bored. There is a lot of crafting and building and the combat is not bad. There are a few things I would like to see added or changed in the future which includes the following:

House Building: Being able to place your own foundations, ceilings, walls, doors, windows, etc would be really fun and would definetly increace the number of hours I have on this game

Being able to Destroy/Move old/garbage huts and replace them with better ones: I placed a trash hut at the beginning of the game in a good spot and was hoping I could replace it with a better one, I really hope this is changed in the future!

*THE NEXT FEW PROBLEMS I MENTION ARE ABOUT MULTIPLAYER WHICH IS CURRENTLY IN BETA, MY REVIEW WILL CHANGE WHEN NECESSARY*

Distance Limit from Other players: Currently you can only go a certain distance away from your fellow players in Multiplayer, I understand that rendering so much could be a problem, but I hope that the dev can find a way around this problem. THIS PROBLEM HAS BEEN SOLVED IN A RECENT UPDATE!!! :D

Player limit in Multiplayer: Currently, you can have a max of 2 (its 4 now) Players in General Mode (Regular Survival with Quests) and 4 Players in Creative (Survival with all recepies, and no Quests). While again, this helps prevent preformance issues, I hope the dev can find a way to fix this. 


I am not demanding that the dev changes all these or saying that the game sucks because of these minor problems, I am just recommending what I think should be added/changed to improve the game. Force of Nature is a good survival game that is worth the price, I give it a 7.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198031172371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1075, 'last_played': 1505282017}
review:
I enjoy this game because that what I was looking for.
But I do not consider this a standard crafting-survival game, so you need to think if it matches what you are looking for.

There are atamina and health meters, but they regenerate if you rest or eat.
There is food, but no hunger meter.
There are enemies, but your base is basically a safe place to rest and farm resources while you heal.

So if you are looking for a difficult survival game where everything attacks you when it gets dark, this game is not for you.
However, if like me, you are looking for a relaxing crafting game when YOU are the one that dictates the pace and progress speed, this is a great game to pass the time, and worth it even in development stages.

I do want some features that will help make this game more fun:
- The compass points to the relic, and that's fine, but it should also point to the north. Shouldn't be too hard to implement two needles.
- Minimap can be useful in navigation
- Better marking on the map to know where resources like iron are located, or an ability to mark places on the map and add notes to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066553474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 198, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1504207717}
review:
This game feels like it wants to be a more visually realistic version of don't starve or even stardew however it waaaay misses the mark. The gfx are buggy there are menus upon menus to get in the way of things. There are limited quick buttons. Uou have to press space just to see what in front of you you can interact with...and then you click on said thing. 
In addition there is no real survival mechanic. You can eat but you don't starve, you can drink but you won't die of thrust and you can make fire but wont burn or freeze or over heat to death. With that all said tbh i don't really see the point, you want to build without dying etc get stardew. You want survival move to don't starve or even rust, both are literary better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158562129', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 301, 'last_played': 1504387170}
review: I loved the idea of this game - I'm a sucker for open world crafting games - but I got bored after 4 hours. Crafting got tedious way too fast, and the game felt very linear. Combat is clunky to the point that it's not fun, and quests were limited to building x to level up, only so you can build y to level up again. I think my 10-year-old will like it, but I lost interest pretty quickly and needed something with a more advanced combat system and more complex quests.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969162919', 'num_games_owned': 934, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1506601241}
review:
This game has a lot of potential, but I can sadly not reccomend it in its current state.

A few things need to be fixed first:

- Render distance, you can't see more than 20 or 30 meters ahead before the fog sets in.
- Controls are clunky and not very friendly
- You can't move very far away from each other in multiplayer
- There's way too much grinding to get the materials you need to craft

However, I hope these things will be fixed in later patches, and then I'll gladly reccomend the game. It has a sort of The Sims Castaway feel to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000538414', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 6550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2974, 'last_played': 1589842453}
review: Force of Nature is a laid back survival game that starts off slowly and never reaches the hectic pace of its competitors. This is a great game to relax with and just build yourself a life. The campaign mode is quite linear. You'll build a rope, a campfire, a knife, etc. After a few days you may wander from your beach home and encounter a monster or two and some natural predators. Don't expand too fast or get too far from your base at first. Build first, then explore. Stock up so that you can build later too. Fun game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198155436794', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1662480895}
review:
I brought this game the other day after reading reviews on it. Being just ¬£6 i thought it was worth it as i love the genre. I like survival and craft games but i was not sure whether this would live up to the quality you'd except as some survival games nowadays are just following a trend and are'nt very great once you've played them but after playing this game when i should of been going to bed as i thought id try it out well lets just say 4 hours later in the early hours of the morning i was glad i brought this game. Ive only played it a total of 6 hours so far but i feel this game lives up to its genre.

You start being stranded on a beach and wonder how you got there then it literally throws you into survival mode, giving you quests and level ups along the way. Its quite fun if you like this type of game and i like how you can keep and farm animals but a word of warning never tame a sheep (any animal) near goblins....lets just say i had attack alerts going off constantly while i chased a group of goblins round who were chasing my sheep round, then the boars decided to join in....it did'nt end well and looked like something you'd watch while listening to the benny hill theme. My sheep however did survive and after a few attempts recused and brought back to my hut! 

The only negative thing i can say is that my worst enemy of the game is copper ingots! Omg they are annoying to make.
Other then that if you like survival crafting games, give this game a try, you should'nt be dissappointed!

My opinion: 8/10.

Have a lovely day =]

author: {'steamid': '76561198108120615', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1634588372}
review:
I actually have really been enjoying this game. That is, until my quest required that I fight a goblin to get to the next level. I really do like this game but find that I have gone as far as I am able to go now since I do not like games that require me to fight things. I just get too freaked out! I checked out the settings and am unable to play in a peaceful mode which in my opinion, should be optional.

It was fun while it lasted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115510416', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 4718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4420, 'last_played': 1620888495}
review:
I love this game, I've never heard of the developers before in my life, so i took a stab in the dark here and im glad i did. This little gem of a game is worth every penny, and this game isnt even finished yet. 

The updates are little additions here and there, as well as little changes. So far im loving this game and would highly recommend this to anyone who wants a change from the triple A titles and want to kill some hours on indie games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038868419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 173, 'last_played': 1503242813}
review: I like this game very much. Reminds me of Lost in Blue but not so dire. So far I have had a lot of fun playing this game. It's super affordable give it a try for sure if you like survival games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069436648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1503363985}
review: My girlfriend and I got this game and it honestly is a great game. Has cool RPG elements along with a really good sandbox system and its honestly unique and very entertaining. The combat is simple but it's a great game if you like rpg/sandbox type stuff and is very relaxing to play. However the multiplayer (it being in beta as I write this) has some issues where it gets stuck on loading eternally with a "Waiting for data from other players" notification, but, my girlfriend and I having contacted the ONE DEV about this issue have received recognition from him and he's trying his very best to fix things and continues to be very helpful and we are very appreciative. This is a great game especially for one guy developing it. The camera angle is different but it isn't bad or unbearable. I definitely recommend this game and have good faith in the developer. Just be patient and let the guy take his time. He most likely has a life aside from making this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013779216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 10284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8039, 'last_played': 1504242905}
review:
i spent very happy time for the first 20 hours, until my character reach level8.
To achive level9, i was destinated to the very far side of the map, almost across the universe.
i walked and walked, but at some point, temperature became too hot.
i made and equip all anti-environment equippment, but that's not enough,
i must eat prercious food all along the way, and at last reached the questing point, but many enemies showed ultra-response and rushed towards me.

i tried almost everything, but temperature drained my HP so quickly.
After 40 hours, i found myself doing nothing but bake bread for restoring  HP.
i need 3 hours baking bread and consumed it for only 5minutes of fighting toward the questing point and retreat.
i bake bread ,try forward and retreat again and again and again.

i recommend this game IF YOU LOVE BAKING BREAD ALL THE TIME.
Of course i don't.

World is created each time you begin new game, so i understand sometimes i can't avoid picking up very unfriendly environment.
But this is BEYOND try and challenge-matter.

balancing was very poor and i abandoned playing after 20 hours  challnge and failure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078109208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2219, 'last_played': 1509383280}
review:
Gut Ding will weile haben,
das beschreibt dieses spiel ganz gut. In Force of Nature gehts nichts schnell und das muss es auch gar nicht. Es macht einem keinen druck zu verhungern oder verdursten oder das die vorr√§te verderben. So manch einer sagt das w√§hre ja kein richtiges survival, ja und? Dieses Spiel bietet entspanntes sammeln und anbauen, dekorieren und bauen in entspanntem feierabentempo. Wer aktion im schnelldurchlauf sucht muss eben was anderes spielen. Mir pers√∂nlich macht es viel spass und ich kann mich austoben mein " zuhause" auszubauen und so zu gestalten wie ich m√∂chte. Das kampfsystem ist zugegebener ma√üen ein wenig gew√∂hnungsbed√ºftig und der gute herr hauptakteur nicht besonders h√ºbsch und hat ab und an seltsame bewegungsabl√§ufe. Der Rest ist aber h√ºbsch gestaltet mit liebe zum detail. alles in allem kann man hier viel zeit verbringen f√ºr wenig geld.

author: {'steamid': '76561197973598382', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1566, 'last_played': 1504367828}
review:
What a great little game this turned out to be!
If you enjoy base building, progression, exploring, resource gathering and survival then you will probably enjoy this game quite a lot.
Some reviews I noticed there was alot of mention of invisable walls, I don't think the term invisable is warrented in this case, sure there are cliffs and collision but most things can be chopped down or mined away plus alot of the time the collision is actually handy not to get swarmed with mobs, you can quite easily cut a narrow path through the undergrowth to take on mobs one at a time for example.
For the price and the content already available its a no brainer! Buy it!

review: Ein wirklich tolles Spiel ! Frisst kaum Speicher, l√§uft fl√ºssig ohne ende-selbst auf meinem Rechner-... Ich kann es nur Empfehlen. Danke an den lieben Freund der es mir geschenkt hat :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198054996980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1458, 'last_played': 1502828752}
review:
My son and I each bought a copy of this last week.
 We've played it every day since then. 
We just reached level 12, so we might take a break from it soon. 
  We have enjoyed the game. 

I like how the dev (or Dev Team?) has been releasing small additions/patches often.

Granted, this game is still in development.
 It remains to be seen how far it will come.

 As it is now, it IS worth the 8 bucks we paid for each copy.
 And that's really the bottom line.

 However,
 I'd like to be able to venture far-further away from each other. 
And the collision needs some improvement. 
 And it was sometimes a pain that he had to log out, so we could log back in together.
 Also, feeding chickens to get one egg at a time was hard on my wrist and my patience. 

 The rest is just obvious stuff. like "needs more stuff". 

 Ideas for some of that "more stuff":

 I'd love to eventually see caves, abandoned houses, bridges, NPCs, shops, escort quests, 
a pet (that can be tamed, leveled, and kept permanently),
spooky towers, and humor. 

Thanks for a fun game at a fair price. 
 Keep up the good work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091281378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2984, 'last_played': 1528447856}
review:
Force of Nature is a Frustratingly Fun Open World 2d Castaway type game.  It does have it's pros and con's 

Pro's
Easy Combat 
Good Controls 
Crafting will keep you busy for hours
Keeps you Entertained 
Nice rain Affects
Armor and weapons are nice
Weather affect is a nice touch



Con's
Constant Farming for materials can become boring and tedious
Aggro on emeies is out of Range they will swarm you half a mile away
To many trees in the forest areas you will spend hours whacking away trees and branches 
Animal run away to much causing aggro issues that can get you killed easily
Magic doesn't need to be here Altars etc
Needs more cooking recipies 
Needs more Armor to fight off cold weather
The map is pure shit but will help you
Poision remedy needs to be easier to obtain
Ending of game is shit

Now even with more nitpicking than positive I recommend this game it is very fun and can keep you entertained for hours on end. What would make this game a solid thumbs up I would get rid of the magic elements and turn this into a solid Castaway type game IT IS A VERY FUN GAME just a few things need tweaking.

review:
Infelizmente esse jogo tinha tudo para ser perfeito, por√©m logo de cara me vejo com um limite de distancia entre a outra pessoa que esta jogando com voc√™... Sem contar que o craft √© muito lento, voc√™ n√£o sente fome, sede, etc.. √â apenas o HP e Stamina, deixando o game um tanto quanto Arcade e n√£o simulador.
Se quiser jogar offline, at√© que √© interessante, por√©m o modo multiplayer al√©m de estar em beta, √© bem zuado, pois os dois players ficam vinculados a mesma quest e n√£o √© individual quanto nos demais jogos, at√© para aumentar o level, somente o host pode fazer isso para os dois.
Mais um Refund para a cole√ß√£o.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055586349', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2116, 'last_played': 1504388539}
review:
Like survivor games? This has got the right balance between crafting,building and bad stuff. In fact, it immediately pulled me in and kept me going until the early morning hours!  You can spend your time building, crafting, exploring without risking dying every 10 minutes. You don't have to die of thirst by refilling yourself with water every second or eating every minute. Your stamina is tied to how much work you do. More work, more stamina required. The nourishment then doesn't become some ridiculous kabuki theatre like certain other survivor games like Stranded Deep.

The game is truly progressive in that the more you engage and want to grow your base and character it will allow you to make the move. This will then allow you to craft more complex things including buildings, weapons, armour, farming. Capture sheep and start the important job of cultivating wool an important ingredient in armour and clothes. Increase the quality of your wearables and increase your character's armour rating. A very smart gentle nudging to move to bigger and better things. 

Graphics are just fine maybe understated but not pretentious. Brings back to mind the Ultima top down  series but more complex  and involved. Primarily survival but allows you to move to RPG areas without being in your face. 

It  then cleverly ties to character development and advancement  qua role playing. Playability is off the charts. Winner!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971522769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 5957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4602, 'last_played': 1565631132}
