author: {'steamid': '76561198018201450', 'num_games_owned': 939, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1502041057}
review:
I have around 12 hours into the game, this one is an odd game.  It is grindy, monotonous, slow paced, graphics are meh, sound is basic as hell but for some strange reason it is very addictive.  Its got that... civilisation-one-more-turn feel to it.  What keep you going is all the cool stuff that opens up to you to craft once you level up.  The new gear means you can push further into the wilderness and see more biomes, loot and monsters.   

The interface is okay, could do with some more hotkeys here and there, but nothing too essential missing.  The sound is passable, at least its not too annoying.  one tip:  put the portal away from your main area, it has an annoying loud hum that made me turn down the game's volume and it can't be moved once placed.  The graphics are passable, its not cute, charming or beautiful, but does the job ok.  The movement of the player is a little slow, wish he can run faster.  You can't out run any of the creatures in the game really.  

NO, despite what other reviewers have said... no this game doesn't lend itself to roleplaying, its mechanics are too predictable, "mechanical" and linear for any meaningful roleplaying.  

Another complaint:  The pacing is haphazard, Thing were slow but steady until level 6 to level 7, it got super slow to level up with a bunch of hard to do quests and what is most annoying is the RNG required to get the 5 gold bars to levelup,  (To get gold bars you need gold coins drop randomly from goblins, this took absolutely forever at this stage.  Once you grind pass level 7, the RNG for getting gold is mitigated somewhat by the much better weapons you get at level 7 and so you are killing stuff much quicker.  I haven't done the level 7 quests yet, but they seem to have returned to reasonable again.   Hope it doesn't slow down again, its a slow going game that can feel like a glacial slog if it slows down any further, I was tempted to quit for the night during level 6.

The good:  Its a solid game, very tight, even though the level questing is linear there is room for variety in terms of the efficiency engine you want to create for yourself.  Not quite open-world variety, but what little there is makes your decisions feel important.  The loot is well thought out and nothing is obsolete and everything seems consequential.  The price is definitely a bonus.  Played this alone and probably wouldn't be a good multiplayer game with adult gamers (at least my gaming buddies, the pace is way too slow.  As a single player that is exceptable, I could be listening to music or something), but I could see this work with young kids though.  

Yes, I would recommend this game to those that enjoy an old school slow-paced linear leveling survival game that is well designed and tight and have a real addictive quality to it, then go for it, the price is fair.  If you want adrenaline pumping action, hair-pulling difficulty, or a game that is difficult to master, you are going to be disappointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051295885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 663, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1507030291}
review:
I know we say graphics aren't everything but despite my initial reaction to look of the game I've already spent a bit of time in it and want to play more. Force of Nature really puts you in an untamed wilderness, you have to actually bushwhack to get to places. It forces you to reshape the land. I find that very refreshing. Plus you also get the fantasy element of fighting goblins and whatnot which is a nice change of pace to the zombies that infest most survival games these days. 

Clear the land, build a house, smack some monstes around.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989310904', 'num_games_owned': 615, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 7956, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7271, 'last_played': 1629772696}
review:
Um dos melhores jogos de sobrevivencia que ja joguei !

Jogabilidade excelente
Variedade de materiais extra√≠veis do mundo
Muitos inimigos (aumentam conforme voc√™ aumenta o level)
Possibilidade de construir inumeras coisas
Barracos, Barris, Ba√∫s, Fogueiras, Fog√£o a lenha, Fornalhas, Portais, e inumeras outras ferramentas e maquinas
Possibilidades de  domar diversos animais, como porcos, galinhas, galos, vacas, ovelhas cabras e muito mais
Cada animal domado vai ser respons√°vel por produzir elementos como leite, ovos, penas e outros diversos elementos que ser√£o usados no crafting do jogo

Jogo baseado em quests, o que  dificulta a subida de nivel, deixando o jogo mais desafiador ainda.

Grafico bonito e leve, enviroment agrad√°vel, varia√ß√µes clim√°ticas dos mais diversos tipos, como sol, chuva, neve, neblina etc...

 ainda n√£o encontrei nem bugs e nem algo que pudesse relatar contra o jogo, ent√£o √© um jogo que recomendo muito.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022215970', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 8221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2580, 'last_played': 1689087382}
review:
Hmmm...
Habe sehr viele EInsch√§tzungen und Bewertungen gelesen.
Diese haben mich inspiriert es auch zu kaufen und zu testen.

1.) Grafik ist nicht die beste ,,, daher f√ºr alle Grafikfetischisten FINGER weg:) F√ºr mich i.O.  !
2.) Handling Steuerung ist sehr Gew√∂hnungsbed√ºrftig , aber der Mensch ist ja ein .....lassen wir das , man kommt zurecht,            
      gew√∂hnt sich daran. Hoffe aber dennoch das sich die Kamara irgendwann mal noch ein wenig ver√§ndern l√§sst:)
3.) Story ( falls man es so bezeichnen kann) ist okay und motviert weiter zu machen bin jetzt lvl 7 kurz vor 8 hab mir da    
     echt  jetzt zeit gelassen, da es ab da natural Teile zu finden gibt , die bewacht werden...:-)
4. K√§mpfe sind etwas stupide aber O.K. man muss halt auf passen und immer gut dabei haben, ich habe derzeit Brot  
     dabei gibt 40 Gesundheit in 20sec oder so plus meinem Kaffee der das selbe in Ausdauer macht. Also "Stupides" 
     ist zwar m√∂glich, aber nur mit einem Gewissen Equip und gen√ºged Vorbereitung. Dennoch muss man aufpassen, da
     weglaufen meist nicht hilft , ausser man kennt einige Tricks, was aber nich immer hilft. Mir machts spass!!!
5. Sound Kulisse Hindergrund sind okay , f√ºr mich passt es , da ich oft ne 12std. Schicht habe und danach einfach entspannen will sei es craften oder sammeln oder auch etwas fighten um an Gold zu kommen.:)
6.) Multiplayer ist in Vorbereitung, d.h. theoretisch funzt es  schon....muss das aber leider noch antesten mit nem Kumpel.

[b]FAZIT:
KLEINES GELD ..... GROSSER SUCHTFAKTOR!!!!   Erwische mich oft noch dabei  wo ich mir sage , ach nur noch die Bretter hertsellten die H√ºhner nochmals F√ºttern und nen Sprung zu den K√ºhen gehen . Ach etwas Holz fehlt noch  das mache ich  noch usw usw usw,
F√ºr Zwischen durch und auch f√ºr l√§nger durchaus geeignet meine Empfehlung bei einer skala von 1-10 (10 beste) w√§re ich hier auf eine gute 7plus oder auch 8.
Klar gibt es  "Conan" "ARK"! usw..... wer kennt das nicht. Aber das hier ist entspanned , wenn man will und es macht spasssss!
Mal sehn was da noch kommt. Ausschlaggebend war f√ºr mich der Preis, hatte es im Angebot gekauft f√ºr gute 5 Euro:)

author: {'steamid': '76561198250283818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1500230643}
review: I got bored. Fast. Was excited to play this and bought it when the July sale came out. But I was a little disappointed when I saw that I have to unlock everything and have to wait days on end (in game) until I can actually build anything. I played this for less than an hour and just stopped. I liked the idea/concept of the game, but I would like to just have everything there at once to build. And maybe have the days and nights a bit more lengthy.
developer_response: There is an creative mode which is almost the same as general but everything is available from the beginning. Also in the near future I will add the magic night vision glasses.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036434805', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 2832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2148, 'last_played': 1501098224}
review:
Ich sag mal klipp und klar, worum es in diesem Spiel geht und auch ein paar Worte zum neuen Multiplayer ... Spielprinzip + Pros und Kontras



- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
SPIELPRINZIP
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Survival? Nope!
Ein Survival w√ºrde implizieren, dass man reagieren muss, um sein Ableben zu verhindern ... also die Handlung des "√úberlebens" t√§tigen ... 
Bei "Force of Nature" gibt es daf√ºr weder die essentielle "Hunger", noch die "Durst" Anzeige ... sprich, man kann den ganzen Tag, gem√ºtlich im Garten herum chillen ...

Und dort wo man beginnt, lauern auch keine Gefahren ... man k√∂nnte einfach da bleiben, wo man anf√§ngt und es w√ºrde nichts passieren ...  diesen Ort zu verlassen, birgt nur das unn√∂tige Risiko sich Gefahren auszusetzen ... warum sollte man sich das antun?

Ja, w√§ren da nicht die sogenannten "Quests" ... und der Drang nach Belohnungen ...
Denn diese Quests sind der Grund, der uns n√∂tigt, die Startlocation zu verlassen ...
Sie funktionieren ungef√§hr so:
1. Baue X
Um X zu bauen, musst du Y finden
2. Baue Z
Um Z  zu bauen, brauchst du 2 X

Und so weiter ... also begebt man sich quasi immer freiwillig in Gefahr, um seine Quests abzuschlie√üen ...

Im Grunde genommen ist das f√ºr mich kein Survival, sondern ein Aufbauspiel ... mit Schwerpunkt auf 


- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
MULTIPLAYER
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Etwas unfair, ein nachgereichtes Multiplayer-System, welches sich in der Bethaphase befindet, zu beurteilen, aber so ist der Stand der Dinge:

- Ein Spieler hostet die Welt, die er vorher alleine erstellt hat
(sprich, der beigetretene Spieler, kann diese Welt nicht alleine weiter spielen, sollte der Host off sein, umgekehrtes ist nat√ºrlich der Fall)

- Die Spieler d√ºrfen sich nicht zu weit von einander entfernen, bzw. immer in Sichtweite bleiben, sonst ist da einfach eine undurchdringliche, unsichtbare Barriere.
Das bedeutet, man kann nicht sagen "Du gehst Erz holen, ich baue hier weiter" ... sondern nur "Los, wir gehen Erz holen" oder "Wir bauen hier weiter"

- Programmiertechnisch spielt man eine Person, auf zwei Personen aufgeteilt.
Steigt Spieler 1 eine Stufe auf, steigt auch Spieler 2 eine Stufe auf
Stirbt Spieler 1, stirbt auch Spieler 2 ...

- Es gibt 2 Modi, einmal den "Quest"-Modus, wo man alle Konstruktionen die man bauen kann, durch das abschlie√üen von Quests freischalten muss, sprich "Man hat Aufgaben" ... und den "Kreativ"-Modus, wo es weder Aufgaben, noch einschr√§nkungen gibt, hierbei werden allerdings auch keine "Errungenschaften" freigeschaltet.
Allerdings kann man den "Quest"-Modus nur alleine oder zu zweit spielen.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
PRO
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

+ Sehr tiefes Craftsystem, hier kann man wirklich viele Dinge herstellen, bin ich von anderen Spielen nicht gewohnt

+ F√ºr eine Zuf√§llig-Generierte Welt, sieht das alles sehr gut aus. Wird f√ºr langanhaltenden spa√ü sorgen

+ Einzigartige, kreative Ideen ... Graben nach Ton, Zinn, Kupfer, Palmwedeln, Kokosn√ºsse, Sonnenblumenkerne, Kaffeebohnen, so viele Blumen und Pilzsorten ... und dazu noch ein Bauernhof Simulator ... alles in einem Spiel, f√ºr schlappe 8 Euro ... hier wurde vieles richtig gemacht

+ Alle Gegenst√§nde die man fallen l√§sst, werden grafisch als auf dem Boden liegende, 3 Dimensionale Gegenst√§nde als das dargestellt, was sie tats√§chlich sind. Wird man ein Ei auf dem Boden, ist auf dem Boden also ein Ei zu sehen.
Sowas simples, bekommen selbst Entwickler mit Millionen Budget (The Elder Scrolls Online) nicht hin, ist man ganz einfach nicht gewohnt. Finde ich Klasse, dass sich dieser Aufwand hier gemacht wurde. Sieht nicht nur schick aus, man kann "sehen" was da liegt, ohne irgendwie da reingucken zu m√ºssen ... !

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
KONTRA
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

- Die Grafik ist "Naja"

- Kein Charakter Editor, man spielt immer diesen h√§sslichen Jungen, und wenn man, so wie ich, das Spiel mit einer Freundin zusammen spielt, spielen wir zwei h√§ssliche Jungs, da es nicht Mal m√∂glich ist, ein h√§ssliches M√§dchen zu spielen

- Das Kampfsystem ist so primitiv und schlecht gemacht, dass ich seine Funktionsweise gar nicht erst erkl√§ren m√∂chte.
Stellt euch einfach das primitivste Kampfsystem vor, dass man sich f√ºr ein Third Person Adventure vorstellen kann

FAZIT

Ja, dass Kampfsystem ist beschissen, die Grafik ist Banane, es gibt keinen Charakter Editor, der Multiplayermodus ist eine Zumutung und es ist kein Survival ...

Andere Frage: Macht es spa√ü?

JA, irgendwie schon ... 

Also im Teamspeak/Skype mit nem Freund oder einer Freundin abh√§ngen, zusammen im Multiplayer Modus "Force of Nature" zocken ... und man hat einen l√§ssigen Abend mit Unterhaltungswert, zu dem Preis, lohnt sich das auf jeden Fall :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198016501753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6690, 'last_played': 1530729412}
review:
I caught Force of Nature on sale for $6 bucks, and grabbed it to give it a try.  What a lucky find!
I'm 90 hours into FoN, and still having a great time with it! 

You can nitpick the little things, like the camera view is a little odd compared to a lot of 3rd person games, but the game is chocked full of fun! 

Money well spent right here, this game is great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198064341909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1547442870}
review:
Brutally slow...fun concept but bogged down with bad controls!

I hate WASD based games.  Had I known this ahead of time I would not have spent the $8.

I've played about 3 hours and still hate the controls.  Can't recommend it based on those.  If you can get rid of the WASD functionality, then I will come back.  Until then, it's a Thumbs Down!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025007953', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 3880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1188, 'last_played': 1509235094}
review:
This game rocks. It has an old-school feel to it. Smoke a bowl, play some tunes, and do your thing. 
Resource Gathering, Farming, Base building, Crafting, Survival.
It's slow paced, take your time in each level building your new unlocks and making your base how you like it.If you're just trying to get to an end-point you aren't going to have a good time. 
I recommend playing with a friend, I've really been enjoying this one. 

Bummers:
No Linux
No female char - ladies game too, damnit!
I see a lot of bitching about the tether to the other player, frustrating, but good when one of you tends to wander off and die.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992433506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1508395348}
review:

Wer das Genre mag, viel Geduld und Ausdauer mitbringt wird "Force of Nature" bestimmt m√∂gen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090511780', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2634, 'last_played': 1529262336}
review:
I was kind of afraid I wouldn't like this game but the price was low enough I figured I'd give it a try. I'm so glad I did because it's turned out to be one of my favorites. The creators didn't get caught up in trying to over complicate things. It's a simple sandbox survival game that sates the desire to build, explore, farm, fight, and level up. HOWEVER I haven't yet felt 'forced' into doing any of the above. Some days I just hang out on my farm and make a ton of coffee. Other days I go on a killing spree in the woods around my house.

It's a great, simple game that lets you play along in your favorite play style. For the price, this is a good game to have in your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125204859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1789, 'last_played': 1500672377}
review:
Invisible wall - invisible wall - I sure do hope - you like invisible walls.  Because they're everywhere.  I think navigating the landscape is likely the most challenging thing about this game.  That hill is too steep, but the one right next to it, which looks the same angle, isn't.  Ok.  Then the trees and bushes are in your way.  You chop them down, collect the stuff, now you got too much stuff.  Now storage becomes an issue.  Where do I put all this crap?  Build some chests and barrels.  Ok.  But now that's an ever creeping problem.  Bah - I really dislike invisible walls and storage stress as part of a games 'challenge'.

That said, after 30 hours I'm still enjoying it.  Mostly.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996104527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1923, 'last_played': 1564956148}
review:
I really have enjoyed this game. I purchased this game on a weekend to do multiplayer with my two adolescent sons, at the time of writing  this you can only do two players in "survival mode" and 4 players in the "creative mode" the only real difference I noticed was every thing was unlocked to build and no quests which I don't recall having any rewards, the quests seem to be like a tutorial kind of guidance. I really enjoy the game though and think it is an amazing value, could easily be worth more. 

Ps I have a hard time having the discipline not to build unlimited buildings or the best items right away in "creative mode" but since you have to grind out the resources, it's not that over powered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031457095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 203, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1502945610}
review:
Bought this game cause I'm a stingy bastard and didn't want to fork out $25 for LiF;Forest Village after watching my partner abuse the game for weeks on end. I decided to give this a shot, cause fucking $7.99 mate! 

Needless to say, we were both fucking impressed, little goblins chasing you round, goats and chickens that make your gay uncle Marvin look straight, and some madly entertaining gameplay. 

+1 to developers, may they continue to bless us with more rabbit chasing galore!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997071860', 'num_games_owned': 443, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6920, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3020, 'last_played': 1544739738}
review:
[i]Hello, this is another 'early access crafting survival sandbox game'.[/i] And if you're interested in theme, it's actually fun!
[strike]-------------------------------------------------------------------------[/strike]
[h1]Theme of the game[/h1]
You're washed ashore of some land. You've got some boldly ripped shorts on you and... that's all. Goal: survive against wildlife, and build youself some roof over your head (or over your things). Good luck!

[h1]Execution of the idea[/h1]
Someone sat down, and actually thought trough the whole thing. Progression from digging stick to first class shovel is nicely implemented - all tools have great impact on your gameplay, and you feel, that there is really need to push forward.

[h1]Gameplay feel[/h1]
After every discovery, of what you can build, smelt or make, there is an influx of 'oh darn, this is sooo repetitive! And yes - it is and it is intended this way. If you actually landed with nothing on you on a foreign land, you won't build brickhouse from day 1 - you'd have to really make your tools, gather materials and so on. Yet from time to time you discover ways game is making some tasks easier for you - you just have to work your way to them!

The game lacks proper story, and I don't think there is a need for one. But in return nothing stops you from some roleplaying.

[h1]Audiovisual experience[/h1]
Music is virtually non-existent in the game - it plays every time you discover and visit new biome (you can force in the options to play it when you visit it again, after some time), and honestly I wouldn't mind it playing more often. It's catchy and good. But the real background is really the true sound of nature - cicadas in the night, birds singing, ocean waves washing the shore, sounds of insects buzzing around you, delicate noise of leaves in the wind, bubbling of a swamp, ice breaking in the frozen desert, or creepy silence of the cold wasteland... It really can relax!

The graphics are nice - nothing much else you can say about them. They are pleasing, but not super-highly detailed, they blur a little. This has nice side effect of the game having quite low hardware requiariments, while it still looks good. There are a couple of ingenious tricks, that make the game more immersive - like vision going out of sharpness, like your avatar is shivering from the cold, or bloody noise and occasional blackouts when you're hurt badly. Small visual cues, that make the game feel more natural.

There are no errors I could spot (except flower pot just floating in the air), and in over 40 hours I've spent in this game, I haven't got a crash or error.

Protagonist's movement are absolutely great - not disrtacting, natural (he has to actually turn around, and not just swirls in place as you move your mouse).

[h1]Interface and playability[/h1]
Coming from other crafting/sandbox games, UI is surprisingly polished. It feels natural, and consequential, but is poorly documented. I feel like some more actions need extra buttons (like 'Take all' should have its own hotkey, or when clicking an item in the chest with i.e. shift all items of this kind could get transfered), but in the end it serves its purpose - you're not limited by it, most of the time. WHERE IS MY MAP ZOOM!?

One thing that needs to be mentioned is the camera - first thing you need is to set it to 'free' in the options, or else you'll end up in that strange overhead view.

[h1]Difficulty[/h1]
While most of the game is collecting stuff, combat is unaviodable. It doesn't require lighting fast reflexes, but rather feeling into it and good timing, and you'll get out of most of the fights unscathed, just keep number of enemies you're fighting low. You won't drown, fall to your death or otherwise croak, so until you wander into pack of bears while backpedalling shooting your bow at goblins, you'll be fine. In short - remember your surroundings.

[h1]Target audience[/h1]
That's hard question. It's both engaging game, and a relaxing one. It has potential, is pleasing to eyes and ears, and transfers very well the difficulty of making your way in the wilderness. I'd say, if you've enjoy watching [i]Primitive Technology[/i] on Youtube, you'll probably enjoy this game. It's building blocks and mechanics are very simple, so I'd say the age bracket is very wide.

[b]I clearly enjoyed this game, and I do not regret spending money on it, It's something different, just not in the same way as jumping from Minecraft to Goat Simulator. There are downsides - like repetitiveness of some tasks and the fact you have to progress from biome to biome in a sequence, or you'll end up with enemies way above your level, but in return you get to immerse into experience you're probably not going to experience (unless you go to field trip in Australia and get lost in the bush).[/b]

[h1]Final objective score: 6.5/10[/h1]
[h1]Final personal subjective score: 8/10[h1].

author: {'steamid': '76561197962021312', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1285, 'last_played': 1502300455}
review:
I am a huge fan of sandbox based games. Once you figure out how the mechanics work it's rather enjoyable. I hope they open this game up to allowing fans to do custom modifications like they did with 7 Days to Die. 

The graphics are pretty decent
The concept is great
The user interface could use some minor tweaks to make it a little more understandable to the new players but easily able to figure out. 

I would recommend it to anybody looking for a nice game to fill their time when they get bored with their other sandbox style games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038689828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1045, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1621943277}
review: A basic, but still enjoyable survival game. Waking on a tropical island, you must use your wits and resources around you to survive. More a casual game, then anything really serious. Probably what makes it so entertaining.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015106678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 3692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3259, 'last_played': 1503277393}
review:
I did enjoy this game for a while now and except to the coop we can recommend it, it is fun and a beautiful game, but we would not really recommand to get it for playing coop. If you want to know why go please to my steam curator page: http://top-or-flop.bytefortress.de/review_force_of_nature.html
Unfortunately most people will probably want to rather play a game like this with some friend, so we can't recommend it for now till this coop system gets changed.
This game has still a lot of problems and if you are thinking about buying it and aren't sure yet you should read my page.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198134640233', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1322, 'last_played': 1663792167}
review:
For those who like surviva games, FON (Force of Nature) is a cheap and very enoyable way to have fun! The exciting gameplay, ambient sounds, thrilling exploration and the great ease into the game is soo good in this game. As you can see, i have played a reasonable amount of time on the game and so i would definately recommend it!

Now you need to understand, however, that this game is new and still has polishing to do but so far (for a new game) it has done really well. Also, i do understand how some people have complained about the grinding element. Firstly, practically all survival games need some aspect of grinding at times and so i feel that FON did really well in creating inventive ways to grinding so it wasn't so boring because there was always an adventure when getting some new materials!

I just want to say that, for the price of this game, you should certainly think about getting it because of the fun you will have as well as the new addition of multiplayer!

author: {'steamid': '76561197962347142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 904, 'last_played': 1499237178}
review:
This game is fantastic. I have already got my moneys worth and I cant seem to put this game down. I love the quest system which basically guides you through the game. The graphics are not that great but they are acceptable, the gameplay far overrides the need for great graphics. Every session of grind has a reward where you can get to the next level or achieve the ability to build something new. 

The fact that you can move everything you have built around without any penalty is brilliant so when I get bored with my homestead or come up with a better idea i can just move things around.

Some improvement on the combat would be welcome and some small quality of life improvements would be great like being able to shift click stacks between inventory and storage, being able to queue crafting recipies wouldnt go a miss either.

All in all a fantastic game from a developer who seems to listen to the people playing it. Well worth the asking price, sale or otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014196104', 'num_games_owned': 879, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 8023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6891, 'last_played': 1526839209}
review:
For the few ¬£ I spent it has been a great game.

50 hours in and my thoughts are as follows.  Not played sandbox yet so this is only for levelling and currently level 10.  Initially I found the crafting clunky and it took a while to get used to.   The hard caps to stop you levelling are annoying, Early levels you have to go kill goblins to get your gold coins and later levels have to kill stuff to get your gem chips.  Having to kill stuff to level annoyed me but i can see why the dev did it this way.   At the start I found the goblins a bit of a weird addition to a crafting/exploration game but you get used to it and some of the later monsters I found quite fun.

Annoying to have to craft a set of clothing for basically a new area and to level.  I can see the rationale behind it but going from a tropical +35 to a -5 area in a matter of a few strides seems a bit weird.   Not sure why the dev capped certain buildings in the levelling mode to me if I want to build 10 wells to sort my water problem out I should be able to.  I am hoping sandbox mode allows this.

That aside the game is laid back for the most part and is well balanced and I have had fun playing it.  Grindy in places it still gives a sense of achivement and I am hopeful that the dev keeps up his great work.  As a left hander who never got to grip with WASD great to see controls can be changed and you can run it in windows mode just remember to use the escape key before going out to windows.  This could turn into a classic game.  Once I finish the main game I am looking forward to see how sandbox goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066102063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 83, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 83, 'last_played': 1498782078}
review:
I had read some positive and negative reviews and I thought "Well, it's on sale right now, and it looks like my kind've thing, why not give it a try?"

Spoilers: I returned the game for a full refund.

First of all... the game plays slowly. Not a relaxing kind of slow, it's a boring kind of slow. ...and that's if your stamina (which runs out entirely too quickly) hasn't packed up too much, in which case it becomes mind-numbingly slow. There are foods you can eat to restore stamina... but they don't restore much. You're better off just leaving your character sitting there, browsing the internet in the background and coming back in a minute or two when it's back up to a reasonable level.

The camera is absolutely atrocious. Typically when you play something you expect to be able to WASD and the camera follows you nicely, or use the mouse as camera control. Not with this game. The vast majority of the time if you want to control the camera you have to move your mouse whilst holding Space. ...why not hold right click or, y'know, actually switch to a good FPS view so WASD + Mouse was an option?

The menus are a pain in the ass. Inventory is something I like to keep open in games. In this game though it restricts your movement and camera control of course because... why wouldn't it..? There are multiple crafting menus rather than having a single one with different categories in it. This of course means more screen space and control is taken away from you.

Nothing is obvious. Either you need it spelled out for you or have to somehow stumble upon a solution by blind luck. I needed palm leaves for rope. Sure, you find some laying around. I used that for a knife (and you HAVE to make everything in order or you can't move on to the next step). No palm leaves for rope, how do I make a hatchet to progress? Turns out you have to kick the palm tree. Because of coouurse.

Combat is ridiculous. For rabbits you have to trap them in a corner. This is very difficult because they are faster than you and even when you have them trapped chances are they'll STILL get away. It's easier with goblins because they don't run. Aaand neither can you. You get two weapons early game to beat goblins with (which, of course, is necessary for game progression). One does less damage but allows you to dodge, one does higher damage but you need more of a swing so you're more likely to take a hit. This is a lie though, as you cannot dodge at all. Doesn't matter how much you side-step or back off, they will keep hitting you, so the only real option is the higher damage weapon, and you're still going to get hurt. You only have these two weapons, no armour, and of course no ability to make the odds better in your favour by preparing.

Levelup is the most awkward thing about the game though. You have to complete certain tasks in order to level up, and thus y'know, actually play the game. The entire game ends up an extended tutorial, and as much as I really tried to give this game a chance to get better... it just... continuously got worse. At no point did I ever have an ounce of fun. It was just a chore to get to the "real gameplay" which I eventually realised would never come. In most games you expect to be in a good position within maybe half an hour at most. It took me over an hour to get... essentially nowhere. For the majority of the time I kept thinking "I wish I was playing something else."

This game could've been so much more. I think that's the worst part. The ideas are there but implemented so badly that you have to wonder what in the flying fiddlesticks were they thinking when designing this game? If they changed the camera to FPS that alone would fix a shit tonne of what is wrong with this game. Remove levelup via tutorial and just give it an exp-based system. Make combat optional, like... you can choose to go to areas that enemies are in, or choose to play it safe. Also make combat less like a pointless slapfight too.

This whole game feels like that one friend you don't really like who is dragging you to every clothes shop in town and making you look at every item of clothing in the store whilst you're hungry and tired and just want to go home.

Ultimately I'd give this game a 1/10. That 1 is only for the ideas they have, wasted on the horrendousness of their execution.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002189495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 656, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1569723686}
review:
If your wondering if you should pick up this game it's a big yes from me at least. I was worried about the camera view, but it is much better than the video shows and there is some other camera option which I haven't tried yet.

The game is fun to play. It's an open world, but it's also quest driven to unlock craftables. The quest driven part is very nice; keeps the game interesting and each play through is randomly generated.  You also level up as you kill goblins, collect coins from them, craft certain items, tame animals, build farms, etc. It's a very nice mix that keeps me busy and it's enjoyable. There is a pretty good variety of animals and creatures which is good to see so far. 

The graphics are nice. I picked this up on sale and I'm very happy I did. The amount of games on Steam can be mind boggling, but this one should keep me coming back for more.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996127261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1572, 'last_played': 1499222870}
review:
At first, I was enjoying the game. Collect this, build that, hunt, farm, explore. But, that quickly changed to disappointment. See bottom for TL:DR

I reached level 6 before I started to plateau. There doesn't seem to be a lot of levels, but compared to the first 5, I was in level 6 for what seemed like twice or three times the amount of time it took me to reach level 5.

At level 6, you're fighting a lot more mobs. As you explore and fight more, you'll quickly realize how lacking the combat system is.

Major issues include: When you die, you lose a random amount of items in your inventory. All that wood you just spent a ton of time and stamina replenishing items on to collect, kiss it all goodbye. You can lose anything ranging from dumb items like logs, to more valuable stuff. I admit I probably should have made more chests to hold my gear back at base, but having to make a hut, just to hold a chest, is mind-numbing. I don't want to have to make three huts and 10 chests to hold all my stuff; it would take days. Real-life days.

You can't pick up what you lost on death. Don't want to lose it? Don't carry it. -Big flaw imho.

The combat mechanic is poorly executed, unexciting, and unrewarding. Animals run away from you when they have 2 hp's left, and you can't chase after them unless you want to aggro another half-dozen mobs. All the health/stamina replenishment items you used to survive combat is all wasted on an enemy that is now surrounded by his friends. This issue is mentioned in their discussion threads often. It's easier, and more exciting to fight a bear who wont run, then some pipsquak fox who'll sprint away, after gnawing half your HP down. -This is another major flaw.

You can make teleport pads before you can make simple clothes or armor? Have fun going 7 levels before you can put a shirt or shoes on. -Most major flaw of them all

The graphics are pretty good, but are wasted on the rest of the game, which needs to play catch-up. The only saving grace this game has is, it has triple monitor support out of the box. Who knew a game this unsophisticated could support triple monitors?!

TL:DR
Think of this game as an overglorified Farmville. At this time I do not recommend this game, unless it is 75% off or more. It's only worth about that much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051326651', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1078, 'last_played': 1566735708}
review:
Hounestly I've only played this game for a few hours but the hours that I have played, oh boy. I think this will turn out to be one of my favourite survival games simply because of the fact that the mechanics of the game are so simple and nice to use. pressing spacebar to show what you can interact with is such a lovely system as you don't waste your time on what you might be able to use, it shows you what you can use and how to use it. I think this game has a lot of potential and for how cheap it is its a must have for anyone like me who can never get their fix of survival games. There is still yet a lot to explore after a few hours of playing.
*******IMPORTANT*******
The only downside to this game is the multiplayer needs work on it. When playing multiplayer everything is depedant on the person hosting and you can't even activate acheievements as a secondry player. As well as this there is a cap of 2 players meaning 3+ is a no go. Finally both players have a certain distance they can have away from eachother meaning that you must explore similar areas together and can't venture out too far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067828426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4457, 'last_played': 1681645935}
review:
For less then $9 this game is a great deal.

Updated review as of 7/7/2017
 
I've tripled my hours since my review and felt it only fair to add some information.

[b]Pro's	[/b]
-Graphics while not state of the art are more then acceptable, surely much more pleasant than the damn voxel torture other more expensive games have.
-Surprising amount of content and anyone can see definate replay value. 
-Multiplayer with friends is a great and unexpected feature for such an inexpensive game!
-Dev's are very responsive to posts
-I'm never a big fan of game music but I admit this was a good effort.
-Nice assortment of creatures, flora, fauna and bio's.
-Leveling system isn't mind boggling but I personally enjoyed that it's item collect of things as you work towards what you need for building your place up. Nice change from kill = level, rinse and repeat.
-Dev is HIGHLY responsive to people with issues, was answered in under 24 hours, dev spent real time on my bug issues with real fixes and 1 work around as only I experienced the issue.
-New content added and planned.
-A good challenge.

Con's.

-SOLVED in a week by Dev personally. Found 5 consistant bugs myself but I AM hopeful (not an optimist in general) that progress will be made to sort out at least some if not all given time. 
-Don't love the controls, I live for right click>menu, left click sellect. With that said I am highly uncoordinated for a gamer and I think some reviews are blowing this out of porportion. 

Yup short con list. A damn good deal for under $9.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996792466', 'num_games_owned': 565, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1714, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 945, 'last_played': 1499541217}
review:
[h1][b]TL:DR[/b][/h1] A really fun and enjoyable game which is challenging and rewarding. If you enjoy progression and don't mind farming/grinding then this game is probably for you. A few minor multiplayer bugs but to be expected and not game breaking.

[h1] Review [/h1]
Third person surivival indie game. You start on a beach and have to progress your way up. Has an old school nostaligic feel to it in the way it handles leveling and general playing. There is a wide range of construction and decorations to build a village. 

The tutorial to the game are the quests. They introduce all the new items, buildings and creatures to the game whether indirectly or directly. These unlockables are behind level teir requirements that occur by completely the quests and spending resources gathered. 

It is a grindy game, similar to what other reviewers say. However I do not mind it as of such as the reward of gathering resources and making something that took time is in my opinion fun. It is not a game that gives you every recipe at the start and you are able to build everything in an hour. I am currently on my first playthrough with a friend and we are approximately 10 hours in and I think we've unlocked 2/3rds of the buildings. 

Multiplayer was added recently and what encouraged me to pick it up for myself and a friend. There is a few teething bugs with it but it not's unplayable (just don't hit windows key!!). The game loads/runs quick.

Update: Emailed the developer regarding with some bugs and recommendations and was replied to within a few days and was interested in hearing my suggestions. It seems the devs behind this are interested in our feedback and suggestions for change.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020532373', 'num_games_owned': 115, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1528196404}
review:
I really like it so far, definitely early access but worth the money. A lot to be worked on but months ago (been following this for half a year or more) it looked awful, the recent update persuaded me to buy it on sale.
Only cons: 
Some weapons/items force you to stand completely still while swinging.
Not too fond of the leveling system, making you gain items and then you consume them upon leveling up, feel like it should be more experience-wise leveling. Maybe keep the items required to level up, but not consume them, sort of like a requirement to mine/obtain to level.

Only put little over an hour into it and I haven't even experienced combat yet (too terrified to break the bush between me and 8+ goblins eyeing me over the bushes that cannot be crossed).
I like the building mechanics too, straightforward, simple. The limit of buildings that can be made is fair, not sure if they have it but maybe the higher the level you are, it increases the amount of buildings you can make?
I also had no idea how to find sticks besides the ones you find on the ground, then I discovered there are "stick bushes" that give you a lot of sticks upon breaking them, very nice to find that out :D

Suggestions: Make crafting have a queue, so in a bonfire, queue like 21 embers that takes a few minutes as the first item crafted to be worked on, then instantly add like, cooked meat, behind it so it'll craft that once the embers are done. That'd be more convenient.
The screen/top down is tolerable, I don't mind it, reminds me of the old classic "Dungeon Siege" from many years ago. 

For the tl/dr: I am overall impressed with the game, it looked terrible half a year ago but now it looks much better so I bought it. A lot of work to be done still but it's definitely playable and time consuming. My biggest pet peeve would be the leveling system!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032105337', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1497710339}
review:
This is a game with potential, but at this current point there are just to many annoyances to warrant a thumbs up. 

The camera is extremely tedious, and when you are in the menu you have to click to pick up items, and hold space to turn the camera. When not in a menu the camera turns normaly but you have to click ctrl to pick up items. In addition the camera is stuck at a really annoying angle, but that is something you can change with a hidden button in the settings menu. 

The crafting system is so tedious and instead of placing items in your inventory when it's done crafting you have to lug your way back to the crafting menu to pick up the item. 
If you are crafting in your inventory it should go to your inventory automatically when finished so you dont have to go back over and over again. 

This game is not even marked early access, when it so clearly needs a better crafting/inventory menu and a less tedious camera system. Things I consider so basic I would complain about it on an early access title as well. 

These are all things that can be fixed. And if they do, it might warrant me having another go at the game. But as it stands, it's a hard resounding no.


Bonus points if you also let us make our own character in the game. Or atleast let us choose skin color and sex so not everyone is generic white dude number 1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035254118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1494776781}
review:
Force of Nature has a good concept. A survival game with complex in depth mechanics that allow you to gain meaningful progression. Like Don't Starve, throwing you into an unknown wilderness and telling you to figure it out yourself. I love these types of games, but they're few and far between. But as of right now, this game is executed extremely poorly.

Camera and movement is tedious and restricted. EVERYTHING is an obstacle. Sunflowers and bushes block everything, and you have to slowly dig through it all. Terrain generation is wonky, and that stops movement even further. Also the camera is locked in the top down view, and it's disorientating and annoying that I can't change it.

Menus and inventory is a hassle. Every menu has to be opened by its own button, and they'll constantly open and close other windows you may want to keep up/down. They'res no way to easily navigate anything.

Progression is not enjoyable or satisfactory due to the worst forced tutorial I've seen. It forces you to grind for materials in order to advance the game. Only to be greeted by more fetchquests and grinding. And if it doesn't teach you, then you'll have a hard time figuring something out. Hell I didn't even know you could break bushes until 30 minutes in.

So yes, a game so dissapointing to me I wrote an extremely long rant about it.
tl:dr, Idea is great, game isn't.

My advice for the devs? Take more from similar games, like Don't Starve and Haven and Hearth. They have fluid movement, easy to use menus, and the combat/progression is difficult, but satisfying.

review:
Force of Nature √© um jogo legal, tem √≥timos gr√°ficos (coisa que eu n√£o me importo muito), uma paisagem bonita e tudo mais por√©m √© lento, o termo sobreviv√™ncia desaparece quando o seu personagem n√£o tem fome, nem sede.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055796374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 41324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24739, 'last_played': 1609121016}
review:
Great game and I have played it for many hours.  It was worth the money.  

Starting out, I did not like a few elements of it  as I did not get it.  For example, running in and pulling a whole bunch of mobs then dying and resuming.  Do this a few times and you get the 'Bad Player' achievement; haha.  During this stage, the game was okay, but my fault of playing it wrong.

Then I recognised the game as survival an the point is to make it to the end without dying.  Hardcore mode is just that, make it to end without dying.  This means you have to play carefully, plan and learn.  This adds a whole new challenge to the game when you play and know it is about survival.  In hardcore, you die and the game is over and everything lost;  no saved games to recover to.  Knowing this, makes the game a challenge.

There are restrictions to the number of constructions, but this is a good thing as it keeps the game challenging.  Without these restrictions it would be far too easy.  At times the game is a bit grindy and you have to wait for crafting.  A small reduction will make it more enjoyable.

I have completed hardcore a few times, each time sligly different due the the random map.  So there is a level of replayability.  Part of the fun is to figure out the mechanics/rules of the game and use them to your advantage.

There are a few bugs.  The good thing is the developers do listen to the community and have made changes based on recommendations.  Their response time on bugs is quick.  As the developers continue to improve the game, hopefully more recipes. weapons will emerge.

If you don't like a bit of a grind and miss the point of 'SURVIVAL' i.e. not dying; then the game may not be for you.   It is not a passive game, you need to go out and kill some mobs.  

Good.  Ambient sound and music great.  Graphics are good,  Game plays smoothly.  Challenge is moderate.  Replayability is fair.

Character customisation does not exist.  Camera angle needs improvement.  A little grindy at the end of the game, can be toned down a bit.  Some achievements are too easy and others ridiculous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035689240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1496589384}
review:
Like some reviews I've seen I've been disapointed with this game. The graphics are fine, the ambiance is very cool and I was looking for a "survival-building" game. But then the game wouldn't let me explore or survive. It got me into doing chores until I was completely bored with it.

There are still issues with the hit boxes (those damned bushes) and the control could be a little more responsive. But what killed the game for me was the levels and the quests and the quests and the other quests...

For me, it could benefit from a "hunger" system, but not everybody agrees with that and that's fine. Still. Please make the "tutorial" a tutorial. Very simple. Short. And let us discover what we want to do next. And then I'd defenitely recommend this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198013794329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1832, 'last_played': 1673991955}
review:
Wohl das rundeste Survival Game Out There!!! 
Es kommt keine Lnageweile auf.
Das Spiel Prinzip:
1. Baue eine Basis
2. Betreibe eine vielzahl von Craftgeb√§uden (z.B. Lagerfeuer, Herd, Ofen, usw.)
3. Versorge dich mit Nahrung durch anlegen von acckerland oder Z√§hme Tiere f√ºr Tierprodukte oder Kominiere alles am Herd f√ºr eine Gute Mahlzeit :)
4. Wenn du genug vorr√§te hast gehe auf die suche nach Erz, Kupfer oder Nutztieren. Oder Gehe auf die jagt nach den seltenen Force of Nature St√ºcken!!!

Man kann Lvl, man hat verschiedene Spiel Modies, usw.
Ich habe mich gut informiert √ºber das Spiel vor dem Kauf von Let¬¥s Plays bis Commentare und Co. und viel √ºber den umfang erfahren... auf den erste Blick sehr umfangreich aber nach dem Kauf und selbst test habe ich entdeckt wie umfangreich es ist. Trotz das es so umfangreich ist erschl√§gt es einen nicht da man immer wieder in anderen dingen in dem spiel besch√§ftigt wird es fast nie langweilig und bin super Gl√ºcklich mit dem Kauf!!!

Also ich bin glaube ich seit ca. 15 Jahren Steam Kunde und muss echt sagen das ist eines der wie gesagt Rundesten Games auf Steam!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198068997719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1577998600}
review:
TL:DR   I dont spend time writting reviews because id rather play a game then listen to what someone else has to say about it. but I'm incredibly pleased with the fixes that have happened within the past few months

 So I had to pause mid game to write this review. I got this game around release date, and to be honest I lasted only about 10 minutes before quting because the interface was horrible. I decided to give it another chance because of time and games always update to fix things. I am now really enjoying this game! It definetly took a minute for me to get my barring and remember the controls. Everything is a lot better now.

pros:
easy survival, you just have to read
no impossible resources per your level ups
linear level up system
monsters to bash around
bunnies that tempt you with mouth watering fresh meat that you cant catch

cons:
fixed camera angle
cant sleep ( onl about an hour into the game so maybe later)
no structres until a higher level

but this is only within the first hour or so of playing im sure that there will be more pros then cons as i continue playing

author: {'steamid': '76561197961367991', 'num_games_owned': 458, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1495682639}
review:
Pros
-Graphics are decent
-Music (heard it the first time I played and I enjoyed it,  but never heard it again lol)
-Crafting - very easy to understand
-Bunch of things to do and discover
-Having to cut through objects to move passed them (a cool thing, and a frustrating thing)
-I like that you can continue to use items with zero durability loss
-Building mechanics
-Relaxing game

Cons
-Music stopped working after first play
-You can't walk down a hill or a sharp edge, you have to literally run around to try to find even ground
-Animals/Monsters can run from you with ease
-STAMINAAAA.  Man, you don't recover stamina at all.  Yes, I've carried around coffee and constantly eat sunflower seeds, but damn, the loss of stamina is crazy.
-Some items can't be built in a house while other items can, and these items are pretty similar
-Not Multiplayer.

TL;DR - Would I recommend, yes.  The game right out the box is playable and has lots of stuff to do.  It will keep you entertain while you wait for your friends to get online to play PUB or something. lol

Edit - A lot of negative reviews talk about the bad camera angle.  You can go in the options --> general and change the camera view to "free" mode and that helps a lot.  Also, it takes a little bit to get used to the controls, but you'll get them.

review: It has some strict rules and this is definely not a game you can speed up from the start, you are set on a long journey to complete tasks. It is amazing though and this comes from a person who regularly plays Dark Souls, Skyrim, Dead Space, and alike. It gives me the feel of a SIMS game. The cost for what you get here is 100% on and I do not feel it is unreasonable. Make sure you stock up on coconuts and bananas and your main priority is to get to the cooking station and stock up so once you get here stay here awhile and have fun building your farm. Make solid plans before you venture too far out into the wilderness!

review: Very unpleasant feel to the game. Awkward camera angle, ugly animation, no ability to play a custom character, lots of work needed here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000958324', 'num_games_owned': 923, 'num_reviews': 208, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1494959619}
review:
I kinda like the game. And i would keep it if not for the insanely slow movement speed. It takes me minutes to walk between my buildings. or even to get to a tree i can chop. And for some reason i can't even speedhack it. 

Adding a 'drive me crazy' slow movement speed, that gets even slower with an essential thing like armor. And then adding it to game that is all about grinding and exploring. Is the worst idea a developer can ever have. So i will refund the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000749595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3850, 'last_played': 1560186041}
review:
Good game, but some suggestions for improvements. These are all things the game doesn't currently have that would complete it. Hell, I'll even take on the development myself if it means these get done:

More use of buildings and defences, such as adding:
- Wooden Palisade Gate (the current two gates don't work with the only wall type available: a palisade).
- Wooden Turret. This would be craftable with a bow as an ingredient, and would allow you to walk inside and shoot over your base's external defence wall.

More use of stone in the game other than for just stone borders. I have about 500 stone just sitting in barrels because there's nothing else to do with it. Perhaps: 
- Stone Wall, stronger than Palisade.
- Fortified Stone Wall, stronger than Stone Wall
- Stone Gate, stronger than Wooden Palisade Gate.
- Fortified Stone Gate, stronger than Stone Gate
- Stone Turret, stronger than Wooden Turret. Allows use of bow built-into turret.

A HUGE improvement: If a large structure is empty, ALLOW THE PLAYER TO MOVE IT like you can with everything else once empty! This is a HUUUUUUGGGGGEEEEEE problem if you build your town thinking you can move the structures (because you can move everything else after it's placed so this makes sense), only to discover you can't move a building once built. If you want it three squares to the right, for example, you have to dismantle it completely and waste resources or move your entire base around to suit it. Please just make it moveable. It would be SO easy to fix and the result would be so much better for the player. 


A highly immersive game that just needs the polishing touches. Recommend you give it at least 10 hours gameplay before making your mind up - I've logged around 40hrs and it's highly enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065221264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1064, 'last_played': 1494275797}
review: Hab das Spiel mittlerweile mehr als 15 Stunden lang "angetestet" und die entstanden innerhalb von 2 Tagen xD Absolutes Suchtpotential und wenn der geplante Multiplayer Modus das h√§lt was ich mir so vorstelle wird das Spiel nur noch besser! Von mir gibts eine Empfehlung

author: {'steamid': '76561198346738958', 'num_games_owned': 377, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1587091663}
review:
With only one hour of game, the survival struggle of this survival game was over, I was already settled.
Thirty minutes later I was already beginning that longest process of looking for higher ranked resources to get the next best craftable gear, right after I just crafted what was the best gear I could craft so far with the resources I could find so far. Find resource, then craft gear, then get blueprint of better equipment, then unlock next level of the same process: this is a process to which a lot of games insist reducing themselves. Besides this, I had two options: minecrafting all sorts of things just for the sake of minecrafting all sorts of things; or hunting monsters and looking for dungs. But: I got sick of the long time-consuming grinding and waiting for work stations to produce things; and those scattered mobs of different monsters wandering around an island waitting to be killed are just poor RPG.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018186853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3764, 'last_played': 1586547665}
review:
The game system is great and the game in general looks very good, but I find a great defect in the game and is that every time you die or leave the game to reappear or enter the game again all creatures appear Again making it difficult to progress again spending many that if you do not die again I hope you modify this defect and make me rethink me to continue playing the game.

I have to say that after spending a good time playing I am forced to remove the defect exposed in the previous analysis since if they did not reappear again the creatures would be impossible to progress in the game this makes me hate as much as I love this game in summary I am Enchanted with this game but it would not be bad if they put a patch in Spanish jejeje this game for its price is worth buying it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021916327', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1494412406}
review:
Sad to say I'm disappointed with this game. And my expectations weren't very high to begin with.
The progress is locked behind quests and levels (that require the quests to be completed anyway, seems like a pointless complexity)
The game feels like an extended tutorial, and kills any desire to explore beyond what the quest tells you to (since if you find something interesting it's just going to clog your inventory until the game deigns to let you make something out of it)

Because of the progress being locked behind quests, it's even more important to make that progress feel meaningful. Sadly, it's not the case here. For example, the game introduces you to a new crafting station (anvil) but only lets you create a couple items (nails), which you can only use for a different crafting station (crafting table). The next quest then jumps to taming animals (which is similarly a frustating experience as there's no proper feedback on why you failed)

I'm a glutton for material grinds in games, but this game manages to make even that feel like a cynical chore, with the stamina limits being a cherry on top.
The stamina ends up feeling like you're playing a bizarre mobile game with timers you could pay to bypass. Not the best feeling.

This game looks like a sandbox game, but plays like a crappy mmorpg where you're being led around by quests with no agency or motivation of your own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198353049718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1491990210}
review: I like this game not only because of the graphics but because of the adventure, the survival and the various objects thst you can get. There was only one small problem there was to much crafting and it took to long to get anything. It was like if you have something and you need ten more and then when you get it you need like 5 more to get another thing and it keeps going on. But over all i think this is great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062550256', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 2669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2330, 'last_played': 1534660922}
review:
Have to admit the game is deceiving when you look at it although I just cant stop playing it and yes only received it.

Definitely a number of genres considered in each part of the game from crafting mining farming trapping and killing all comes down to managing your time to get the most out of everything gathered.

Thank god it isnt a top down view only like so many other games of similar characteristics
Fluid graphics easy gameplay no hunger or dying of thirst related parts to worry about, just steady plod along at your own pace do how you like but heres the list to  level up just so you know kind of game.

Level your self when your upto it no xp grind just nice and relaxing and when you leel up you actually feel accomplished
Love it nicely priced cant wait for MP to jump in and see how well that pans out

Yes my hours are low having just bought the game but its impressed me from the word go.

review: muy buena jugabilidad, aunque la camara es un poco ¬øestatica e incomoda pero eso no te limita a la hora de jugar, bastante completo y con una linea de aprendizaje muy estable aparte de que el desarrollador le pone atencion a la comunidad y mejora constantemente el juego, lo recomiendo mucho a los que les guste el genero

author: {'steamid': '76561198018379489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2783, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1355, 'last_played': 1550245320}
review:
I'm realy enjoying this relaxing game. No worrying about starving to death or dying of thirst every 5 mins like most survival games. Great price at ¬£5.99 to.

Had no problems with the game at all and realy looking forward to the multi player for it that they are working on. I hope there will be a co-op mode for friends to build up there camps together as that would suit this type of game much more than random people smashing and stealing all your stuff.

Most of the negative stuff i have seen on the game like bad camera angle and such have been fixed (Camera angle is now free movment) The combat is a bit basic but i not playing it for the combat there are plenty of other games out there for that type of game play.

Very happy customer ty very much for the game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197970608841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1493713938}
review: Should have read the negative reviews before buying. Amateur hour all the way, pointlessly grindy with dead-boring repetive combat situations. Animations take FOREVER to complete so unless you plan on becoming immortal, your life is literally too short to play this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000300779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1494381350}
review:
After roughly 11 hours playing the game I have to give it a Yes.

It's actually pretty fun and calming. The ambient music is very soothing as well. There are a few things which might put people off like the camera but for those of us who grew up playing isometric games it's nothing big. Definitely a good game to relax with and build/craft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041114748', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2698, 'last_played': 1681379565}
review: The game is good for beginners who is new to an open world survival crafting game. It gives players a basic understanding on how a survival crafting game is about. The quest is understandable and easy to follow as it takes you to one level at a time to progress throughout the game. One of the great features is to have monsters to fight with you when hunting or gathering. The resources are limted though for it cannot grow or respawn anything what uhave gathered or cut down. So use your resources wisely. A good deal for $8 for the features that it has.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016196050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 3247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1632669706}
review:
This game was a disappointment primarily due to the save and exit not working properly which I unfortunately didn't discover until after refunding the game. 

When you save and exit the gave and then load your save you don't load wherever you were when you saved and exited but instead end up back in the starting location.

This combined with the fixed camera angle (in one mode you can rotate the camera but you can't look into the distance), a map that you can't mark your finds on, and having to fight your way through the same waves of enemies to try to find that resource you were at when you saved your game is just plain frustrating.

Most of those full of hackers guess mmo..Of curse its not my number 1 of all survivals but its low prize and its kinda selution for all those people who want to play a great survival without geting sad of hackers. 100% would buy again.3 Languages aviable now.English Russia German.Devs still work on it.So both thumps up  for this good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087755670', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2638, 'last_played': 1680304517}
review:
So I like to call this game "Oh s%#t I'm out of something."

Whether I would recommend this game is more about what kind of experience you are looking for.  Games like Terraria and Starbound allow you to use everything you find, quickly, and flex some creative muscle in building yourself grand structures.  They also have a fantastical element and a wide crafting tree.

Force of Nature has less of that.  Crafting things requires care and time.  To forge a single ingot of metal you need the ore, and coal.  Coal requires you to put wood and burning embers into the coal smoker.  Burning embers come from a bonfire and sticks.  And these things take time.  It's a more immersive experience, especially with the 3D third person perspective.  But it can cause things to drag slightly.

The game mechanics and graphics are good.  Music and sound effects can be decent.  Like most sandbox games it can take a bit to figure some things out.  To get rid of items permanently in this game you have to build a trashcan, which is listed under "decorations" and not "constructions".  Combat so far(44 hours in) has been relatively simple.

There's a few quirky things that make me laugh about this game too.  Lilke the fact you're able to craft a magical portal before you can craft yourself pants.  It's nothing that detracts from the game overall, but just silly.  There's also no castle building like terraria or Starbound.  You build small structures in one piece.  

If you like a more realisitc exploration, sandbox, adventure game, this can be for you.  If you're looking for another game closer to the fantasy and ease of Terraria, maybe look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084425536', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1493009237}
review: This game has that Minecraft, Rune Factory, and Harvest Moon Nostalgia. This game can only appeal to certain types of people and i love this kind of game so i can say i enjoy it. The only thing that i can say i don't like about it is the way the camera is. But have fun guys!

author: {'steamid': '76561197968649409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2082, 'last_played': 1492827764}
review:
This game has all the right things at its core even if the surrounding things are left a bit to be desired.

The core gameplay is exactly the kind of crack you get from crafting. The same thrill you get from Runescape, the slow progress of getting to do better and better things. Seeing yourself become more and more efficient, making you want the stuff you create. The progression is great, it's what makes this game so addictive.

It's slow paced, single person, and you get your own satisfaction of doing your own thing. A small bonus, weirdly, is that there isn't any internet guides, so you'll have the fun of discovering things pretty much on your own. The game is easy enough to understand, but there are somethings that are frustrating which make the game that much more fun. 

The 3Cs are lacking (character, camera, controls), but with the core so well made that can soon be ignored. You develop the feel for it.

It's not a AAA game, but the concept is perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016648829', 'num_games_owned': 19, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10433, 'last_played': 1500773244}
review:
By far the best sandbox game I ever played.  The camera angle takes a bit of getting used to but it's all fun after that. 
 I likethe progression of levels.  Every piece of equipment, clothing, food recipes, weapons, buildings etc. get better as you level but you must supply the resources.  You need to save everything, yes, even the poisonous mushrooms.  If you can‚Äôt build storage containers (barrels and chests) fast enough to accommodate your resources, you can pile them in neat stacks anywhere on the ground and no one will disturb them. The scenery is fantastic, the terrain is great.  Here are some highlights:

1.) All animals are wild, you catch them with net traps, tame them and tell them to follow you.  Make sure you have fenced in areas to lead and keep the animals securely inside.  Cows will give milk, chickens, eggs, etc. etc. But you need to feed them.

2.) You need to gather plants, seeds and fruit but after that you can grow most of them in planting beds at home.

3.) Mining for ore, building a smelter and an anvil is all part of the game.

3.) Hunting for meat, pelts and other animal resources is fun as well.

4.) You can make your own trails through the thick brush by cutting trees and bushes and saving the logs and sticks.

5.) You can build Portals to teleport from one place to another anywhere on the map and it is huge.

I could go on and on.  Just watch out for the goblins, they will attack anything but they do drop gold coins, the only resource you have for making gold ingots, which you will need later in the game.  These ugly little creatures are everywhere and they are a pain, until you reach the level where you can actually trap one and he becomes your sidekick.  He will be the funniest thing in the game as you both go on adventures. Only thing is that he dies if he‚Äôs killed, unlike you, who resurrects at home, minus some inventory items, sometimes,  valuable stuff.  So, you make more chain traps and catch another one!!!!

My hats off to the developers, now for the extension package and multiplayer ability.

Akeel

author: {'steamid': '76561198006845803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1490557689}
review:
To start off, Unless you like to be railroaded down your quest line with literally Zero Freedom this is not the game for you. 
Also as most others have said, the camera angles are fixed in an almost top down but not, can't zoom, while your character is stuck bottom center. The combat is dull at best, if you have a good enough weapon and more hp than the enemies then you win if not you run or die, almost no skill involved, which i could say about the whole game.

review:
This game is Brilliant so i start with the good things first:

One of my Favorites is the build and replace system thats missing in a lot of survival games, also the fights there are sometimes hard to win and but simply, you got a lot of weapons and they are not easy to get so it makes it a game with more hours to spend. the traping feels wierd but if you catch something its satisfying after all your hard Net throwing.

thats the good part now the bad things:

after some hours spend in the game the are things that i personaly miss, so theres no multiplayer i hope it is in sight for the next months. the next thing is many other games get a Mac support cause its obvious that are some players on mac aswell this combind with a multiplayer and you got a lot more options to do in the game
