author: {'steamid': '76561198072152701', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483096434}
review:
I would try to like this game. But there are multiple things that bug me after already 15min.
First is this weird angle. Why can't you change it so that you can look into the distance?
Second the mouse speed. I usually have it quite high, so it bugs me that I have to "fight" with the low mouse-speed of the game. 3rd..... Why is the right mouse button never used? You could use it perfectly for changing the camera angle, even more so when you have some interface open. That way you don't have to close everything just to look around.

If those things are cleared up, I'm willing to give a thumbs up, but for now..... I'm inbetween.

EDIT: After reading through some more ideas, I think that the angle might be for low specs, but well.... at least make an option for higher-end systems so that they aren't restricted.

review:
Juegazo donde los halla, vi un video del juego por internet y me decidi a probarlo, ya que me recordaba mucho a otros juegos de anta√±o. Un total acierto el haberlo probado y jugado. Es un todo en uno bastante agradable de jugar, a veces se hace pesado ( el farmeo ) pero es muy llevadero el juego ya que a medida que vas avanzando se desbloquean cosas nuevas y te hace seguir adelante. A simple vista no he visto ningun tipo de bug o fallo en el juego. Evidentemente tiene muchas cosas que mejorar a dia de hoy pero no dejan al juego de lado y le a√±aden parches corrigiendo cosas o a√±adiendo cosas      ( como el arbol de navidad ). De graficos parece un poco asi asao pero la verdad esque estan super bien los graficos, detallados y super fluidos a la hora de renderizar no te cuesta nada.
Ya os anticipo de que si os gustan los juegos que mezclen crafteos, supervivencia, misiones y un monton de cosas mas este es vuestro juego. Lo unico que lamento ha sido no haberlo encontrado antes para empezar a jugarlo mucho antes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009792779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1686744225}
review:
I went into this game after watching 15 minutes of a gameplay by the Youtuber xBCrafted (I recommend checking him out) And I really enjoy this game so far. Plenty of more stuff for me to do, and I can't wait to fully explore them.

There is a bit of a grind in order to get to certain points in the game, which is good in my opinion.
And like plenty of others have already pointed out, don't be scared of the camera angle, you'll get used to it before you know! 

I highly recommend people to try this game, as its a very relaxing game.

The only "issue" I have is the water grind.. Makes you babysit a bit too much as wells stops making more water after 4, untill you take those out. A little nitpicking, but it's just since you need water for ALOT of things. Dont get discouraged though. Im certain you'll still like the other aspects of the game.. Even the "clunky" combat system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014704153', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 2330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2330, 'last_played': 1483020456}
review:
The game was fun at first, but not as good as I thought it would be.

The game is very limiting, in the fact that you can only craft certain objects at each level and you can only lvl by completing the set quests and crafting what is listed. So this game is wrongly classed as a sandbox game as there are limitations to what you can do. Such as you can't craft any clothes until lvl 7 or iron axes until lvl 8.

At lvl 6 I was only allowed 1 cooking table, so I could not make bread, coffee and cheese at the same time. And crafting is not queued, so you can only craft 1 thing at a time so it takes ages, especially since I did not want to leave my base without having  a decent amount of food.
And the food you find is not good enough as it hardly restores any health or stamina.

Iam currently, not allowed to make a better weapon than a cudgel or a crude bow, both are rather weak and hate that you can only attack 1 enemy at a time so if you get more than 1 goblin and a bear joining in the fight, you end up dead as I can't craft armour at lvl 6.

I hate how very restrictive the game is, so it makes this game less fun for me.
Everything takes forever to craft. It becomes very tedious and grindy, needing  15 amethyst chips just to progress, it gets boring by the time you get to lvl 7 as you need way too many items and
you have to spend ages making food and drink just to survive going anywhere.

When trying to hunt animals for pelts, boars and foxes will run away when their health gets low and they are way too fast espcially when you have -3 movement speed from wearing bronze armour. Only bears stay and fight, makes it annoying when you need 50+ pelts for crafting fur armour.

Other bad things is combat is terrible and so is the camera angle, it's a weird angle so you can't see into the distance.
Also for some strange reason animals need 2 traps before they can be tamed, the first trap thrown always fails.
I gave this game a chance, playing it even when feeling bored.


I got up to lvl 8, had to get my third force of nature in the cold area, the area surrounded thick in mobs each lvl 10, tried to pull 1, 5 mobs came after me, died, came back and am faced with the same problem this game is just frustrating and annoying, I can't recommend it anymore.

This game has a good concept, but is let down by poor execution, there is a lot that needs to be improved. It feels unbalanced and not as polished as it could be. I may change this game to recommend if the gameplay is updated and improved. Things such as when digging soil, you get 1 piece of soil at a time, which is slow when you need like 30 soil for a seedbed. Or having 30 animals and having to feed each of them 1 at a time. Which is crazy considering a real productive farm would have large feed troughs so that all animals can be fed quickly.

This game was played and the review was written before any major updates, creative mode or creature taming was added. Comments disabled because of nasty non constructive troll comments.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059232567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483060293}

review: I've very much enjoyed this game 8 hours of gameplay so far. Its slow collecting but it makes it rewarding.  Sounds are relaxing. Lots to explore. It has quests and lots of options. the camera few and movement have been an ajustment but I feel its worth it from what i've seen so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127788130', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482973189}
review:
Find leaf. Click make this. now click to make this. now click to make this.... ok, so where is the adventure part? I was expecting a more detailed minecraft. Not so much. You don't really build anything. You open a menu screen select build and it gets generated for you. 

IDK, maybe it will get better with updates. Controls leave much to be desired. The walls of text menus block free camera movement, but if you close them you have no idea what to do. Also anything that needs to be broken down to be collected can't be touched without the menu screen up so you have to jump back and forth.

I supose it has a survival element somewhere.. I got maybe ten minutes in and was too bored to continue. There are free phone apps with the same feel and better controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997925483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1482971197}
review: 10 minutes in and I requested a refund.  Game needs some serious interface/mechanics tweeks.  Just like many of the other negative reviews state, there is a fixed camera angle that makes you feel like you are on a swivel and you are not allowed to see more than 10 feet in front of you.  Free motion camera is needed!  Also - the fact that you have to have your inventory window open to pick up items in the world is simply stupid.  Also - your character movement changes when you have said inventory window open so instead of moving left to right, you change to side stepping.  So forget about just leaving the window open all the time.  See a stick?  Walk up to it.  Open inventory window, click the new "Stick" box that appears.  Close inventory window, continue rest of your day.  Also, crafting...  When you are done crafting you have to click "Get Object" or whatever it was to put the item in your inventory.  What else would I do with it???  Apparently developer has never played any games like this in the past.  A major step backwards in design.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175990243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1483214074}
review:
The game is OK, there are bugs which can be annoying.
Combat sucks. Combat sucks, yeah I typed it twice it is that bad.
The game is quest driven, to level up you need to complete set quests, which entails lots of farming for pelts, and other mats.
There is very little to build in the game, and it all has level requirements, see above.
Designed this way because there is very little to do in the game. You will end up growing food to go and fight some mobs, rinse and repeat. Get enough mats to finish that levels quests, level up, and start all over again doing the same thing every level.
You cannot design and construct your own buildings which would be a great improvement, hopefully the game will get better with new patches. 
Old equipment gets thrown on the floor, there is no way to destroy or recycle old stuff. Too many logs, not a problem, just leave them on the floor, they do not dissapear, however, the bloody fur set of clothes I made magically dissapeared from the chest they were stored in.
Right, some parts of the game are poorly designed and suck, I wish there was a sandbox mode even with the limited gameplay that would give you. At the current price I would buy the game again, just beacuse it is cheap and I hope the game will improve in the future.

review: This is a great little game. It's a bit grindy in places but for whatever reason it hooks you and you want to keep playing it to find out what's next. Updates have been almost daily at times which is nice, the game is super stable minus the occasional slowdown/stutter when it auto-saves. The camera angle option doesn't seem to do anything for me, and I'd like a bit lower angle camera so I could see further in the distance. Other than a few minor nitpicks and the animal pelt grind being a bit rough (animals run away too much) it's a really fantastic game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053222443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1435, 'last_played': 1483525215}
review:
Don't buy it - Don't buy it  - Don't buy it  - Don't buy it  - Don't buy it  - Don't buy it  - Don't buy it 


Dear prospective buyer, 
Force of nature is worth your time ( quite literally ) if you have a lot of time on your hands to play a slow-paced crafting game. In my opinion the game is more suited for children than adults as all the graphics are simple a processes are slow.

- Gameplay-
The game offers pre-made buildings which can be placed and requires you to harvest and obtain resources, just like any other crafting game. This is however slower than in most games and you need to harvest a lot of materials before you are able to craft anything big. In addition, there is a limit to how many building or items you can place. So, placing 15 smelters to create industrial scale production of iron is right out. 

- Combat - 
The combat is what you would expect of the first diablo. In addition there is no real threat in the game apart from goblins and wolves. both do not threaten your base and you have to actively seek them out to get into a fight. Which makes this game quite peaceful. 

- leveling system - 
You need to obtain resources before you can level. that means that whether you've killed 20.000 goblins or only 1, you might still be level 1. This can be seen as a challenge or a millstone aroun ones neck. 

----------------------------- After 10 hours of gameplay --------------------------------------------------------- :s

- opinion - 
Personally , I am enjoying this game as a casual game. It's very peaceful and will run on machines with low specs. Like my broken down laptop of a bazillion years old. Exellent game for casual use, but not very immersive. If you want hardcore combat and crafting, don't buy this game. If you want a peaceful / slow crafting game, buy this game. 

------------------- After more than 20 hours of playing ---------------------------------------------- :(

This game is horrific. Let me list some major cons: 

1 * You need insane amounts of materials before constructing stuff.
 ( example: you need to kill 25 bears before you are able to make a pair of gloves ) 
 ( You need gloves, boots, jacket, hat and pants to enter a cold area, this requires you to kill 125      bears )

2 * You need stuff instead of XP to level up. 

3 * The game is extremely linear, you need to create all items of that level before you can continue.

4. UBER-grind , really to the point you are actually starting to ask yourself existential questions.

5. Terrain messed- up -> you use your stamina to chop a way through a marsh only to find out that you cannot walk up a mediocre hill. 

6. No stamina - no fighting. Oh shit ! you are out of coffee, now you will just stand there as the bear claws you to death and you gain the " bad player " achievement. 

7. Crappy translations - This is an English teacher thing, but " Furs pants " and double letters do begin to annoy. 

8. You can't do things in bulk. You may only have so many productive buildings per level. 

9. No skills. You aren't getting better. You just get better stuff. ( by grinding )

10. Random item loss at death. You die ? Too bad, you lose you 2 hours worth of ropes !


!!!! TL;DR !!!!!!
SLow paced crafting game, ok but not aggresive, requires a lot of time. Interface sucks, lots of bugs, total grind.

Don't buy it - Don't buy it  - Don't buy it  - Don't buy it  - Don't buy it  - Don't buy it  

Love,

Lord Warmold

author: {'steamid': '76561198003077424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1486451772}

author: {'steamid': '76561197987733274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 2129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1483220636}
review:
Hidden gem of crafting/sandbox genre, very simple controls, not too complex crafting systems that tie early tier resources to later game. Combat is nothing amazing but some basic spacing and timing elements are in there, the focus and main fun of combat is to get yourself geared up in order to further progres into tougher/richer areas. 

Lastly, the sandbox experience has a thread put through via the "quest system" or rather, a general direction one should take in order to advance in level, but more importantly, to get access to higher tier crafting that'll make previous challenges to now be possible to overcome. Very good bargain for 8 EUR.

review:
Played it for 2 hours and reached lvl 6 in that time. I really love the game! (i simply want to play more, more and more). The crafting, growing crops and herbs and slowly progressing as character is really good. The quests do really help and the hints in the game constantly helped me aswell. Only negative experience is the controls sometimes.. but after 2 hours i got used to the keybindings.

For the price you get a really nice game! I can recommend all who like build, explore, gather and slowly progressing as character.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971136467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 15437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1328, 'last_played': 1590109870}
review:
Bought this on an impulse when I saw it in my recommended list, and I must say, I'm not dissapointed.

Yes, the game is 'grindy', it's kind of point of these sorts of games, to do the dull tasks to get the good stuff, but the game works in such a way as you can set the pace, how quickly you work your way up through the levels, or whether you simply choose to stockpile a load of basic level stuff first is up to you.

Visually, the game is appealing enough, not a massive fan of the non-tiltable camera, since I actually find myself craning my neck to look under the top of the monitor, but you DO get used to it. Audio is fine, though I seemed to get hit by 'surprise music' when I ventured into the desert earlier, which seemed kind of odd after hours of ambience. 

Gameplay is well-paced, you can control your own speed of advancement, and removing resources locally as you grow means your base is more exposed to the nearby creatures, so there's still work to do there, and the portal system means you don't have to constantly walk back and forth across the map.

There are some things I'd like to see, though some in-game stuff may simply not be unlocked yet, I'd like a bit more control over world generation, and maybe a way to automate some processes (though, as I say, the tech may simply not be unlocked yet).

I suppose if I were to describe the 'feel' of the game, I'd say it's a production/hunting/farming game (not really survival) that plays a tiny bit like Diablo or Titan Quest, at least I get that vibe from it. It's not a game for action freaks, but if you want a moderately relaxing game that you can invest a bit of time in and explore at your own pace, you could certainly do worse.

author: {'steamid': '76561197974927402', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1566713143}
review:
This is a game about slowly harvesting resources, creating workstations such as "Crafting Table" etc to make more advanced items and so on. I would compare it to Life is Feudal, Stranded Deep, Don't Starve and Timber & Stone (though you play one guy rather than a colony). All good games, and FoN takes a bit from each.

The camera angle; it feels claustrophobic for the first while, I found myself wantting to lower it to see further. I got used to it though and it doesn't occur to me anymore while playing, you can turn the screen to see further, and if you use the map often, you can avoid mobs or at least pull them one at a time if your careful. Mobs show as a red dot on the map.

I found once I took the time to remap my keys to more comfortable places on my G13 I enjoyed the game much more. Some controls are a bit awkward for a bit.

The graphics are really nice (I play at 4k), I love the "Castaway" idea and setting, and this game gets it right. Nice ambient birds, waves, and wildlife sounds make it relaxing to plod away. I put on some tunes and just enjoy slowly getting my primitive camp better and better set up with animals, farms, and the ton of crafting and busy work to keep it all going.

Combat is kind of slow and mostly about not getting overwhelmed and having food buffs to stay up, the mobs around the early area are quickly little threat. You can build weapons, armor, clothes etc eventually.

Cons include level-gating the advanced crafting. So no bow until lvl 4 for example. However, you level by completing crafting quests, not mob grinding. So you have no choice but to lvl by grinding out whatever crafts are needed, and it quickly gets to be a long slog. I want to craft much more, much earlier personally.

Camera will turn off some people, but i think it's just a matter of getting used to it.

Overall, get it if you like crafting games with survival aspects and a touch of RPG (gaining levels, stats) to boot. it's not fast paced by any means, but you can pass hours playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022221037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1485120377}
review:
Das Spiel bietet eine Menge an bekannter Spielmechaniken, die man
aus anderen Spielen schon kennt. Gut daran ist, das diese Mechaniken
sehr gut funktionieren.

Hier ein kleines Video meinerseits, weiter unten steht der Text.
https://youtu.be/dg4c0DRPYqY


Man startet auf einer fremden Insel und hat Nichts. Absolut Nichts.
Wie √ºblich bei solchen Spielen f√§ngt man damit an Ressourcen zu
sammeln und die ersten n√ºtzlichen Gegenst√§nde herzustellen.

Dabei nimmt das Spiel einen gut an die Hand, sehr gut sogar.
Es wird √ºber Quests dem Spieler alles erkl√§rt was man zum √úberleben braucht.
Wobei man nicht auf Nahrung oder Wasser achten muss.
Es gibt lediglich einen Lebens- und Ausdauerbalken. Was ich gut finde.

Durch das erf√ºllen der Quests kann man auch Stufen aufsteigen.
Der Charakter wird dadurch besser und erh√§lt mehr Lebensenergie,
Ausdauer, Regeneration und kommt besser mit den Umweltbedingungen
zurecht.

Das Spiel l√§uft sehr fl√ºssig, was aber daran liegt, das die Grafik zwar sch√∂n und
Atmosph√§risch ist, aber nicht auf dem neuesten Stand der Dinge.
Was auch gar nicht sein muss, oder vielleicht sogar kann. Durch
die ganzen Dinge die man in diesem Spiel machen kann.
(Indie Entwickler)

Detailverliebt ist es aber allemal, wenn man einen Baum abholzt dann fallen
Bl√§tter herunter. Der Regen kann verschiedene Stufen annehmen.
Wenn ein neuer Tag beginnt, dann kann der schon mal neblig anfangen
und sp√§ter zu Sonnenschein werden. 
Der ganze Tag/Nacht Zyklus ist super gelungen.

Was den ein oder anderen vielleicht st√∂ren kann, ist die Kamera.
In diesem Fall, steht der Spieler nicht in der Mitte des Bildschirms,
sondern unten am Rand. Das ist zwar gew√∂hnungsbed√ºrftig, aber
st√∂rt nach ein paar Minuten eigentlich nicht mehr.

Man kann weder rein- noch rauszoomen, das w√§re vielleicht etwas,
was man noch irgendwann einbinden kann.

√úber das Endgame kann ich noch nicht viel sagen, aber soweit wie
ich es bisher gespielt habe macht es eine Menge Spa√ü.

Gerade wenn man anf√§ngt zu k√§mpfen und den ersten Kn√ºppel
auspackt um ein paar Goblins einen Satz hei√üe Ohren zu verpassen!

Wie oben bereits beschrieben, funktioniert das Gameplay sehr gut
und ist auch sauber ausgearbeitet. Bisher hatte ich keine Bugs oder Glitches.

Wer lust auf ein Sandbox spiel hat, in dem die Survival-Elemente
eine eher untergeordnete Rolle spielen und gern Sachen baut und Dinge
erforscht, der ist bei Force of Nature genau richtig.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044729170', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 3364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3364, 'last_played': 1483358726}
review:
Odio este juego. Y lo he amado al mismo tiempo. Vale, tiene un sistema de combate muy tosco y los gr√°ficos no son lo mejor del mundo, pero engancha m√°s que la droga. Todo son risas al principio hasta que te empiezan a pedir m√°s que Hacienda cada vez que quieres subir de nivel, y te pasas horas farmeando para conseguir esos putos troncos para hacer carb√≥n para hacer movidas que luego combinar√°s con nosequ√© para hacer un **** lingote de bronce.
Edit: Despu√©s de acabar por fin el juego (me esperaba un final mejor la verdad despu√©s de pasarme varias horas grindeando materiales), lo sigo recomendando. Tiene un equilibrio muy balanceado de los materiales, pero te tiene que gustar farmear de vez en cuando ya que los requisitos de materiales son bastante elevados. Rejugabilidad pr√°cticamente nula, pero unas cuantas horitas te mantendr√° enganchado a la pantalla. Le bajo un poco la nota.

Os dejo que tengo caf√© haci√©ndose. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198000556591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1482868848}
review: Its a great game for the price. Will soak up many hours and a great balance between grind and progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077101793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1482223856}
review:
A sandbox game with limited depth, despite how it may advertise itself.

If you end up buying this game, the most important thing to know is that you need to kick bushes (R click) to get palm leaves at the start. Might sound intuitive, but it really isn't.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124892716', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1573236677}
review:
I may not have a lot of time in this game, but it is good. It's city building mixed with survival, and a RPG sense to it. 

The downside in my opinion would be the camera angle.

Edit: Also would love to be able to chose a female character instead of just being a male character. Other than the camera angle and being only a male character, it's a really fun game to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007831648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 898, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1581103748}
review:
Apres 10h :

Tr√®s bon jeu solo. C'est un Life is Feudal solo, la survie en soi n'est pas difficile (aucune lutte contre la m√©t√©o ou la faim), c'est plus un jeu de farm et de craft. Ca ressemble √† un Don't Starve mais encore une fois plus ax√© craft que survie.

Vous avez une barre de vie, une d'endurance, si vous mourrez (vie √† 0) vous perdez definitivement une partie de votre inventaire et r√©-apparaissez au spwan de d√©part ou √† un portail que vous avez construit.

On d√©bute le jeu sur une vaste ile, la zone de d√©part est sans danger et c'est la que vous allez developper votre camp.

D√®s le d√©part un systeme de qu√™te vous permet de gagner vos niveaux (chaque niveau d√©bloque de nouveaux crafts). Tr√®s bien fait, bien dos√©, bien expliqu√© m√™me si l'interface et la maniabilit√© demande une prise en main.

Il y a toujours quelque chose √† faire, √† craft, √† farm ou √† explorer. Outre la zone s√©curis√©e du d√©part, c'est la Nature et tous ces dangers qui vous attendent et donc tous les crafts vous permettant de lutter contre.

Possibilit√© de construire des batiments, des tables de cratfs, des d√©corations, de capturer des animaux, de les exploiter, de cultiver des plantes etc. Du classique mais tr√®s bien foutu, je conseille.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960555820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 180, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1492276157}
review: Great game. Fun and refreshing! If you are on the fence, BUY IT. You will not be dissapointed (well you might be, if you are a whiny little bitch, if you expect the world and offer nothing in return, if you are a spoiled brat or if you just like to watch the world burn; otherwise, you will enjoy this game). For $7.99 USD you can't complain anyway. I would gladly pay upwards of $20 for this game. Buy it. Play it. Love it. STFU.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124668331', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1530455561}
review: I waited to see if this game would go on sale for Christmas and when it didn't, I bought it anyways.  The game is cheap enough and I have been watching it since release.  I have noticed that when people bring up small issues that they would like to see changed, it only takes less than a week before the change is made.  So, if you are unsure if you should get the game, I highly suggest buying it.  The game is cheap and the development is constant.  Even if nothing else is done to this game, I am 100% pleased with the full price game.  Thank you and Merry Christmas everyone!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021576506', 'num_games_owned': 177, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 916, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1483057782}
review:
Went into this game not entirely sure what to expect... It looked simple... Boy was i wrong.

As with any "survival" game you do have the gathering grind, and not all recipes make complete sense, but the game is still in developement so i expect some of that will change.

The forced camera angle is a bit awkward, but i got use to it. Though i do still hope for an option  to change it.

All in all, a very solid game, for early access. (Especially with what "early access" has come to mean these days)

Have played a few hours, and look forward to playing many hours to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972039165', 'num_games_owned': 1596, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 6353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3770, 'last_played': 1623338022}
review: A nice crafted game, the only bugs I have seen are the ones that bite and poisen you.    Love the crafting/building/harvesting side,  Would like more things to make/build but ok as it stands and will give you value for money ar far as play time goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334353956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1416, 'last_played': 1494456737}
review: Great game a lot of fun to play can get a little hard and grindy when you get up in the higher levels.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008632106', 'num_games_owned': 1226, 'num_reviews': 164, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1482483496}
review: It takes to long to do anything. With my hour and a half play Im still only level 4 because its not a "kill stuff get exp" or "do quests get exp" kind of RPG leveling, its a "craft X and have Y materials" kind of leveling. Ontop of that stamina regen is slow. You start with about .22 stamina regen and gain .02 every level. With 80 stamina that takes 76.92 seconds to regen it all. This adds up over time. Im going to get a refund and I hope that doesnt remove this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085207555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1540169028}
review: I quite like this game from what I've done so far in my first few hours. The game is rather slow paced, but in a relaxing way. The gameplay is simple yet strangely satisfying as it goes on, and for the price I'd say it's a fairly safe bet. The game lacks some polish (coocking table anyone?), but if you can look past minor things like that it should be a overall positive experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016638391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1405, 'last_played': 1517347236}
review: This game is fun and addictive. I like that you have to do the quests as they are given or you can't proceed. Each quest is learning to craft another item. It really expands on alot of things to harvest as the items to make are all being compiled in order to build a home and farm your land. There are lots of other things too but why spoil it for you. LOL

author: {'steamid': '76561198023197403', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1376, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 871, 'last_played': 1553310870}
review:
Yes. YES! This is the game I was looking for. 
Simple gameplay, easy controls, freedom to what you want, when you want, and go crazy with the crafting. 
It let's you explore, make your own story - almost like minecraft, but more focused on realistic crafting and harvesting than moving blocks around. 
It may be more realistic, with starting off making a stone knife and rope with flint and palm fronds and then make your way up from there, but still has fantasy with goblins and teleporters.
And the price is just right. From all the disappointments I kept getting trying to find a good building/crafting game ... I finally found it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026833258', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1482242837}

author: {'steamid': '76561197977776470', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1482284214}
review:
TLDR:  A fun (if at times tedious and frustrating) survival, crafting, scavaging game worth a few bucks, but if your money or time is limited - there are vastly superior options available.

This game has lots of issues:

The camera is infuriating.  
The controls are lacking.
You can't chop/mine/attack/etc while inventory is up.
Abysmal enemy AI.
Tons of resources required for crafting in mid game with no crafting queue.  It's super tedious and can get confusing.
Only has very basic base building and requires massive resources for even a fence.

Even though I'm finding it mildly entertaining, It's hard to recommend this game when there are vastly superior options.  7 Days to Die for example is more money, but absolutely amazing.  I have around 200 hours in it and still go back regularly.  Force of Nature won't see 10 hours in its current form.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106279489', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1039, 'last_played': 1483800750}
review:
Malgr√© plein de d√©tails tr√©s agacants (mais qui on n'en doute pas vont s'am√©liorer au fil des patchs) le jeu reste jouable et agr√©able.

Les +:
-crafting  d√©velopp√©
- map qui semble bien grande
-visiblement, il y a un semblant d'histoire et non un simple crafting sans but
- toujours quelque chose √† faire
-construction de base sympa
-prix + qu'abordable

Les bofs:
-cam√©ra zarbi mais on s'y habitue
- combat fadasse pour l'instant
-graphisme ann√©es 2000 (pour ceux que ca g√™ne, moi ca allait perso)
- manque un peu de survie √† mon gout, malgr√© que cela soit agr√©able de ne pas stresser tout le temps pour trouver de la bouffe.

Les -:
- une map pixelis√©e d√©gueue et quasi inutile. Tr√©s frustrante quand on cherche une ressource d√©s√©sp√©r√©ment. 
-des qu√™tes affligeantes de dirigisme et d'ennuyosit√© (pourquoi tout bonnement ne pas bloquer le passage de niveau par des constructions requises directement, au lieu de dire que pour passer au niveau sup√©rieur il faut avoir rempli la qu√™te "construit un four"). 
-cot√© RPG inexistant alors que vendu comme tel.


N√©anmoins, pour le prix, et vu que c'est √† peine le d√©but du jeu, je conseille vivement aux amateurs du genre de l'acheter. C'est rare de trouver un tel crafting dans un jeu solo et pas un MMORPG, sans pour autant que cela tombe dans un ennui mortel. M√©rite de s'y int√©r√©sser et d'√©sp√©rer de bons patchs, et m√©rite amplement le prix

author: {'steamid': '76561198117118909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 476, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1488082316}
review:
Please Read if concerned about buying!!!
 
NOTE: Many people address the issue of the camera view. You must hold the 'space bar' when any menu is up to change your camera view with your mouse. Exit all on screen menus with 'escape key' or repress the same menu key as before.

Jumping straight into the Pros and Cons...

Pros:
* Death penalty - lose random items in personal inventory
Why is this a Pro? Because you do not have to hunt down your old inventory/lose everything

* Multi-tasking - can craft multiple items from DIFFERENT work benches/crafting menus.
You can craft several of one item (if materials permit), run through the forest like Rambo, and be home in time for tea. Yes, the crafting works while you walk away from any station.

* Multitude of crafting - There is many (many) things to craft, and each has a purpose.

* Safe Startup - So far, every time I spawned it was back at the original beach which has been safe from monsters thus far. However there is a con to this, leading right to...

* Character Progression - The character progresses in terms of completing quests and as a reward gains more health/stamina/damage/speed. This is non-selective, and is a fixed leveling system. Each level opens up new crafting recipes to further your survival/exploration.

Cons:
* Mobs respawn on Startup/death - The monsters and other baddies respawn after I leave the game or die, even if I did nuke the island clean. This isn't necessarily bad, because there is more resources available. But if I want to get across the map I need to wipe out everyone again.

* Combat - the combat feels a bit sluggish specifically with melee weapons. Ranged weapons are bit tricky to get used to due to the camera view.

* No Sprint - this isn't a feature in the game that I know of, and would come in handy when being chased by a bear, a boar, and a fox. Leading into ...

* Non-neutral Animals - There are many animals in the game that can be tamed for resources. There is also a number of bad animals for hunting, and if they see you from a good distance away they will chase you and most likely kill you.

* No Mob control combat - Many times there will be 3 or more monsters/animals attacking you and you can only hit one at a time. This usually results in your death, and ranged attacks need to be used before-hand.

* Tedious - This game will consume a lot of time before anything is done. Getting resources cost stamina, and at lower levels at the beginning can take some time.

* Menus - There are several menus for different crafting, which requires a lot of clicking and/or dragging. 

OVERALL: 3.5/5
This game shows good promise, but needs some work to reduce the amount of work the player needs to do. This game definitely requires some patience and an ability to grind out materials. I'm going to keep playing and see how things progress and will add/edit my future opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198311025187', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1530792165}
review:
Fun game, worth the money for people who have the crafting/building/survival itch.

On the bad side, it doesn't really have much survival. I can't for the life of me understand why there is food and water, but no hunger or thirst. There's temperature zones and clothing, but no changing seasons. I wish there were a greater sense of urgency, that you had to start a fire OR DIE and make food OR DIE. 

On the good side, it keeps you hooked with the gathering and crafting. Everything that you can do makes sense and flows in a natural way. The amount of grind seems perfectly reasonable to me so far. Between raids out in nature and trying to not get eaten by bears, and watering and feeding my animals back home and trying to get the new tools, i think there will be a few more hours of gameplay for me still.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039158408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1484300006}
review:
G'day all, first review 5 years after installing Steam!  This game is a pretty good investment so far.  Cheap enough to risk the 8 bucks and I have already got 6 hours out of it.  I must admit that some of that time was spent wondering how to get sticks after the initial sticks were used.

Force of Nature feels claustrophobic due to the very limited camera angle and control method - maybe this is intentional but I struggled with it.  The devs really need to make this a bit more flexible as I think this will be the thing that disappoints most players.  Maybe it is me, but I found it hard to get to the goblins - I had to chop things down to do this which used up stamina and made me vulnerable when I finally stumbled on to 4 goblins at once.  The spelling and grammar in the game are quite often incorrect but maybe only old farts like me care about that.

Give this game a whirl if you like sandbox survival games, it is fun and there seems to be a fair bit of content that I have not yet even approached.  Force of Nature has a lot of potential that I hope is not left to rot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008821594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1221, 'last_played': 1482385750}
review:
Um, I just lost complete track of time playing this game. Almost 9 hours...and I forgot to eat. I ate a lot in the game though, and had a ton of fun. I'm having a hard time taming the animals, but I'll get there. I have a chicken and a sheep so far. Taking care of them, and the crops, and crafting, and building, and killing stuff...this game is great.

My only tiny issue would be the camera angle. The distance one is better than the top down one, but you still can't see very far. It took a little to get used to, and I just go slow and listen for the enemies. They'll let you know when they see you. Gotta watch for them hangin in small packs, and try to get home before dark.

Highly recommended, and the price is awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070492304', 'num_games_owned': 123, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1235, 'last_played': 1574277033}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046100307', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1482094486}
review:
Hi Leute,

das Spiel ist einfach super und es macht Spa√ü! F√ºr den Preis, ein fast bugfreies Spiel. Allerdings ist es manchmal doch recht *schwer* am Anfang.

Aber sonst ein Gutes Spiel.

Pro:
+ g√ºnstig im Preis
+ gute Grafik
+ nicht zu leicht und nicht zu schwer

author: {'steamid': '76561198025949324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 488, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1644389463}
review:
I love this game.  It somehow has the near perfect balance between grind and reward.  The quests are required to continue, but at the same time they are things you want to do anyway.  You level up by completing quests and handing in what you've crafted through those quests.  So it's kind of like paying for increasing your tech tree, which I was kinda iffy about it at first but it just works.  
With the new camera introduced in the last patch it is easier on the eyes.  Graphics are simple yet pretty.  Food works to heal you or increase stamina [both regenerate really slowly, but a bit too slow, so having foods that heal and recover stamina is always a good idea, specially out in the wild].  
Farm, craft, battle, build, tame animals.  
Only things missing is co-op [which is being worked on by what I've read in the forums].  

You are stuck playing as the guy in the video so don't get hopes about any character creation or gender options.  It will also be quite a few hours before you start getting armor/clothing, so hope you like generic castaway shorts!  
But those are minor gripes that don't take away from the fun and relaxing gameplay.  
Should also point out:  only languages available at the time of this writing are English and Russian, so if that is an issue you may want to wait.  

tl;dr - At this price this game is a must buy for all crafting-survival fans that don't mind playing solo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051407717', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1482007726}
review:
If you really enjoy sandbox survival/builder games but you think they tend to lead you to nowhere, then this is a really good game for you.  You get to do a lot of things that are available in other survival games.  But there is a storyline and goal.  You can stop doing quests and just explore but you won't level up because leveling is based only on completing quests.  This is neither good nor bad. If you use that fact to your advantage you can have alot of control over your experience.

This game is not trying to be like other games. It's trying to provide a quality experience and do everything it does as well as possible.  So it might feel a bit more on the rails, but you're rewarded in a quality experience.

CONS:  The camera control or lack of it.  I keep trying to change the camera angle only to remember it's fixed.

PROS:  
Good crafting system that's not frustrating but not too easy
Interesting and subtly funny things to do, especially related to taming animals.
You don't get awesome gear off mobs you kill.  You craft it or you don't have it.
There's enough resources to start off with so you don't have to go somewhere impossible at first.  
The combat system is about right in difficulty in my opinion.
There's a seed system (I am fairly sure) for the world generation based on the world name.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978081139', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1276, 'last_played': 1599950550}
review:
This is my first time for a game of this type, so I have no experiences to compare this game to.
I dig it.  I guess I'm a bit more forgiving when it comes to a game's idiosyncrasies, but the camera angle some people don't like doesn't bother me; I just accept it as part of the game.  I've yet to play it with yesterday's patch, so I might amend this later.
There's always something you could be doing to gain resources while waiting on something to be completed craft or buildwise, and you'll need everything you find at one point or another.  If I had to find something negative, I'd have to say the fighting just seems like taking turns whacking one another, rather than your levels and experience helping you with some misses every once in a while (on both sides, if applicable).  The taming process is a bit of a pain, but I remember what a time Rocky had with trying to catch a chicken, so that's most likely just my inexperience with this style game.

Overall, great job, developers!  I'm really enjoying the balance between the Zen of gathering resources, and the sheer panic when trying to catch an animal, or fighting a group of goblins.  The price is a steal, as well.  10/10 for the blending of genres, and the great gameplay and pleasing artwork.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014674308', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 970, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1521593073}
review:
So, here we have another crafting/survival game. Only this time, it's feature complete. Also, it's not a survival game. 

That all said, I like it. It's a fairly slow paced game with long crafting timers, the forced camera angle is wonky (the developers state they are working on this), there's a lot of annoying controls and the English translation is somewhat off. The combat is clunky and irritating, progression is too linear and heavily gated and the grind is excessive.

That all said. I like it. The developers have been updating frequently since release, listening to player feedback and working hard to improve the game. It's a fairly relaxing, low-key experience that has you working to build up your caveman camp. Hang out, make some bread, maybe chill out with your chicken friends, smack a goblin in the face and kick some banana trees. There is a lot to do, a lot of content, the crafting trees and supply chains all make sense, and you really do get the sense that in most cases, the grind actions you're taking are outright helping you improve your ability to take on the threats of [NONDESCRIPT DESERTED ISLAND], I've also noticed very little in the way of bugs and the game is feature complete. Everything promised in the description is there and the game functions, which puts it head and shoulders above a lot of early access games in the same genre that are promising the moon.

If you're into the crafting/survival genre, I think this is a good buy, especially at such a reasonable price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111438072', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1608473553}
review:
Ich bin ein groer Fan von Aufbau- und Farminggames. Als ich Force of Nature vor ein paar Tagen entdeckte, dachte ich: "Bei dem Preis kann es noch nicht gut sein!"

Ich muss sagen: Irrtum! EIn ganz gro√ües Lob an die Entwickler. Sie haben ein sehr detailverliebtes Spiel mit vielen M√∂glichkeiten und sehr viel Farming entwickelt.

Ich will nun versuchen ein bischen mehr aufzuteilen:

Grafik:
Die Grafik gibt selbst auf meinem alten Lenovo B590 einiges her. Die Oberfl√§chenstrukturen wirken nat√ºrlich, das Gr√ºn der Wiesen und B√§ume ist satt und wirklich naturnah im Farbspektrum. Die Texturen der unterschiedlichen Objekte passen und alles wirkt insgesamt sehr geschmeidig - immerhin rennt man halbnackt auf einer Insel?? rum, wo es nun mal seh viel Flora und Fauna gibt, die es grafisch gut darzustellen gilt. Das wurde hervorragend gel√∂st, das Auge hat viel zu sehen. Ich denke je besser die Grafikkarte im PC, desto besser sieht es dann noch aus. Aber f√ºr alle mit etwas √§lteren Gamer-Inseln: Traut ruch ruhig ran!

Gameplay:
Die Bewegungen wirken sehr fl√ºssig, man merkt das man eine Axt schwingt oder das Messer benutzt.
Es gibt viel zu entdecken, B√§ume, B√ºsche und andere Dinge versperren einen tats√§chlich den Weg, hier gilt es sich durchzuarbeiten und gleichzeitig viel Material zu sammeln.

Was entwas merkw√ºrdig daher kommt ist die Draufsicht, man sieht seinen Charakter nur aus der Vogelperspektive. Wirklich st√∂rend ist das allerdings bisher nicht.

Die Natur ist hier der Rohstofflieferant, welcher gut genutzt werden muss um alles zu bauen was man sich ertr√§umt und das ist bis jetzt schon einiges: Es reicht von einfachen Steinwaffen √ºber H√§user, Z√§une, √ñfen bis hin zu Beeten, R√ºstung und sogar Bienenst√∂cken.

Alles funktioniert sehr sinnig, selbst die Rezepte wirken plausibel. Lediglich der Zugang zu den Men√ºs ist am Anfang etwas verwirrend, man kann nciht mit offenen Men√º laufen wie mit geschlossenem sondern rennt quasi nur horizontal oder vertikal durch die Gegend, das m√ºsste gel√∂st werden das die Bewegungsfreiheit die gleich bleibt wenn man sein Inventar offen hat.

K√§mpfe:

Ich habe bisher nur gegen Goblins gek√§mpft, wo sich die richtige Waffewahl durchaus bemerkbar macht. Je mehr es n√§mlich werden, deto nutzloser ist der Kn√ºppel. Mal schauen was ncoh kommt...Bossgegner und eine Art Magie schienen laut Video dabei zu sein.

Fazit:
Pro:
- Farming, Farmin, Farming
- Baut eueren eigenen Hof
-Jagen und sammeln
- Gute Grafik
- Zusammenspiel zwischen Natur und Spieler ist genial gel√∂st
- sinnvolle Rezepte
- Kampf macht irgendwie Laune auf mehr Gegener und bessere Waffen

Contra:

- Kamerasteuerung
- Men√º auf und Laufen ist etwas ung√ºnstig gel√∂st


So das wars f√ºrs Erste!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061843086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1481789705}
review: Got bored 90 mintues in... Some may find it refereshing but I found the successes to be empty and the progression not very satisfying. Likes nice at first, but the simplicity and repetativeness are a bit much in the early game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003133304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1481766405}
review:
First and biggest problem- The control was awkward and the camera angle was permanently locked to some weird 3rd person view with no way of being changed. Between the camera angle and the somewhat weird graphics, I was feeling somewhat nauseous after playing for an hour or so. Though obviously this may vary from person to person. 

Secondly, there is little to no sense of urgency despite it being a survival game. Hunger and thirst currently does not exist, and any food you craft exist solely to heal you or give you back stamina, both of which regenerate (slowly) on their own anyway. 

Thirdly, the gameplay was incredibly, incredibly slow paced, yet the 'slowness' felt artificial and manifest primarily in the form of crafting time on just about anything you make. Though the gathering speed was also frustratingly slow even though it may simply be an illusion created by the painfully slow gathering animation, this is compounded further by the fact that you'll be constantly low/out of stamina even when you're spamming food. Looking back, what I accomplished in an hour in this game I probably could've done in other games within the first fifteen minutes of spawning into a world.

But on the plus side, this game IS relatively cheap, and if the camera angle is ever fixed I would probably flip the 'No' to a 'Yes' based on the price alone. For nowthough , you're probably still better off playing modded Minecraft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059556836', 'num_games_owned': 2756, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1076, 'last_played': 1482413223}
review:
[b]tl;dr - Buy this and play it!![/b]

‚ÄúForce of Nature‚Äù is an interesting game. It‚Äôs a quasi-survival, open world, RPG, adventure, crafting, and farming genre laden experience. It isn‚Äôt overly complicated and it provides just the right mix of tasks to fun. It‚Äôs casually simple in nature and I found it quite relaxing to play. I definitely recommend anyone to give it try!

When you begin, you‚Äôll start out with nothing and have to craft everything you need to get by. This idea isn‚Äôt really new or ground breaking in the world of survival type sims. However, how you survive and craft is a little different from the likes of say ‚ÄúStranded Deep.‚Äù You have two bars to manage: a health bar & a stamina bar. Health depletes as you take damage from the ‚Äúwildlife‚Äù and stamina depletes as you perform tasks such as chopping down trees or gathering items. To replenish these all you have to do is eat, and drink. No hunger, or thirst bars to manage. No sleeping, unless you want too. In fact sleeping isn‚Äôt even available at the start of the game, as the schematic to craft the bed doesn‚Äôt unlock until you gain a few levels. In order to gain levels you‚Äôll have to complete tasks contained in your journal. After completing said tasks and leveling all the way up, you‚Äôve essentially beat the game. However, you‚Äôre free to continue playing the game in a type of sandbox mode with all crafting recipes unlocked. 

The controls are simple, the graphics and art are well done and look good. Some of the animations can look a bit strange at times, but they work well within the simplicity of the task actions - such as digging, mining ore, etc. Currently, there is only one locked playing view. The view is in a third person perspective and is elevated directly behind the player ‚Äì sort of isometric‚Äôish, but not quite. The lack of viewing freedom and the viewing field can get a little frustrating at times, especially while trying to navigate the thick forest areas and during combat. I understand the design choice, being that there is no ‚Äúfog of war‚Äù so having a free camera would probably spoil the excitement that comes with exploring the area, and foraging for materials necessary to craft. However if you get lost, there is an available mini-map to assist with navigation around the lush and dangerous world. 

Over all, I have to say that I am very impressed with the design of the game, as well as the gameplay. I like what the devs have done with it by thinking outside of the box and by incorporating several different gameplay mechanics into it to make it their own. I‚Äôm honestly a little shocked the game isn‚Äôt more expensive, as I think it could be. It was $7.99 USD for me. However after playing it I would‚Äôve been happy paying more for it ‚Äì if I had to, of course. It seems the developer is active on the forums and is open to suggestions on ways to better the game. Force of Nature is a promising game and I really hope the devs stay with it by continuing to add and improve upon it. Just a couple items I would like to see is; more enemy variety and a few character customization options. Overall I give Force of Nature a ‚Äú[b]Must Play[/b]‚Äù  - [b]9/10[/b].

[b]The Good[/b]
+ [i]Robust crafting experience[/i]
+ [i]Easy to learn and play[/i]
+ [i]It‚Äôs not RUST[/i]
+ [i]Better than RUST[/i]

[b]The Bad[/b] - Grasping here
- [i]Fixed camera position[/i]
- [i]Lack of enemy variety[/i]
- [i]A few English spelling & grammar errors[/i]
- [i]Some repetitive sound effects & music[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198034345171', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1482272989}
review:
Nice fun game with allot of crafting options and crafting menus that are easy to use .
There are litle quests you need to do for leveling up and they also work like a sort of tutorial.

Graphics are nice and the sounds do add enough to make the game feel more alive.

The game seems to run very smooth with only a small hickup when it autosaves but nothing dramatic.
Sofar i also did not encounter any bug in the six hours i played it.

Only downsides are the combat that is a bit simple and the camera angle . However after playing for a while the last seems to be getting used to.

If you like survival type games or if your on a budget this title could be worth picking up

author: {'steamid': '76561198134116220', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 176, 'last_played': 1481758734}
review:
Reviewed: Dec 14, 2016

Painfully boring even in the first few hours of playing (currently "Level 6").  Combat is tremendously simple and offers little enjoyment.  Game has some potential that can be added via patching but the entertainment factor is lost very quickly.

I will re-visit this game after a while to see if it's improved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060899664', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1643463601}
review:
Bei FoN merkt man von Beginn an, wie wichtig den Entwicklern ein gutes und vorzeigbares Spielerlebnis ist. Das Spiel kommt sehr detailverliebt daher, ansehnlich in h√ºbscher Grafik verpackt, mit einem angenehmen Spielfluss und simpler Steuerung. Es st√∂rt meiner Meinung nach nicht einmal, dass es bislang nur eine russische und englische Sprachausgabe gibt, denn jeder Aspekt, jede T√§tigkeit ist genau beschrieben und leicht verst√§ndlich, selbst wenn man die Fremdsprache nicht allzu gut beherrscht. In meinen bisherigen f√ºnf Spielstunden konnte ich tats√§chlich auch nicht wirklich aufh√∂ren zu spielen, weil die Quests und das daraus resultierende Levelsystem einen irgendwie fesseln. Ich bin kein Steam-Troph√§en-J√§ger, doch jeder kleine Erfolg im Spiel, der mich einLevel weiterbringt macht einfach Spa√ü. Monster und Tiere sind von knuffig s√º√ü bis gruselig hart dabei und das in vielf√§ltiger Form. Neben den klassischem RPG Komponenten kann man enorm viel craften und erkunden, ausprobieren und entdecken. 

Gibt es bei all der Euphorie auch Negatives zu berichten? Die Grafik ist zweifelsohne ein kleiner Hingucker - leider (noch) etwas Arm an Schatteneffekten, was nicht wirklich st√∂rt. Bugs (Abst√ºrze, Klippenfehler usw.) hatte ich in den f√ºnf Spielstunden keinen einzigen, Hut ab an der Stelle. Eine Kleinigkeit, die ich aber ehr witzig, als st√∂rend empfinde: weglaufende Tiere am Strand laufen gern mal so weit ins offene Meer hinaus, dass man nur noch die Blubberblasen sieht. Aber keine Panik, sie √ºberleben das ;-) Was mich pers√∂nlich etwas stutzig macht ist, dass man die Kamera weder kippen noch zoomen kann. Das w√§re noch verbesserungsw√ºrdig. Allerdings st√∂rt das den Spielfluss nur insoweit, dass man ab und zu einen Feind hinter einen Baum nicht rechtzeitig sieht, weil die Perspektive der Kamera nicht immer gleich f√ºr das Ausblenden des Laubwerks sorgt. Vorsicht also beim Betreten der W√§lder - Gefahren k√∂nnen √ºberall lauern :-)

Zusammenfassend kann ich sagen: ein sehr gelungenes Mix-Genre- Spiel, wo f√ºr jeden etwas dabei ist, dass von Anfang an ohne lahmende Wartezeiten beim Craften auskommt - es gibt immer etwas zu tun!

Pros:
- h√ºbsche Grafik, detailverliebt
- ausgewogene Ressourcen, Biome
- sehr einfache Erkl√§rungen der Quests in englischer Textausgabe (auch f√ºr weniger Wortgewandte geeignet)
- guter und leichter Einstieg
- praktisch keine Bugs (bereits in Version 1.0)
- Tiere und Monster verhalten sich realistisch
- viele und detailreiche Craftingm√∂glichkeiten (mit Bild und Worterkl√§rungen und Tips)
- ungehemmter Erkundungsdrang
- hoher Wiederspielfaktor, da prozedural generierte Landschaft

Cons:
- fehlende Kipp- u. Zoomfunktion der Vogelperspektiven-Kamera
- wenige Schatteneffekte

Das Preis/Leistungsverh√§ltnis is im Vergleich zu vielen anderen Produkten ein Kracher und im Moment kaum zu toppen.

Liebe Entwickler: vielen Dank, endlich mal kein Fehlkauf!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065923820', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1481809085}
review:
[h1] Un Gran Comienzo[/h1]

Ya llevo unas cuantas horas metidas en este juego y creo que puedo decir sin lugar a dudas que este juego promete y lo hace muy fuerte. Es un juego de pura y duro crafting y supervivencia. Es sencillo, directo y moriras una y otra vez hasta que consigas aumentar de nivel, y como consecuencia desbloquear crafteos mas potentes.

Los graficos son simples y por ahora esta solo en ingles y ruso, pero se ve que trabajan duro en el (segundo dia y ya van 2 actualizaciones) asi que espero, con mucho interes, ver el rumbo que sigue y ver a donde nos lleva.

En fin, solo una palabra lo define... divertido.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170310923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1506440186}
review:
I have played this game for 6 hrs now so i feel I have a good idea for the feel of it and how to play it.
Firstly its very enjoyable with a good system for crafting and also for farming, taming animals as well for your plot,in a word so far its great!
Like a few of the comments before have made don't expect to rush this game it requires patience and if your looking for a bit of relaxation whilst  playing a game this is for you.
Nice graphics and weather system as well.
I would like personally a choice of Male or female avatars as it's not only guys that play games so that would be great please at the moment  there is only a male choice sooo!
You have to fend off some aggrivating little troll like creatures as well  so you have to protect your plot and after all your  hard work you really don't want to lose anything !
Also the UI  could be better but it works for now ok but I am sure in time they will customise it better,  not too bad really its easy to come to grips with after a few mins or so.
My last suggestion as well is the view point at the moment its top down almost and being able to look into the distance or pull back would be great it is a bit low.
Overall  I love it  and I think as this game goes on it will only get better as they iron stuff out and whilst it is on sale it's a great buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198089149767', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1481759770}
review:
-Gets in game

- Lowers standards once I read "Were am I?" (*Where)

- Plays for 2-3 hours straight with little interest in stopping.

I'd say it's a pretty amazing game!
Here are a few pros and cons so far:

Pros:
Easy to find resources
Lots of enemies to kill
Crafting interface makes sense
Keeps you wanting more

Cons:
Enemies can destroy you early on if 2 or more of them gang up on you.
Camera angle is always facing the same way the character is.

So far, I'd give it a 7/10, definitely worth the $8 :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198118867668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1481741228}
review:
Why I dislike this game:
 - I appear to have woken up on a beach, as a... brown-haired white man. How dull.
 - These bushes are weirdly solid... I can't even get close to that spidly leaf? Really?
 - While I'm always looking at the ground IRL, if I'm looking for palm leaves and strawberry plants in a place devoid of other people I will definitely want to look around. But I can't. So I'm on a beach and can't remember which way the sea is...
 - Speaking of camera controls, I'd rather not have to do this funky crab-walk whenever I want to pick something up, and when I'm exploring, I'd really like to see if that cool-looking object is pick-up-able.
 - You're telling me that if I dig my digging stick into grass, I can't get soil? What's this grass growing on, bedrock?
 - Too many inventory windows. IMO, character, inventory, crafting and building could have gone in one tabbed window that stays open while camera controls/picking up objects remains enabled. Too much clicking and not enough playing!

Why I like this game:
 - Quests: few at a time, easy at first, difficulty increasing. Great way to learn the controls and game mechanics.
 - Mining/gathering/crafting/building: easy to understand, fun and realistic (both in terms of materials found/needed and time taken to gather/make).
 - Stamina: could be a little more balanced but overall is realistic. Also got me wanting bananas now...
 - Graphics: the world is pretty and the weather effects are both cool and realistic! 
 - The aesthetic and aims of the game combine to make it feel really relaxed and chill, if you ignore the frustration from the UI/camera controls.

TL;DR: UI and cameral controls are rubbish but the ideas behind the game are good, making it feel like it should be early access. It definitely has the potential to be fun but right now it's just a little irritating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016055966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1485985635}
review:
Force of Nature hat mich durchaus positiv √ºberascht.

Ich st√∂berte im shop und stie√ü auf diesen Titel, von dem ich bisher noch nichts geh√∂rt hatte. Spontan entschlo√ü ich mich zum Kauf, da ich noch ein wenig Guthaben hatte und startete das Spiel.

Die Grafik ist schnuckelig und stimmig, der Sound ist atmosph√§risch. Die Steuerung und der Umgang mit den Menus ist selbsterkl√§rend. Das Spiel nimmt einen am Anfang an die Hand und erkl√§rt das crafting-System.

Farmen, Bauen, erkunden und k√§mpfen...all das durfte ich bereits in der ersten Spielstunde erleben.

Negativ muss ich die Kameraposition erw√§hnen. Der Winkel der Kamera ist etwas ungl√ºcklich, sodass die Sichtweite sehr eingeschr√§nkt ist. Auch die Orientierung f√§llt wegen der seltsamen Kameraperspektive manchmal etwas schwer. Ich hoffe hier wird noch nachgebessert.

Fazit: Scheint ein wirklich tolles Spiel zu sein und bei dem Preis sollten Freunde des Genres zugreifen.

Ich habe mit einem [b] [url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLIyR65prQ37iBrsSsS3KWxc65hV-wW3uV] Let's play	[/url] [/b] auf Youtube  begonnen, sodass Interessierte hier einen Einblick ins Spiel bekommen k√∂nnen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042280305', 'num_games_owned': 1228, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1512, 'last_played': 1484571953}
review:
25 hours into the game

1) Graphics wise- simple but vauled for money map looks tacky though.
2) Early in the game tried to kill a rabbit but it just runs off way faster than i can attack it. 
A little frustrating but I guess I'll be able to kil it later.
3) The quests helps to get you going in the right direction.
4) Stamina recovers quite slowly though. And theres only one fixed camera view.
5)The background nature soundtrack has calming / hypnotizng effects  not sure if thats good or bad.
6) The crafting menus are simple and easy to learn.
7) Should have a keyboard function to harvest stuff instead of having to click the harvest option in inventory menu.
8) Perhaps should include some skill trees. / skill tree map to show the unlockable stuff like wood work, mining, fishing etc which will allow for more challenge and reward systems like the over all leveling up.
9) Perhaps including a gender selection would be nice? 
10) the collection of crafted items seems to be abit of a time wasting hassle which can be improved on. 
11) Please make seeds for trees #SAVE THE EARTH
12)Throwable spears made from wood would be nice too.

Overall for a game that only launched on 13 Dec 2016 and I'm playing it in the 2nd day.
The developers have been actively updating the game. well done!!

"This a promising title for crafting sandbox games."
"Love the title (force of nature) simple yet impactful." 
"Graphics worth the money so far."
"Has impressed me by how much they already have to offer on their first day of release, manage to get me hoping to see more promising updates in the near future."
"DEFINITELY A GOOD CRAFTING GAME WORTH THE $$$$$"

author: {'steamid': '76561198069627378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 892, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1493087096}
review: Fun little sandbox crafting game. Build a base, tame animals for food and useful items, and craft a ton of weapons and items. 3 hours in and having a blast. Very relaxed pace and a nice change from more hardcore survival/crafting games. Worth the price easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271130670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1508391475}
review:
Only 3 hours or so of gameplay and I'm absolutely in love with the game. Some pro's and con's are listed below:

Pro's:
- The game's intuitive questing system provides enough guideline to get you fully started and initiated into the game. There's no guessing as to what to do!
- The RPG aspect of the game is wonderful. Full of crafting, fighting, surviving, etc. It's truly a sandbox
- Interface is fairly easy to understand
- Leveling system (though, there is no skill allocation)
- Minimal controls! 1 - 8 on your keyboard, 4 buttons to access your crafting, building, inventory and map, and your mouse.
- Graphics are outstandingly wonderful for the minimalization of spec's required to play the game. Truly is wonderful and simple for any computer or toaster :)


Con's:
- Aerial view can be discomforting at times
- No option to scroll in and out of your character
- All mobs aggro to you, and there's no getting away (But are level 1 when you start, so you can kill them, but 1 by 1)
- A bit of a slow start. So if you're looking to jump in and craft some crazy armor, you're gonna have to wait a bit. (THAT's JUST A PERSONAL THING FOR ME!!!)


Overall - The con's do not nearly have enough of a negative effect on the expereince of the game to say this game is just not amazing. There are very few games out there where you can just play alone and feel like you're immersed into the world. It's your village, your way, your own farms, your own way of fighting, your way for gathering, your way of getting by. You're not restricted by any means and it's just so simply complex. It really is worth the money 100%, and it's developers are certainly headed towards a wonderful future for this fresh RPG Sandbox.

There aren't games as freeing as this folks, so if you're really looking for a, dare I say, realistic Minecraft, or Medeival and simple Elder Scrolls combo, this is definitely the game for you. I'm sure the developers will work with the aerial view and the minor kinks of the game to bring out the best. 

Personal Rating: 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197971652634', 'num_games_owned': 233, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1551818047}
review:
I am having a whole lot of fun playing this game. 

https://youtu.be/tikEH8EDmWE

Would like to make some suggestions:
Ability to pan the camera a bit
Indication when a tree (node) is depleted i.e., ferns, sticks, etc.
Ability to rotate cama when inventory is open.

So far these are only minor sugestions and I am having a great time.

Very addicting! WELL WORTH THE $8!

author: {'steamid': '76561197993867485', 'num_games_owned': 1781, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1481688322}
review:
The game seems like it still needs a lot of work. You're locked to bird's eye view of your character, without the ability to zoom in or out. 

There are a few major annoyances too, that I found to be way too annoying to enjoy the game. For example. If you close a crafting menu after you initate crafting, to get to the menu where you claim the crafted item, you have to fiddle with all other menus until it will randomly come into focus again.

Item names are only seen (for items on the ground) when you are in inventory view. While this may be fine, when you're in inventory view, you are locked to a single direction of travel. Whever your char is pointing at the time, is where you can go forward/back and strafe... but not turn. Turning is done when you are out of any menus' only.

Overall, I cannot recommend the game that forces you to struggle with the UI more than trying to play the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075926252', 'num_games_owned': 269, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1485138765}
review: Worth every penny. Just buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198030958834', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1481669573}
review:
So far I cant recomend it.   The combat  and controls in general are clunky and need to optimized.  A click to move system would make navigation better.  The controls feel like it came from a console. I like the crafting and building but the char development and leveling system is also lackluster.    It doesn't appear as of yet that there are any devs involved in steam forums so thats a big negative for me as the game feels very EA and it would be cool if devs were taking ideas from fans.  

Almost forgot... Your char only has health and stamina.   You do not need to eat, drink, sleep.  The weather doesn't seem to matter...heat,cold,rain,etc. You can afk for hours and your char will be fine.  You can carry huge ginormous amounts of inventory but you can't store it on the ground or in containers.  When i'm tired of finding my way back home I just die by suicide and magically I'm back at my base.   

This is not a survival game its more like and arcade rpg with crafting.  I hope they update and patch and when they do I'll change my review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068083624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 955, 'last_played': 1481831806}
review:
3 hours into the game, so far everything works and I enjoy playing.
For the price the game has very good amount of playtime, lots of different enemies, crafting, building, farming, plants, tools, weapons, armor and loot etc.

Replayability with hardcore mode. Futur updates will bring some new features.
If you are okay with sandbox mode and liked games like Don't starve, this game is a good buy :)

Had 1 crash so far, but thx to autosave I lost nothing at all.


The only few things I dislike:

To discover new plans and recipes, you have to level up. 
To level up, u have to finish all quests (get xx and yy loot and craft zz).
The level up then needs additional materials. Who the hell needs 10x sand to level up?........

It feels like an artificial border, why I can't just get them ironswords and armor and have to run around naked with hundreds of iron ores in my pocket : /

Also there is a major "harvest all" button bug, where u can harvest unlimitied amounts of recources by simply clicking the button over and over again.

Combat is simple tank&spank because of simple clumsy movement.

Windows/menues are clumsy, you have to close additional windows and take loot manually. You can move with windows open, but not turn around.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987059876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 317, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 317, 'last_played': 1481951166}
review:
The game is great! Sure its got mediocre graphics but they're not the highlight anyway. Progression is in these crafting survival games and this game has it in spades! Each upgrade is an obvious increase to your survivability. The only two "survival" stats are health and stamina, neither of which are difficult to manage and death only results in a few items being lost (a permadeath mode can be unlocked it seems). Seeing your base go from a shack and a fire to a spiked fortress filled with animals is incredibly fun and Ill be coming back to this one for a while.

Something that does need to be mentioned is the controls take a bit of getting used to. You are set on a high third person camera right behind your character which is very jarring (even possibly annoying) at first. Holding space allows you to pick stuff up with the mouse or interact with items which feels very "stop and start" since you control the turning of your character when not holding space. This would be a pretty big con EXCEPT you can just hit ctrl to grab stuff. At this point I'm completely used to it and find the controls to be fine.

I'm normally hesitant with these indie type games but for $8 I highly recommend this one. It takes a little to start but once it gets going you'll find yourself spending a lot of time with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018448595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1481743475}
review: Great little game - bargain at a fiver.  Crafting, exploring and combat are well combined and good fun if challenging and a tad repetitive at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044442942', 'num_games_owned': 1558, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 146, 'last_played': 1482339170}
review:
Force of Nature is a castaway style adventure/survival game.  Essentially you begin the game on a beach with nothing, collect rocks, sticks, and leaves, then craft to create an axe, hammer, rope etc.  eventually building huts, farming rabbits, and hunting various beasts  (Something we've seen a lot of recently with games like Straded Deep and Ark).  
What sets this one apart from the rest is the variety of biomes you will come across as well as the types of beasts out there to hunt or tame.

Overall, I'd say if you're a fan of the survival/crafting genre, then this one is well worth the low price.

[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=O1X_kzYqo2Y]Here's my full review[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197990747831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1880, 'last_played': 1657372994}
review:
Worth the 8 bucks I'd say! It's a pretty fun game and pretty relaxing.
At night it can get pretty scary though because of the goblins. 
Sometimes i rains sometimes its foggy but in the end at least you are alive.
When you die you lose a couple random items in your inventory.
You can catch animals and feed them to gain eggs so you can cook eggs and eat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018904143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1489959736}
review:
So after 1 hour of playing i quite enjoy this little game and im excited what there is to craft and build. Exploring the island is also really nice. I like the style of the graphics very much, its not high end but it sure does look nice and fits the setting. 

So far a recommendation, especially for this price. I dont know how many hours one can get out of this, but even after my first hour id say its worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978239304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1283, 'last_played': 1535535568}
review:
Promising little game with a lots of detail and a pretty good crafting system.

Usability and controls could use some improvements at the time of writing but those are mostly minor things. Aside from that: It just got released, I've played it for a few hours and haven't encountered any bugs. That alone is noteworthy :)


I'm curious where this is headed, I guess it will recieve some updates and improvements in the future but it is pretty fun to play already and the price is more than reasonable.
